Title: Articles of Impeachment Filed Against Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
A total of 12 articles of impeachment have officially been filed against Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine over abuse of power during the Chinese coronavirus pandemic.

Ohio State Rep. John Becker (R) was joined by Representatives Candice Keller (R), Nino Vitale (R), and Paul Zeltwanger (R) in filing articles of impeachment against Governor DeWine, according to a report by Cleveland 19 News.

The representatives argue that DeWine has abused his power during the pandemic, noting that the governor vetoed Senate Bill 55 ‚Äî and threatened to veto other General Assembly legislation, including Senate Bill 311 ‚Äî which seeks to severely limit the governor‚Äôs power during a pandemic.

‚ÄúGovernor DeWine‚Äôs mismanagement, malfeasance, misfeasance, abuse of power, and other crimes include, but are not limited to, meddling in the conduct of a presidential primary election, arbitrarily closing and placing curfews on certain businesses, while allowing other businesses to remain open,‚Äù said Rep. Becker‚Äôs office in a statement.

‚ÄúHe weaponized the Ohio Bureau of Workers‚Äô Compensation to bully and harass businesses and the people; to enforce a statewide mask mandate and other controversial measures of dubious ‚Äòvalue,‚Äô making Ohio a hostile work environment,‚Äù the statement added.

The statement goes on to cite the governor‚Äôs inclusion of places of worship during shutdown orders, as well as the implementation a statewide mask mandate, which has been in effect in one way or another since the summer.

‚ÄúRather than hearing the cries of Ohioans, Governor DeWine continues to stifle those cries by finding more inventive ways to use masks to muffle the voices of the people,‚Äù said Rep. Becker in his statement.

‚ÄúHe continues to have callous disregard for the fact that his isolation policies have led to a shockingly high number of suicides, alarming rates of drug abuse, persistently high unemployment, and the forced abandonment of the elderly by their loved ones,‚Äù the representative added.

Becker first announced his decision to file articles of impeachment against DeWine in August, citing the same issues.

According to Ohio‚Äôs Constitution, the State House of Representatives has the sole power of impeachment, but a majority of members are needed in order for impeachment to concur. It would then go to the State Senate, with a two-thirds vote needed to convict a governor of impeachment.

You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Facebook and Twitter at @ARmastrangelo, on Parler at @alana, and on Instagram.

Title: FNC‚Äôs Makary: FDA Should Be Able to Turn Vaccine Applications Around in 24 Hours, They‚Äôre ‚ÄòToo Bureaucratic‚Äô and Slow
Author: ['Ian Hanchett']
Text:
On Monday‚Äôs broadcast of the Fox News Channel‚Äôs ‚ÄúBill Hemmer Reports,‚Äù Fox News Medical Contributor Dr. Marty Makary stated that the FDA is ‚Äútoo bureaucratic, taking too much time‚Äù on the coronavirus vaccine and they should be able to turn around applications for authorization for the vaccine in 24 hours.

Makary said, ‚ÄúThe review committee is not interviewing subjects and volunteers. They‚Äôre not looking under a microscope at the cells or the virus. They are simply reading a piece of paper with the numbers. We have an internet now, they can get those numbers in real-time. Europe does a rolling review and they turn things around quicker. Britain is slated to get the vaccine in arms before the United States, same vaccine. The FDA has been too bureaucratic, taking too much time, and I don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôre scheduling around vacation times and tee times of the reviewers, but they should turn the application around in 24 hours.‚Äù

Follow Ian Hanchett on Twitter @IanHanchett

Title: Gavin Newsom Threatens ‚ÄòDrastic Actions,‚Äô Including Stay-at-Home Order
Author: ['Joel B. Pollak']
Text:
California Gov. Gavin Newsom said Monday that ‚Äúdrastic actions‚Äù such as a new stay-at-home order might be necessary to slow the spread of coronavirus in the state.

Newsom said that the state had reached a ‚Äútipping point,‚Äù and that with the continued increase in hospitalizations due to the disease, the state could run out of hospital beds by Christmas.

This is the tipping point. CA has worked hard to prepare for a surge‚Äîbut we can‚Äôt sustain the record high cases we‚Äôre seeing. Current projections show CA will run out of current ICU beds before Christmas Eve. Please stay safe & stay home as much as you can for next few weeks. pic.twitter.com/5NJYzHokhE ‚Äî Gavin Newsom (@GavinNewsom) November 30, 2020

The Los Angeles Times reported:

Of particular concern is the state‚Äôs intensive care capacity. Currently, about 75% of the state‚Äôs 7,733 ICU beds are occupied ‚Äî with 1,812 of them filled by coronavirus patients. Unless things change, the state could exhaust its existing ICU capacity by mid-December, according to projections Newsom presented. ‚ÄúIf these trends continue, we‚Äôre going to have to take much more dramatic ‚Äî arguably drastic ‚Äî actions,‚Äù he said during a briefing. Those include ‚Äúthe potential for a stay-at-home order‚Äù for areas in the strictest purple tier of California‚Äôs coronavirus reopening road map, he said. Of the state‚Äôs 58 counties, 51 are in the purple tier.

The state‚Äôs ‚Äúpurple tier‚Äù counties are already under a month-long, 10 p.m.-to-5 a.m. curfew.

State and local officials are particularly worried about coronavirus spikes over the holidays. In Los Angeles County, officials have prohibited outdoor dining at restaurants and imposed new restrictions on business capacity.

In more positive news, Newsom tweeted that California will receive 327,000 doses of Pfizer‚Äôs coronavirus vaccine by mid-December.

Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News and the host of Breitbart News Sunday on Sirius XM Patriot on Sunday evenings from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. ET (4 p.m. to 7 p.m. PT). His newest e-book is The Trumpian Virtues: The Lessons and Legacy of Donald Trump‚Äôs Presidency. His recent book, RED NOVEMBER, tells the story of the 2020 Democratic presidential primary from a conservative perspective. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

Title: Ravens-Steelers Rescheduled Again by COVID-19 to Wednesday
Text:
The Baltimore Ravens‚Äô struggle to contain an extended outbreak of the coronavirus forced their rescheduled game Tuesday night against the unbeaten Pittsburgh Steelers to be moved back to Wednesday.

It‚Äôs the third fix to a matchup originally slated to be played Thanksgiving night.

The NFL announced the most recent switch Monday after the Ravens placed starters Matthew Judon, Willie Snead and Mark Andrews on the reserve/COVID-19 list.

Although Baltimore also had four players return from that list, the team will still be severely short-handed when this game is finally played.

The addition of Judon, a standout linebacker, and Andrews, the leading receiver on the team, brings to seven the number of 2019 Pro Bowl players that Baltimore has placed on the COVID-19 list over the past week.

Cornerback Terrell Bonds, who‚Äôs on injured reserve, was also added to the expansive list Monday.

There was a bit of good news, however: Baltimore activated linebacker Jayson Ferguson, offensive lineman D.J. Fluker and defensive tackle Broderick Washington from the COVID-19 list. Defensive back Iman Marshall was also activated, although he‚Äôs been on IR since tearing his right ACL in August.

The contest pitting two longtime rivals was originally scheduled for Thanksgiving night before a rash of coronavirus cases among the Ravens forced the game to be postponed to Sunday. As Baltimore continued to stack up positive tests, the game was moved back to Tuesday night.

Now, perhaps, they‚Äôll finally meet on Wednesday in Pittsburgh. Or not.

The Ravens (6-4) will face the Steelers without several of their top playmakers, including quarterback Lamar Jackson, running backs Mark Ingram and J.K. Dobbins, and defensive linemen Calais Campbell and Brandon Williams.

The loss of Andrews and Snead will further hinder backup quarterback Robert Griffin III, who will be taking snaps from a third-string center after Patrick Mekari and Matt Skura were placed on the COVID-19 list on Wednesday.

Andrews is a Type-1 diabetic, which makes COVID-19 potentially more dangerous. His loss should have an impact in that he leads Baltimore in receptions (38), yards receiving (454) and touchdown catches (6).

Andrews, Judon, Jackson, Ingram, Campbell, fullback Patrick Ricard and long snapper Morgan Cox were all selected to the Pro Bowl last season. Jackson, of course, was the NFL‚Äôs MVP in 2019.

Judon owns Baltimore‚Äôs franchise tag. He is tied for the team lead with four sacks and has 34 tackles.

Snead has 17 catches for 230 yards and two touchdowns over the past four games.

The NFL‚Äôs last Wednesday game was the 2012 season opener between the Giants and the Cowboys, which was moved from a Thursday night because of a conflict with the Democratic National Convention, which was scheduled to have President Barack Obama speak on Thursday night.

‚ÄúWe understand that every team is going through something like this,‚Äù Steelers defensive end Cam Heyward said. ‚ÄúNot to this extent, but we have to be ready for any situation. I think (coach Mike Tomlin) has laid out the plan. It‚Äôs up for us to follow it and it‚Äôs up for us to bounce back with it.‚Äù

Added Steelers tackle Zach Banner, who was injured in the season opener: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna be healthy by the time we play this game.‚Äù

Still to be decided is when the scheduled Week 13 game between the Steelers and Washington will be played. It is currently set for Sunday at Heinz Field. Baltimore is supposed to host Dallas on Dec. 7.

Title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis Says School Must Remain Open
Author: ['Joshua Caplan']
Text:
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) on Monday said that schools are required to remain open for in-person learning in the spring as the state continues to battle the coronavirus.

WEAR-TV reports:

[The schools] will also continue to offer virtual options, although there will be stricter monitoring requirements in virtual classes. When it comes to virtual classes, the new rules will require parents to be notified if the student is struggling with virtual learning. Transitions to in-person learning may then be made, unless a parent objects.

‚ÄúClosing schools due to coronavirus is probably the biggest blunder in modern American history,‚Äù DeSantis told reporters.

‚ÄúPeople who advocate closing schools for virus mitigation are effectively today‚Äôs flat-Earthers, they have no scientific or evidence support for their position,‚Äù he added.

Florida is experiencing a rise in coronavirus cases with 990,000 confirmed infections since the pandemic started.

DeSantis‚Äôs comments come after the governor extended his order barring local governments from imposing mask mandates.

‚ÄúJust as an act of executive grace, all outstanding fines and penalties that have been applied against individuals are suspended,‚Äù DeSantis said last week.

‚ÄúI think we need to get away from trying to penalize people for not social distancing and work with people constructively,‚Äù he added.

Title: 49ers to Play 2 Upcoming Home Games in Arizona
Text:
The San Francisco 49ers will play two home games in Arizona after new coronavirus regulations put in place by officials in Northern California forced the team to find a temporary new home.

The 49ers (5-6) will host the Buffalo Bills next Monday night and Washington on Dec. 13 at State Farm Stadium, home of the Arizona Cardinals, because they won‚Äôt be able to practice or play games in their home in Santa Clara County for three weeks.

The team said it will have information on practice arrangements later but it will likely need to look outside the area because the rules imposed by Santa Clara County will require the players to quarantine for 14 days any time they travel more than 150 miles.

Niners CEO Jed York said the team had offers from San Diego and Arizona but playing at the Cardinals‚Äô home proved to be the best option. He thanked Cardinals owner Michael Bidwell and the officials in Arizona for their help in ‚Äúthese unprecedented times.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Cardinals organization, State Farm Stadium and League officials have been supportive and accommodating as we work through the many logistical issues involved in relocating NFL games,‚Äù the 49ers said in a statement.

Santa Clara County announced rules Saturday that include a three-week ban on practices and games for contact sports starting Monday. The Niners were on a plane getting ready to travel to Los Angeles, where they beat the Rams 23-20 on Sunday, when the players and coaches heard about the rules.

Now they will likely head on an even longer road trip while trying to make a late-season playoff run. San Francisco is currently one game out of a playoff spot.

‚ÄúThe biggest thing for me is us all leaving our families,‚Äù coach Kyle Shanahan said after the game. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all human just like everyone else. It‚Äôs a big deal to leave your family for the whole month of December. A huge deal, as everyone knows. This virus is a huge deal.‚Äù

Shanahan said it was ‚Äúextremely disappointing‚Äù the players and coaches learned about the new rules on social media as they were on the plane.

The county said the dramatic rise in cases required ‚Äúquick action‚Äù and that the priority was making sure there is enough hospital space to deal with the coronavirus and any other health issues.

‚ÄúThe 49ers are one of the thousands of organizations impacted by our most recent actions,‚Äù the county said in a statement. ‚ÄúThe County of Santa Clara has been in regular communication with the 49ers both before and after the announcement of the revised mandatory directive affecting all contact sports. We continue to do everything we can to support the 49ers, as well as all local businesses, affected communities, and families impacted by the pandemic.‚Äù

The Niners have road games scheduled at Dallas on Dec. 20 and then again on Dec. 26 at their temporary home in Arizona against the Cardinals.

They finish the season with a home game against Seattle on Jan. 3, which could be played at Levi‚Äôs Stadium if the ban is lifted as scheduled Dec. 21.

‚ÄúWe just got to have that open mind and positive attitude and make sure that first and foremost that everybody‚Äôs safe,‚Äù said running back Raheem Mostert, whose wife gave birth to the couple‚Äôs second child during the season back home in the Cleveland area. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the main goal.‚Äù

The AFC East-leading Bills (8-3) return to Arizona for the second time in a little over three weeks, following a heartbreaking 32-30 loss to the Cardinals. The game was decided by DeAndre Hopkins‚Äô leaping catch of Kyler Murray‚Äôs 43-yard touchdown pass with two seconds left.

The catch was immediately dubbed the ‚ÄúHail Murray,‚Äù and came 32 seconds after Buffalo pulled ahead on Stefon Diggs‚Äô 21-yard touchdown reception. Buffalo squandered a 23-9 lead before heading into its bye week.

The Bills are coming off a 27-17 win over the Los Angeles Chargers.

The rules also will impact the San Jose Sharks of the NHL and college teams at Stanford and San Jose State.

There is no start date yet for NHL training camp but some Sharks players have been taking part in voluntary rehabilitation and training in a socially distanced setting at the team‚Äôs facility in San Jose. The team said those will have to be modified to comply with the health order.

‚ÄúWe are reviewing what options may be available locally to allow these players to receive rehabilitation treatment and continue their training for the upcoming season,‚Äù the team said in a statement.

Title: Andrew Cuomo Tells Hospitals to Recruit Retired Doctors 'NOW'
Author: ['Amy Furr']
Text:
New York is preparing to recruit retired doctors and nurses to staff hospitals dealing with a surge in coronavirus cases, Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D) said Monday.

The governor called it a ‚Äúnew phase in the war against COVID [Chinese coronavirus],‚Äù according to the New York Post, adding that daily hospitalizations across the state are almost quadruple what they were in June.

Cuomo said every hospital in New York must compile a list of retired doctors and nurses they can call on because of staffing problems in some areas.

‚ÄúI am very worried about staff shortages. I‚Äôm more concerned about the staff shortage than I am the [number of hospital] beds. We can build beds. We can‚Äôt create more staff. And the staff is starting tired,‚Äù he explained.

In a tweet Monday morning, the governor shared an infographic titled Initiate Emergency Hospital Procedures, with the first point reading, ‚ÄúStaff shortage: identify retired nurses and doctors NOW‚Äù:

We are laser-focused on ensuring enough hospital capacity as COVID surges. Today @HealthNYGov is initiating emergency hospital measures. Hospitals are directed to identify retired staff, make plans to add 50% bed capacity, confirm they have a 90-day PPE stockpile, and more. pic.twitter.com/6XzF4jXFxY ‚Äî Andrew Cuomo (@NYGovCuomo) November 30, 2020

In a subsequent post, Cuomo told residents to stop attending small gatherings immediately.

‚ÄúHospitalizations are climbing ‚Äî statewide. What can you do? Cut out the small gatherings. Now. 65% of all cases are traced to small gatherings. Gov‚Äôt can‚Äôt enforce who‚Äôs in your living room. But you can,‚Äù he wrote.

As his state prepares to go into another lockdown that could put thousands out of work, Cuomo accepted his International Emmy Award last week by claiming victory and saying his press conferences offered ‚Äúauthentic truth and stability,‚Äù according to Breitbart News.

‚ÄúIn what became a Cuomo love-in for the so-called ‚ÄòLove Gov,‚Äô a chorus of celebrities joined in to sing the governor‚Äôs praises,‚Äù the report continued:

Absent from the ceremony was any mention of Gov. Cuomo‚Äôs March directive ordering New York nursing homes to accept COVID-19 patients, which caused the virus to spread like wild fire among that state‚Äôs elderly and infirm population. His decision contributed to the state‚Äôs COVID-19 mortality rate, which currently ranks as the second highest in the nation.

‚ÄúCuomo‚Äôs nursing home mandate reportedly led to 6,000 nursing home deaths from the coronavirus,‚Äù the article read.

Title: El Paso Mayor Attributes Coronavirus Spike to Shopping at Large Retailers
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
El Paso Mayor Dee Margo (R) is attributing the recent spike in cases of the Chinese coronavirus to individuals shopping at large retailers during a Sunday appearance on CBS News‚Äôs Face the Nation.

On Monday, the City of El Paso, Texas, reported 461 new cases of the Wuhan virus, bringing the cumulative total to 86,172 cases:

To date, 47,397 residents have recovered from the virus and 37,267 cases remain active. For more information and other data visit https://t.co/ZQYzXomtTr ‚Äî City of El Paso (@ElPasoTXGov) November 30, 2020

On Sunday, the city‚Äôs mayor attributed the spike in cases to people experiencing ‚ÄúCOVID fatigue.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe hit, oh, about almost six weeks ago, we started spiking significantly. I think people just‚Äî the consensus is people just had COVID fatigue and they let down, as Dr. Birx said, you got to wear the mask and you‚Äôve got to maintain the distancing and you‚Äôve got to avoid the crowds,‚Äù he said, detailing the ‚Äúdeep dive‚Äù officials conducted into their contact tracing for the week spanning November 10 through November 16.

The investigation found that ‚Äú55 percent of the positives were coming from shopping at large retailers, what we‚Äôd term as the big box stores,‚Äù according to the mayor:

And those are considered essential under CISA guidelines under homeland security. And we don‚Äôt really have- I don‚Äôt have any control over any limitations there. We‚Äôve asked for voluntary limitations and Wal-Mart and several others are starting to meter, meaning they‚Äôre going to limit the occupancy of their- of their stores, which we think- we also dug up the fact that previously our- over 52 percent of our positives were coming in the ages of 20 to 39. Now it‚Äôs 30 to 50. So we‚Äôre just trying to maintain, but recently, and I‚Äôm- I‚Äôm fearful to even mention it, we‚Äôve started to seem like we‚Äôre starting to maybe plateau. On Thanksgiving Day, we had 406 positives. The next day was 678.

CBS News‚Äôs Margaret Brennan asked Margo what other action he could take in light of the fact that big box retail stores, which officials say are contributing to the spread of the virus, are considered essential.

‚ÄúI know you just said that you can‚Äôt shut down big box stores because they‚Äôre deemed essential,‚Äù Brennan said.

‚ÄúBut at a certain point, because of what you‚Äôre talking about, if people aren‚Äôt taking personal responsibility for themselves and their own behavior, do you as mayor need to shut down what businesses you can?‚Äù she asked.

The mayor explained that he ‚Äútook action‚Äù to close down restaurant bars at 9 p.m., but Brennan noted that restaurants, as well as other stores, remain open.

‚ÄúWe were seeing a lot of congregating there. And so we shut them down at 9:00 p.m. for in-dining,‚Äù the mayor said.

‚ÄúThe state of Texas allowed bars to convert to restaurants with food trucks, kind of a ‚Äî some of them were kind of gaming the system, we think, and there was a lot of congregation there,‚Äù he continued, switching focus to private gatherings:

But, you know, when we look at the Rio Grande Valley and Hidalgo County, which went through a spike just before ours, we talked to their health department. What they discovered in their contact tracing was the majority of their positives were coming from- from home gatherings. And that‚Äôs- that‚Äôs also still problematic here. I mean, we‚Äôre- we‚Äôre a multigenerational community and family is big‚Äì and there‚Äôs travel to Mexico. There‚Äôs also those issues.

Similarly, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D) has also placed an emphasis on private gatherings, reporting that 65 percent of all cases are traced to gatherings of that nature.

‚ÄúThis is where the spread is coming from. It‚Äôs a small gathering spread. We have to communicate this now to people the way we communicated masks,‚Äù he said during Monday‚Äôs press conference.

‚ÄúSeemingly the safest place ‚Äî my home my table my family. Yeah, even that place is not safe,‚Äù he added.

El Paso made headlines earlier this month over the mobilization of the Texas National Guard, which was tasked with ‚Äúsupport[ing] the moratory affairs in the region‚Äù:

2/ The Texas Military will provide us with the critical personnel to carry out our fatality management plan and we are very grateful to them for their ongoing support. #ElPasoTX ‚Äî Mayor Dee Margo (@mayor_margo) November 21, 2020

El Paso County is reportedly moving mobile morgues to a ‚Äúcentral morgue facility,‚Äù according to ABC7.

Title: Greta Thunberg Tells Black Friday Shoppers: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt Buy Stuff You Don‚Äôt Need‚Äô
Author: ['Amy Furr']
Text:
Teenage climate change activist Greta Thunberg urged consumers to avoid buying things they do not need on Black Friday.

‚ÄúSchool strike week 119. Today is black Friday. Overconsumption is wrecking present and future living conditions and the planet itself. Don‚Äôt buy stuff you don‚Äôt need,‚Äù she wrote on Twitter:

School strike week 119. Today is black Friday. Overconsumption is wrecking present and future living conditions and the planet itself.

Don‚Äôt buy stuff you don‚Äôt need.#ClimateStrikeOnline #fridaysforfuture #schoolstrike4climate #flattenthecurve #FaceTheClimateEmergency pic.twitter.com/rMr02n0vwT ‚Äî Greta Thunberg (@GretaThunberg) November 27, 2020

While many of Thunberg‚Äôs followers agreed with her, others did not.

‚ÄúI hate to do this, but I NEED a PS5,‚Äù one user commented.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt take orders from clueless adolescents,‚Äù another person said.

Despite Thunberg‚Äôs warnings, consumer spending has been strong since the economy began reopening amid the coronavirus pandemic, writes Breitbart News‚Äôs John Carney:

Many consumers are feeling flush, their wealth boosted by a stock market that has pushed the S&P 500 up 65 percent since the lockdown low in March and soaring home values. Money not spent on trips, sports games, movies, or eating out has apparently gone into the purchase of consumer goods and contributed to savings accounts of many households.

‚ÄúBlack Friday was traditionally the day when many retailers first turned a profit for the year,‚Äù Carney noted.

However, those promoting Black Friday sales appeared not to draw the same size crowds this year as in previous years.

‚ÄúWhile the hustle and bustle of the holiday season has not completely disappeared, it is demonstratively lower this year due to fears, protocols, and limitations caused by the Chinese coronavirus pandemic,‚Äù Breitbart News reported.

Photos and video footage shared online showed small crowds and a few relatively empty parking lots:

A very short line outside of Best Buy on Camelback near 16th Street in Phoenix on this Black Friday. Years past the line was hundreds of yards long. pic.twitter.com/MY5nGIOZUd ‚Äî Jim Cross (@Crossfire923) November 27, 2020

There‚Äôs actually a line forming at Old Navy now. Still no where near what we normally see on Black Friday, but it‚Äôs picking up a tad. pic.twitter.com/JgQD4xHz8l ‚Äî Kristi O'Connor WBTV (@KristiOConnor_) November 27, 2020

Fortune magazine senior writer Phil Wahba called New Jersey‚Äôs Newport Centre mall a ‚Äúghost town‚Äù:

Newport Centre, a major mall in a major metro area is a ghost town. I saw not a single shopper at sears (well‚Ä¶), very few at Kohl‚Äôs or JCP or clothing stores. Only semi busy store was Bath & Body Works. This feels more like an average Tuesday in April than #blackfriday2020 pic.twitter.com/jnhUS4fLsi ‚Äî Phil Wahba (@philwahba) November 27, 2020

In another tweet on Friday, Thunberg claimed, ‚ÄúThe climate- and ecological crisis will only worsen by encouraging people to buy things they don‚Äôt need‚Äù:

We appreciate the effort, but we in #FridaysForFuture don‚Äôt wish to be linked to anything commercial.

Nor do we wish to gain from overconsumption.

The climate- and ecological crisis will only worsen by encouraging people to buy things they don‚Äôt need.

1/2 https://t.co/UqyWmZbs7W ‚Äî Greta Thunberg (@GretaThunberg) November 27, 2020

She then urged her followers to donate to organizations and funds ‚Äúsupporting people in the most affected areas suffering from the climate- and ecological crisis.‚Äù

Title: Bar Files to Register as Church to Avoid Coronavirus Lockdown Rules
Author: ['Dr. Susan Berry']
Text:
A U.K. tequila bar owner has filed an application to register his business as a church to avoid coronavirus lockdown rules.

In a Facebook post on Friday, James Aspell wrote (language warning) he is changing the name of his Nottingham bar, now called ‚Äú400 Rabbits Tequila and Mezcal Cocktail Bar,‚Äù as ‚ÄúThe Church of the 400 Rabbits.‚Äù

‚ÄúWith places of worship allowed to open in all tiers we thought fuck it lets start a religion!‚Äù he announced. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt be that hard can it! ‚ÄòThe Church of the 400 Rabbits‚Äô launching as soon as we get the green light!‚Äù

‚ÄúCongregation daily til late,‚Äù Aspell added. ‚ÄúMore deets coming soon!‚Äù

‚ÄúThe intention of this is to be a joke, but it comes from a serious place, ‚ÄúAspell, 34, told Nottinghamshire Live. ‚ÄúWith the new restrictions we‚Äôre forced to close and it could be months before we can reopen. We don‚Äôt have a food offering, so even if we were in Tier 2, we couldn‚Äôt open.‚Äù

Aspell added that during the lockdown, his business has been ‚Äútargeted unfairly to an extent and it seems wrong.‚Äù

‚ÄúEverything from gyms to massage parlours can stay open and even the Christmas markets are happening ‚Äì that was the point when I thought, this is ridiculous,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúSo, we have sent in an application to register as a place of worship.‚Äù

Aspell, who has owned the bar for five years, said his application ‚Äúpoints out the hypocrisy‚Äù of the coronavirus restrictions.

‚ÄúIf we were to open, we‚Äôd follow government guidelines and I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôd be selling alcohol,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe might be able to adapt in a different way and have some fun with it.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not doing this to offend anybody or break any rules,‚Äù he added.

Title: Cuomo Scolds New Yorkers for Private Gatherings: 'This Is Not Government Being Overly Dramatic'
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D) scolded New Yorkers for gathering with friends and families in the comfort of their private homes, identifying such gatherings as contributing to the spread of the Chinese coronavirus and defending his order limiting gatherings to no more than ten people in private homes. He also floated volunteering to assist coronavirus patients in a hospital as an alternative to private Thanksgiving gatherings, though he failed to explain how that was safer.

‚ÄúThis is a dramatic shift,‚Äù Cuomo said during Monday‚Äôs press conference, referencing the spike in cases caused by small gatherings:

Hospitalizations are climbing ‚Äî statewide. What can you do? Cut out the small gatherings. Now. 65% of all cases are traced to small gatherings. Gov't can't enforce who's in your living room. But you can. ‚Äî Andrew Cuomo (@NYGovCuomo) November 30, 2020

While he acknowledged that part of it is the nature of the holiday season, he also said people are gravitating toward small gatherings due to ‚Äúreduced social options.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt go to the bar and hang out. I can‚Äôt go to a restaurant and hang out. I can‚Äôt go to the movie theater and hang out. Come over to my house, and we‚Äôll hang out. It‚Äôs just an adaptation of social behavior to the circumstance,‚Äù Cuomo said.

‚ÄúWe have a rule in effect, no more than ten at an event,‚Äù Cuomo said, defending his mandate by pointing to other states that have similar rules in effect.

‚ÄúPeople say, ‚ÄòOh I can‚Äôt believe the New York rule, no more than ten.‚Äô Many states have a rule of no more than ten,‚Äù he said, adding that Kentucky is instituting a rule of no more than eight.

While Cuomo has publicly asked local governments to enforce his edicts, he admitted that the government does not have the ability to monitor the number of people an individual invites into his or her dwelling.

He continued:

This is a nationwide problem. I understand the people say I don‚Äôt like the restrictions. ‚ÄúI have COVID fatigue. How can you say I shouldn‚Äôt have more than ten people in my house?‚Äù Look. The truth is the government doesn‚Äôt have an ability to monitor it. But you want to know what is smart, what is reasonable, what is protective of other people and yourself? This is where the spread is coming from. It‚Äôs a small gathering spread. We have to communicate this now to people the way we communicated masks. Seemingly the safest place ‚Äî my home, my table, my family. Yeah, even that place is not safe.

Because of that, Cuomo‚Äôs administration will roll out a new public education campaign focusing on small, private gatherings.

‚ÄúThis is not government being overly dramatic. These are just facts,‚Äù Cuomo continued, arguing that his emphasis on limiting private gatherings is supported by ‚ÄúPresident Trump‚Äôs people and Joe Biden‚Äôs people.‚Äù He also cited the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) guidelines, which advised Americans to gather with ‚Äúno more than your household‚Äù for Thanksgiving.

‚ÄúSo whose politics are you playing if Donald Trump says the CDC mandates it and Joe Biden‚Äôs advisers say it‚Äôs smart?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúWhose politics? Your own politics? You‚Äôre waving the political flag. Whose flag are you waving? It‚Äôs agreed to by both. It‚Äôs a fact of being smart, and luckily most of us are smart,‚Äù he continued.

The Democrat governor also used the opportunity to detail a conversation he had with a man over the weekend, who was purportedly incensed by Cuomo‚Äôs mandates, particularly his limit on gatherings in private homes.

‚ÄúNobody‚Äôs going to tell me how many people to have in my house. It‚Äôs my house. I want to have my family over I can have my family over,‚Äù Cuomo said, quoting the man.

‚ÄúI said alright. I‚Äôll make a deal with you right now. You do whatever you want in your house. Invite whoever you want. But here‚Äôs the deal. If somebody gets sick from what you did, you handle it,‚Äù Cuomo said, telling the man that he should not call an ambulance or go to the doctor and ‚Äúexpose‚Äù others because he ‚Äúwanted to be reckless‚Äù:

I said don‚Äôt call an ambulance and expose an ambulance driver. Don‚Äôt go to the hospital and expose a nurse and a doctor ‚Ä¶ because you wanted to be reckless. You handle it. Stay at home and take care of yourself. But don‚Äôt expose people, and don‚Äôt ask people to risk their lives because you undertook risky behavior. ‚ÄúOh no, no I won‚Äôt agree with that.‚Äù I said, ‚ÄúOh I see. You want to be able to behave in a risky way and then if you get sick, then other people have to risk their lives because you were risky.‚Äù Is that fair? But that‚Äôs what they‚Äôre asking.

‚ÄúYou want to be a tough guy ‚Ä¶ go volunteer in a field hospital in Staten Island and help COVID patients if you‚Äôre a tough guy,‚Äù Cuomo said, adding, ‚ÄúYou want to celebrate Thanksgiving? Bring your whole family and your extended family and go volunteer in a hospital and help COVID people.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs how you celebrate Thanksgiving. Don‚Äôt create more COVID-positive people and expect other people to come to your rescue. That‚Äôs not the spirit of Thanksgiving,‚Äù he added.

Cuomo did not explain how it was less risky to willingly expose an entire family to coronavirus patients in a hospital rather than gathering in a private residence with no known positive cases.

Title: Kim Jong-un ‚ÄòHarshly Criticizes‚Äô North Korea‚Äôs Economic Agencies
Author: ['Ben Kew']
Text:
‚ÄúIt stressed the need to put the operation and command for carrying out the Party‚Äôs economic policies on a scientific basis and display great dedication and responsibility,‚Äù reported the Korean Central News Agency (KNCA). ‚ÄúThe Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK discussed measures for important issues of carrying out immediate economic tasks for this year and adopted key decisions with unanimous approval.‚Äù

Kim‚Äôs raising of such concerns comes as the North Korean economy, which was already struggling under the weight of global economic sanctions, continues to suffer under the pressure of the Chinese coronavirus pandemic. Pyongyang‚Äôs own lockdowns have cut it off to much of the foreign capital it once relied on. Adding to these economic troubles has been the impact of consecutive summer typhoons believed to have devastated large swathes of the nation‚Äôs countryside.

His criticisms also follow unconfirmed reports last week that Kim has executed at least two officials in the past two months. Such reports, which cannot be independently verified, identified the two victims as a foreign exchange dealer accused of causing currency fluctuations and an official responsible for customs checks on the Chinese border.

In August, the 36-year-old dictator made a tearful admission that, despite incessant propaganda about his own unending wisdom and supernatural powers, North Korea‚Äôs economic progress has been ‚Äúseriously delayed‚Äù and the population continues to struggle as a result of ‚Äúunexpected and inevitable challenges in various aspects.‚Äù

‚ÄúOur people have placed trust, as high as sky and as deep as sea, on me, but I have failed to always live up to it satisfactorily. I am really sorry for that,‚Äù Kim declared before a military rally.

‚ÄúAlthough I am entrusted with the important responsibility to lead this country upholding the cause of the great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il thanks to the trust of all the people, my efforts and sincerity have not been sufficient enough to rid our people of the difficulties in their life,‚Äù he continued.

Follow Ben Kew on Parler, Facebook, or Twitter. You can email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

Title: Democrat Jon Ossoff Signals Support for Lockdowns: ‚ÄòIt's Time to Trust the Experts‚Äô
Author: ['Ashley Oliver']
Text:
Georgia Democrat Senate candidate Jon Ossoff said on CNN‚Äôs State of the Union on Sunday that he would support a statewide lockdown of businesses to address coronavirus spread if public health experts indicate a need for ‚Äústronger mitigation measures,‚Äù remarking that ‚Äúit‚Äôs time to trust the experts.‚Äù

Ossoff, who is challenging Republican Sen. David Perdue in Georgia‚Äôs race for U.S. Senate, told CNN host Dana Bash, ‚ÄúThe problem we‚Äôve had all year is that politicians have been suppressing and ignoring public health advice. It‚Äôs time to trust the experts, listen to public health professionals in a public health crisis.‚Äù

Bash said the White House Coronavirus Task Force has already indicated that ‚Äúthis is the moment to dramatically increase mitigation‚Äù due to a resurgence of the virus. Bash asked Ossoff, ‚ÄúSo would you support harsher restrictions in Georgia, like closing restaurants and businesses temporarily?‚Äù

The Georgia Democrat responded, ‚ÄúI think we should follow the expertise of public health experts like those of the CDC, which is based here in Georgia, and if that is the consensus of the public health community, we need to take that advice very seriously.‚Äù

Bash further pressed, ‚ÄúSo if they said, ‚ÄòShut things down temporarily,‚Äô you‚Äôd be all for it?‚Äù to which Ossoff replied, ‚ÄúIf the CDC and its leadership gave us strong indication that those kinds of stronger mitigation measures are necessary to save lives and contain the spread of the virus, it would be malpractice for politicians to ignore that advice.‚Äù

The Worldometer reports that Georgia currently has 162,886 active cases of the novel coronavirus, or 1.5 percent, of the state‚Äôs population of 10,617,423. At its peak, Georgia saw 6,209 new daily cases reported on November 21. Since then, new daily cases have substantially dropped, with the latest data showing 1,952 new daily cases reported on November 29.

Ossoff said the spread of the virus ‚Äúis out of control‚Äù and claimed people, including incumbent Perdue, have disregarded advice of public health experts. ‚ÄúThe problem is we‚Äôve ignored the public health experts, so I‚Äôll be listening to them and not to political consultants, pollsters, or folks looking out for their own financial interests, like my opponent.‚Äù

Perdue has advocated for a phased reopening of businesses and described the lockdown measures Ossoff supports as ‚Äúoverreaching‚Äù following Ossoff‚Äôs CNN interview:

If you think the overreaching lockdowns in states like New York and California are scary, know that Jon @Ossoff would support the very same policies ‚Äì for the entire country. pic.twitter.com/RADSX01uMO ‚Äî David Perdue (@Perduesenate) November 30, 2020

In the same interview, Bash also asked Ossoff about his recent endorsement from Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), a self-proclaimed democratic socialist, and whether Ossoff wants Sanders to campaign with him in the weeks leading up to the January 5 Senate runoff election. Ossoff said that while he has not had that conversation with Sanders, he welcomes Sanders‚Äô support.

Georgia GOP spokeswoman Abigail Sigler expressed concern after Ossoff‚Äôs television appearance that the Georgia Democrat‚Äôs support for lockdowns aligns with the socialist ideology‚Äôs tendency for government dependency.

‚ÄúOn January 5th, Georgians have a clear choice between socialism and freedom,‚Äù Sigler said. ‚ÄúJon Ossoff supports a national lockdown and seeks to keep the entire country shut inside until we are completely dependent on the federal government for everything. ‚Ä¶ We must reject Jon Ossoff and the radical Democrats‚Äô socialist agenda.‚Äù

Write to Ashley Oliver at aoliver@breitbart.com.

Title: Report: Over a Quarter of Small Businesses in New York and New Jersey Closed This Year
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
Over a quarter of small businesses in New York and New Jersey, areas hit hardest by the Chinese coronavirus pandemic, have not reopened this year, according to a report from a Harvard-run database.

The database, TrackTheRecovery.org, revealed that 27.8 percent of small businesses in New York have not reopened following the mass shutdowns that occurred in the state this year, as of November 16. Even more businesses remained closed in New Jersey ‚Äî 31.2 percent.

The New York Post reported:

The figures are in line with estimates from the New Jersey Business & Industry Association, which says 28 percent of the Garden State‚Äôs small businesses had shut up shop by the end of October, according to the Star Ledger newspaper. ‚Ä¶ More than half of small businesses in both states were forced to shut their doors in the spring at the height of the pandemic, with both hitting highs in mid-April ‚Äî 52.5 percent of New York businesses and 53.9 percent in the Garden States, the stats show.

The news comes as virus rates begin to spike, prompting Govs. Andrew Cuomo (D) and Phil Murphy (D) to reintroduce restrictions in their respective states.

Murphy, who was recently confronted after dining out with his maskless family after retightening restrictions in the Garden State, told Fox News Sunday that a statewide lockdown remains ‚Äúon the table.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt has to stay on the table. Gov. Hutchinson, I think, had a similar answer to that. You hate like heck to even have to consider that, and God willing, we won‚Äôt have to,‚Äù he said, calling for a ‚Äúbig federal stimulus,‚Äù which he believes will act as a ‚Äúlifeline‚Äù for small businesses.

‚ÄúThat would be a game-changer. Not just in their lives and in their prospects, but it gives us more degrees of freedom in terms of dealing with the virus. So it‚Äôs on the table in terms of a shutdown,‚Äù he continued.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt anticipate it, and I sure as heck don‚Äôt want to go that route but boy, federal stimulus would give us a lot more ammunition to do a lot more things right now,‚Äù Murphy added.

State and local governments across the country are also taking action as virus rates increase, preemptively closing businesses deemed nonessential and limiting capacity limitations at essential retailers, forming what has been dubbed ‚Äúmodern breadlines‚Äù in states such as New Mexico ahead of its recent two-week lockdown.

Title: 49ers Blindsided by County Rules that Make them Homeless
Text:
San Francisco coach Kyle Shanahan said the team was blindsided by new coronavirus regulations put in place by Santa Clara County officials that will force the 49ers to find a temporary new home for practice and games.

The county announced the new rules Saturday that include a three-week ban on practices and games for contact sports starting Monday. The Niners were on a plane getting ready to travel to Los Angeles where they beat the Rams 23-20 on Sunday when the players and coaches heard about the new rules that will force the team out of its homes.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been working with them as a partner, just trying to figure it out,‚Äù Shanahan said. ‚ÄúFor us to be heading out here yesterday and the relationship we have with them, for all of our players and coaches and everyone on that plane and our wives to find that out while we‚Äôre getting on a plane and no one to tell us. It was just extremely disappointing.‚Äù

A county spokeswoman didn‚Äôt immediately respond to a request for comment.

Along with banning contact sports, the new rules also require anyone who has traveled more than 150 miles from the county to quarantine for 14 days. The 49ers were set to return from the trip Sunday night just hours before the rules go into effect.

The 49ers will now need to find a new place to practice and to play games. They have two home games scheduled during this three-week stretch: Dec. 7 against Buffalo and Dec. 13 against Washington.

While there are options outside Santa Clara in the Bay Area, including the Raiders‚Äô old home at Oakland Coliseum, it appears more likely that the team will play its home games at an existing NFL stadium out of this market. The Arizona Cardinals and Dallas Cowboys have no home games scheduled on the same day as Niners home games the rest of the season.

‚ÄúThey made that decision and we‚Äôve got to deal with it,‚Äù Shanahan said. ‚ÄúBut to find that out through a tweet or a press conference where I have an entire plane coming up to me, I have all wives, everyone‚Äôs girlfriends, everyone‚Äôs family members, kids, saying that what they heard there. Are we going to be gone for the entire month of December? Are we going to be quarantined for 14 days when we get back? That‚Äôs all we could talk about for the last 18 hours because we got no answers from them. I was just very disappointed.‚Äù

The Niners have a few days to finalize their decision. With their next game not until a week from Monday, the team won‚Äôt start practicing until Thursday.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see what the future holds,‚Äù quarterback Nick Mullens said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs tough for us but it‚Äôs more tough for the families. We‚Äôll see what happens. We‚Äôll adjust and we‚Äôll be ready.‚Äù

The rules also will impact the San Jose Sharks of the NHL and college teams at Stanford and San Jose State.

Stanford and San Jose State also have several sports in season. The Cardinal have one scheduled home football game left on Dec. 12 against Oregon State and will need to find a place to practice out of the county this week.

The Spartans have home football games on Dec. 5 against Hawaii and Dec. 11 against Nevada. San Jose State practiced before the season a few hundred miles away at Humboldt State because of restrictions in Santa Clara County.

San Jose State officials planned to meet with county officials on Sunday to get more details and then will formulate a plan.

‚ÄúWe are in a fluid situation with our football and basketball teams since their seasons are in progress,‚Äù athletic director Marie Tuite said. ‚ÄúWe will make decisions on team practices and when and where our contests are being played in conjunction with university administration and the Mountain West.‚Äù

Stanford‚Äôs second-ranked women‚Äôs basketball team will not play its scheduled home game Monday against San Diego. The team is looking for a place to practice.

The NHL hasn‚Äôt announced a date for the start of training camp but the Sharks have said they would look into alternate sites if needed. Several Sharks players have been holding informal workouts at the team facility in small groups.

Title: Ted Cruz Hammers Alyssa Milano On Coronavirus Aid: ‚ÄòEvery Senate Dem Voted to Block Relief‚Äô
Author: ['Warner Todd Huston']
Text:
Sen. Ted Cruz (R, TX) called out leftist actress Alyssa Milano for her attack on Republican lawmakers blocking a recent coronavirus relief bill after she ignored months of Democrats blocking similar financial relief bills.

Alyssa Milano took to Twitter on Sunday to slap congressional Republicans for blocking a minimum wage hike and a coronavirus relief bill for working-class families. Milano posted her tweet as a reply to an earlier tweet by Sen. Cruz, in which he noted the statistics proving that the Democrats are now the party of the super-rich, coastal elites while the GOP has become the party of working class Americans.

This is hilarious. Why is the GOP blocking covid relief from working class families if it‚Äôs the party of working class? Or blocking the bill to raise minimum wage to 15 dollars an hour. Sit down. ‚Äî Alyssa Milano (@Alyssa_Milano) November 29, 2020

The Charmed star questioned Cruz‚Äô contention that the GOP is now the party of the working classes by noting that the GOP had blocked the coronavirus bill. ‚ÄúThis is hilarious. Why is the GOP blocking covid relief from working class families if it‚Äôs the party of working class? Or blocking the bill to raise minimum wage to 15 dollars an hour. Sit down,‚Äù Milnao tweeted on Sunday.

It is not exactly clear what bills Milano was speaking about but it is possible she was referring to the latest $15 Minimum Wage increase that died in the Senate. And she could be referring to Senate leader Mitch McConnell‚Äôs decision back in October to ignore Democrat Chuck Schumer‚Äôs attempt to force the upper chamber to discuss a second $2.2 trillion coronavirus relief bill.

Schumer wanted to debate his relief bill when Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett was being confirmed. It would have restored the $600-per-week federal unemployment boost and would have sent another $1,200 stimulus check to Americans.

But Senator Cruz quickly pushed back. The Texas Senator noted that Milano conveniently ignored the many months that Nancy Pelosi in the House and Chuck Schumer in the Senate blocked the GOP‚Äôs $500 billion coronavirus aid bill.

‚ÄúAlyssa, facts matter,‚Äù Cruz tweeted back to Milano. ‚ÄúDems have TWICE filibustered $500Bn in emergency COVID relief. EVERY SINGLE Senate Dem voted to block relief‚ÄîPelosi refuses even to talk‚Äîbc they believe maximizing economic pain helped Biden & it helps Dems in GA. & they trust the press to cover for them.‚Äù

Alyssa, facts matter. Dems have TWICE filibustered $500Bn in emergency COVID relief. EVERY SINGLE Senate Dem voted to block relief‚ÄîPelosi refuses even to talk‚Äîbc they believe maximizing economic pain helped Biden & it helps Dems in GA. & they trust the press to cover for them. https://t.co/vQBXmwiJRs ‚Äî Ted Cruz (@tedcruz) November 30, 2020

Follow Warner Todd Huston on Facebook at: facebook.com/Warner.Todd.Huston.

Title: Joy Behar: If Hillary Clinton Won, U.S. Would Not Be Number One in Coronavirus Cases, Deaths
Author: ['Pam Key']
Text:
Co-host Joy Behar said on Monday‚Äôs broadcast of ABC‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe View‚Äù that if Hillary Clinton had won the 2016 presidential election, the United States would not be ‚Äúnumber one in the world in COVID cases and COVID deaths.‚Äù

During a discussion on Joe Biden‚Äôs all-female communication team picks, Behar said, ‚ÄúI think Joe Biden is now demonstrating correctly that women can run things really well, and we‚Äôre all going to be a witness to it. He‚Äôs got Kamala Harris in the second position, you know, that‚Äôs the first time we‚Äôve seen that. Let the world see how well women can do when put in the spot when they can do the job.‚Äù

Co-host Sunny Hostin said, ‚ÄúJoy, to your point, we know that women leaders have done really well when it comes to the pandemic response, right? Think about Australia and New Zealand. They‚Äôre proven to be effective leaders time and time again. If you look at any study, and I mean Harvard has a tremendous amount of data on this, women have in comparison to men, I hate to say it, but it‚Äôs true, have more leadership skills when given the opportunity. Unfortunately, oftentimes we‚Äôre not.‚Äù

Behar said, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt we all believe at this point ‚Äî I know I do, if Hillary Clinton were president instead of Trump for the last four years, we would not have ‚Äî we would not be number one in the world in COVID cases and COVID deaths.‚Äù

She continued, ‚ÄúI just believe that. I don‚Äôt think Hillary would have lied to the American people. She would have been interviewed by Bob Woodward, and she would have said, this is a terrible thing, and we have to clamp down on it right away. I know she would have done that.‚Äù

Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

Title: Hundreds Gather to Protest Oregon Gym‚Äôs $90,000 Coronavirus Fine
Author: ['Katherine Rodriguez']
Text:
Hundreds of people gathered in an Oregon neighborhood to protest the $90,000 fine slapped on a local gym for defying Gov. Kate Brown‚Äôs coronavirus closure order.

Protesters gathered in front of a dark, grey house with a sign on the door warning trespassers to keep out, the Salem Statesman Journal reported.

The house is owned by a safety and health enforcement manager who worked for the Oregon Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

Organizers of the rally accused the manager of being the inspector who deemed Courthouse Club and Fitness to be unsafe.

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre in that house, we‚Äôre asking you to stand with the people ‚Ä¶ because if you don‚Äôt stand with us, we‚Äôre going to go through some real difficult times,‚Äù protest organizer Joey Gibson said.

Brown‚Äôs order made it a requirement for gyms and fitness centers, as well as other businesses, to close between November 18 and December 2 to respond to and stop the rising level of coronavirus cases.

Courthouse Club Fitness stated in a now-deleted post on its Facebook page that it would remain open and received a $90,000 fine just more than a week later.

State health officials said the fine was calculated from the citations of each of the four fitness clubs‚Äô facilities.

‚ÄúThe total penalty for each individual inspection is $22,500,‚Äù said Mark Peterson, acting spokesman for OSHA. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a willful penalty of $17,500 for being open to the public and a separate $5,000 penalty for violating the Red Warning Notices that we posted at each location late last week.‚Äù

The closures are expected to last until December 2, although Brown said ‚Äúextreme risk‚Äù counties with high coronavirus case numbers will face continued restrictions.

Title: Stacey Abrams Voter Registration Group Denies Impropriety
Author: ['Kyle Morris']
Text:
Brad Raffensperger, Georgia‚Äôs Republican Secretary of State, resurrected a tired and false claim against the New Georgia Project‚Äôs legitimate efforts to register eligible Georgians to participate in elections in a press conference held Monday morning, November 30th.

Nse Ufot, Executive Director of the New Georgia Project said:

As Georgians are turning out in record numbers to have their voices heard at the polls, the Secretary of State is resorting to desperate attempts to smear law-abiding organizations and scare eligible Georgians from registering to vote in critical upcoming elections. We will not be deterred. This attack on our organization comes at a time when people across the country have witnessed the strength of our program and the collective power of a new Georgia electorate that embraces a system of inclusivity and opportunity for all Georgians. The timing is not accidental.

The organization also stated that it will ‚Äúcontinue its mission to register eligible voters in advance of the December 7th deadline‚Äù in its efforts to make sure that Georgia residents ‚Äúhave their voices heard at the polls and freely and fairly cast their ballots for those who would represent them.‚Äù

Raffensperger announced earlier Monday that his office will launch an investigation into voting groups accused of encouraging non-Georgia residents to register to vote in the runoff elections, which are set to take place on January 5.

‚ÄúWe have opened an investigation into a group called America Votes, who is sending absentee ballot applications to people at addresses where they have not lived since 1994,‚Äù Raffensperger said during a press conference, adding:

Voting in Georgia when you are not a resident of Georgia is a felony, and encouraging college kids to commit felonies with no regard for what [it] might mean for them is despicable. These third-party groups have a responsibility to not encourage illegal voting. If they do so, they will be held responsible.

Other organizations set to face scrutiny from the investigation include America Votes, Operation New Voter Registration Georgia, and Vote Forward.

Last week, Abrams announced that 900,000 Georgians had requested a mail-in ballot for the runoff elections between Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) and her Democrat challenger Raphael Warnock, and another between Sen. David Perdue (R-GA) and his Democrat opponent Jon Ossoff.

Interestingly, the Washington Free Beacon reported that Warnock served as the CEO of The New Georgia Project until February of this year.

‚ÄúWarnock was listed as CEO of the New Georgia Project from 2017 until Feb. 21, 2020, according to the group‚Äôs corporate filings,‚Äù the report stated. ‚ÄúHe has been identified as the New Georgia Project‚Äôs chairman and spokesman in media reports and has said he organized voter mobilization drives for the group, including a push to register 80,000 new minority voters in 2014.‚Äù

Title: FNC‚Äôs Geraldo Rivera: Trump Must Stop Attacking Election Results ‚Äî ‚ÄòEnough Is Enough Now‚Äô
Author: ['Pam Key']
Text:
Fox News Channel‚Äôs Geraldo Rivera called on President Donald Trump to stop attacking the presidential election as fraudulent because it could cost the Republican Party the Georgia Senate races and control of the Senate during an appearance on Monday‚Äôs broadcast of ‚ÄúThe Story.‚Äù

Rivera said, ‚ÄúIf people lose faith in Georgia‚Äôs electoral system and not show up, then they will be gifting Democrats control of the United States Senate. The stakes are so very high. They are astronomical. You know, as a person who has been accused of giving the president too much of the benefit of the doubt, I can‚Äôt imagine why the Republican senators aren‚Äôt rallying around the Georgia Republicans ‚Äì the secretary of state and the governor there ‚Äì and saying that, ‚ÄòThe system in Georgia will work. You got to vote. Everything is at stake here.‚Äô Rather than attacking the system, not only in Georgia but nationwide, undermines faith in the system, discourages people.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúI think that the president is on the wrong course here. I think he has got to take a real gut check between now and Saturday. With all due respect, and you know I love the guy, but enough is enough now.‚Äù

He added, ‚ÄúThis is the job he has now as the head of the GOP, as the commander-in-chief of the country ‚Äì he‚Äôs gotta rally the voters in Georgia. Control of the Senate is in the balance now, and if he allows his personal, you know, annoyance with the secretary of state and Governor Kemp to rule, then I think it‚Äôs going to be a devastating loss for the Republican Party.‚Äù

Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

Title: Georgia Secretary of State Launches Probe into Voter Registration Groups
Author: ['Joshua Caplan']
Text:
Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger (R) announced Monday that his office will launch an investigation into voting groups accused of encouraging non-Georgia residents to register to vote in the state‚Äôs twin Senate runoff elections.

‚ÄúWe have opened an investigation into a group called America Votes, who is sending absentee ballot applications to people at addresses where they have not lived since 1994,‚Äù Raffensperger stated during a press conference.

‚ÄúVoting in Georgia when you are not a resident of Georgia is a felony, and encouraging college kids to commit felonies with no regard for what [it] might mean for them is despicable,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThese third-party groups have a responsibility to not encourage illegal voting. If they do so, they will be held responsible.‚Äù

The organizations set for state scrutiny include: America Votes, Operation New Voter Registration Georgia, The New Georgia Project, and Vote Forward.

America Votes claimed in a statement that it has not done anything illegal.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre pleased that so many Georgians have already applied to vote by mail this election and will continue our work to make sure every voice is heard in January,‚Äù the group told The Atlanta Journal-Constitution.

Georgia voting system manager Gabriel Sterling has said 940,000 Georgians have requested absentee ballots for the Jan. 5 Senate races with Republican Sens. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue against Democrat opponents Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff.

Editor‚Äôs Note: The photo accompanying this article is not of any individual associated with America Votes, Operation New Voter Registration Georgia, The New Georgia Project, or Vote Forward.. The image is illustrative rather than literal.

Title: Judge Orders GA County to Stop Software Update on Voting Machines
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
A U.S. district judge issued a federal court order to stop officials in Georgia from performing a software update that would ‚Äúwipe‚Äù or ‚Äúreset‚Äù Fulton County voting machines, according to the order, which was shared by attorney Lin Wood.

The attorney added that the order was later ‚Äúreversed‚Äù when a judge deemed Georgia counties to be in control of the voting machines.

‚ÄúTime to obey the law. Stop the destruction of evidence,‚Äù tweeted Wood at several Georgia officials on Sunday, sharing an image of the federal court order.

‚ÄúPlaintiffs contend that union county officials have advised that they are going to wipe or reset the voting machines of all data and bring the count back to zero on Monday, November 30,‚Äù the court order stated. It went on:

To the extent Plaintiffs seek a temporary restraining order to preserve the voting machines in the State of Georgia, and to prevent any wiping of data, their motion is granted. Defendants are ordered to maintain the status quo and are temporarily enjoined from wiping or resetting any voting machines in the State of Georgia until further order of the Court.

The order was signed by U.S. District Judge Timothy C. Batten on Sunday.

‚ÄúOur Republican recount monitors at the World Congress Center waited today for four hours while Fulton County elections officials ‚Äòupdated the software,'‚Äù tweeted the Chairman of the Georgia Republican Party, David Shafer.

‚ÄúThe explanation given to me ‚Äì ‚Äòjust the usual Fulton County incompetence‚Äô ‚Äì is completely unacceptable,‚Äù Shafer added.

Our Republican recount monitors at the World Congress Center waited today for four hours while Fulton County elections officials ‚Äúupdated the software.‚Äù The explanation given to me ‚Äì ‚Äújust the usual Fulton County incompetence‚Äù ‚Äì is completely unacceptable. ‚Äî David Shafer (@DavidShafer) November 29, 2020

‚ÄúThankfully [Lin Wood] this afternoon obtained an emergency federal court order prohibiting any ‚Äòwiping‚Äô or ‚Äòresetting‚Äô of the voting machines,‚Äù continued Shafer in a follow-up tweet.

Wood is the Georgia-based attorney most famous for successfully suing the media on behalf of Richard Jewell in the 90s, as well as on behalf of Covington Catholic High School student Nick Sandmann last year.

‚ÄúIt is outrageous that we cannot rely on Fulton County elections officials to do their jobs without unexplained four hour delays, interventions by private attorneys and federal court orders,‚Äù Shafer added.

It is outrageous that we cannot rely on Fulton County elections officials to do their jobs without unexplained four hour delays, interventions by private attorneys and federal court orders. ‚Äî David Shafer (@DavidShafer) November 29, 2020

The court order, however, was apparently rescinded, as Wood later announced in a follow-up tweet that a judge had reversed the federal order based on the Defendants‚Äô claim that Georgia counties control voting machines.

‚ÄúWhat??? Judge reversed order based on Defendants‚Äô claim that GA Counties control voting machines,‚Äù wrote Wood. ‚ÄúMachines are owned by State & [Georgia Secretary of State] administers state laws on elections.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy are GA officials determined to wipe these machines clean be resetting them?‚Äù the attorney inquired.

What??? Judge reversed order based on Defendants‚Äô claim that GA Counties control voting machines. Machines are owned by State & @GaSecofState administers state laws on elections. Why are GA officials determined to wipe these machines clean be resetting them? https://t.co/Oq0edTGfsl ‚Äî Lin Wood (@LLinWood) November 29, 2020

‚ÄúOn November 24, a litigation hold notice was served on Fulton County which demanded that all evidence related to voting machines be preserved,‚Äù explained Wood in another tweet.

‚ÄúScrubbing the machines or tampering with them in any manner should NOT be occurring,‚Äù he declared.

On November 24, a litigation hold notice was served on Fulton County which demanded that all evidence related to voting machines be preserved. Scrubbing the machines or tampering with them in any manner should NOT be occurring.https://t.co/gUDhD6KmNS ‚Äî Lin Wood (@LLinWood) November 29, 2020

Researchers have questioned the reliability of new voting machines that state and local officials have rushed to implement at their polling locations ahead of the 2020 presidential election ‚Äî machines which are used in all of Georgia‚Äôs counties.

All eyes are on Georgia, as the state is now ground zero for the battle for the balance of power in Washington, D.C.

Control of the U.S. Senate now hinges on the outcome of the two Senate runoff races this January. With the Senate majority leadership just a couple seats away, Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) recently declared, ‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change America.‚Äù

You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Facebook and Twitter at @ARmastrangelo, on Parler at @alana, and on Instagram.

Title: Exclusive ‚Äî Blackburn: ‚ÄòVital‚Äô that Georgians Reelect Loeffler, Perdue to Protect Senate ‚ÄòFirewall‚Äô Against Left
Author: ['Matthew Boyle']
Text:
Sen. Marsha Blackburn (R-TN) told Breitbart News exclusively that the upcoming U.S. Senate runoffs in Georgia on January 5 represent a ‚Äúclassic battle between freedom and socialism.‚Äù

Sens. David Perdue (R-GA) and Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) will face off against Democrats Jon Ossoff and Rev. Raphael Warnock respectively for both of Georgia‚Äôs U.S. Senate seats and potentially control of the majority in the U.S. Senate at stake. Republicans will definitely have at least 50 seats in the Senate next year, and Democrats will definitely have at least 48. If the Democrats were to take both of these seats, then the Senate would be tied at 50-50 and whoever the vice president of the United States is next year would cut the tie and determine the majority control in the Senate.

Since Democrat presidential candidate former Vice President Joe Biden currently leads in enough states to win the electoral college, that would probably be now-Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA)‚Äîhis running mate‚Äîshould challenges from President Donald Trump fail. If Trump were to succeed in his election challenges, then Vice President Mike Pence would cut ties in the Senate. But as it stands now, barring a miraculous legal challenge comeback by Trump, in a 50-50 Senate it would be Harris cutting ties and steering control of the upper chamber of Congress to the Democrat Party.

Blackburn argued in an appearance on Breitbart News Saturday on SiriusXM 125 the Patriot Channel that the Democrats would use victories in these Georgia Senate races if they got them to implement a radical leftist and socialist agenda.

‚ÄúWhat you have is a classic battle between freedom and socialism,‚Äù Blackburn said. ‚ÄúChuck Schumer has said, in his glee on Election Day, he said first we go ‚Äòtake‚Äô Georgia‚Äînot we go earn the vote, not we work in Georgia to win, but ‚Äòtake.‚Äô They are planning, the left is planning to ‚Äòtake‚Äô Georgia. Then Schumer said they will ‚Äòchange‚Äô America. The ‚Äòchange‚Äô they are planning for America is adding justices to the Supreme Court, changing the Supreme Court, giving statehood to D.C. Now, D.C. is not as big as Atlanta, but D.C. is going to be a state if the Democrats get their way. Statehood for Puerto Rico, and making sure they take health insurance away from 153 million Americans and 57 million Medicare enrollees and putting everyone into a Medicaid-style program that is run by the government. They want to implement the Green New Deal, and they want to give felons the right to vote‚Äîand that is the plan just for their first 100 days. This is what they are going to do if they are given the opportunity. Bear in mind what they plan to do is use Georgia and then force their will not only on Georgians but also on the American people.‚Äù

Blackburn urged all Republicans and Trump supporters to get out and vote for Perdue and Loeffler, saying it is ‚Äúvital‚Äù for them to do so since the ‚Äúleft is organized‚Äù in a systemic way to try to manufacture wins for Ossoff and Perdue.

‚ÄúIt is absolutely vital,‚Äù Blackburn said when asked how critical it is for Trump supporters to back Loeffler and Perdue. ‚ÄúThe left is organized because they cannot get by with implementing all the stuff they‚Äôre wanting to foist upon Americans unless they win Georgia. The Senate has been the firewall. They‚Äôre the ones that have blocked a lot of stuff. It is so important that we make certain that we carry these races in Georgia. I guarantee you I am going to be out there working every single day‚Äînight and day‚Äîto make certain that we win these races. You just think about the people who would be heading these various committees. Do you really want Bernie Sanders chairing the Senate Budget Committee? Do you really want somebody like Elizabeth Warren leading the Senate Armed Services Committee? Do you really want someone like Dick Durbin as chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee? Most Georgians would say no I‚Äôm not comfortable with that because these are individuals who are too far left for me. So the only thing that stands between that happening and not is for the people of Georgia to go elect Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue.‚Äù

Pence is headed back to Georgia on Friday, and Trump is heading there on Saturday, to campaign with Loeffler and Perdue. Several other top GOP stars have already been to the state and more are planning trips there over the next month.
