Title: Kemp Rejects Call to Strengthen GA Recount with Emergency Powers
Author: ['Joshua Caplan']
Text:
‚ÄúGeorgia law prohibits the governor from interfering in elections. The Secretary of State, who is an elected constitutional officer, has oversight over elections that cannot be overridden by executive order,‚Äù Cody Hall, a spokesperson for Kemp, said in a statement to The Atlanta Journal-Constitution. ‚ÄúAs the governor has said repeatedly, he will continue to follow the law and encourage the Secretary of State to take reasonable steps ‚Äì including a sample audit of signatures ‚Äì to restore trust and address serious issues that have been raised.‚Äù

Earlier Monday, President Trump criticized Kemp for failing to tackle the ‚Äúgoldmine of fraud‚Äù in the state‚Äôs presidential election by not signature matching mail-in ballots.‚ÄúWhy won‚Äôt Governor Brian Kemp, the hapless Governor of Georgia, use his emergency powers, which can be easily done, to overrule his obstinate Secretary of State, and do a match of signatures on envelopes,‚Äù the president tweeted in reference to Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger (R).

‚Ä¶.Also, quickly check the number of envelopes versus the number of ballots. You may just find that there are many more ballots than there are envelopes. So simple, and so easy to do. Georgia Republicans are angry, all Republicans are angry. Get it done! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) November 30, 2020

‚ÄúGeorgia Republicans are angry, all Republicans are angry. Get it done!‚Äù he added.

Raffensperger has said signatures matching is now impossible due to ballots being separated from their outer envelopes.

President Trump also suggested that the state‚Äôs election could have been plagued by other types of irregularities.

‚ÄúAlso, quickly check the number of envelopes versus the number of ballots,‚Äù he tweeted. ‚ÄúYou may just find that there are many more ballots than there are envelopes. So simple, and so easy to do.‚Äù

Shortly after President Trump‚Äôs comments, his campaign announced that it sent a fifth request to Raffensperger for a signature audit.

‚ÄúIt is not possible for you to accurately certify the results in the presidential race from the November 3, 2020, election until and unless there is a thorough audit of the signatures, which we have now requested four times in writing prior to this request. You cannot in good faith conclude the ongoing statutory recount until you have instituted a signature matching audit,‚Äù said Trump campaign lawyer Ray Smith.

‚ÄúUntil the signatures are matched, the vote count in Georgia is a complete fraud,‚Äù added former New York City Mayor and Trump attorney Rudy Giuliani. ‚ÄúThere is no way of knowing which ballots are honest and which ballots are fraudulent.‚Äù

Title: Democrat Jon Ossoff Signals Support for Lockdowns: ‚ÄòIt's Time to Trust the Experts‚Äô
Author: ['Ashley Oliver']
Text:
Georgia Democrat Senate candidate Jon Ossoff said on CNN‚Äôs State of the Union on Sunday that he would support a statewide lockdown of businesses to address coronavirus spread if public health experts indicate a need for ‚Äústronger mitigation measures,‚Äù remarking that ‚Äúit‚Äôs time to trust the experts.‚Äù

Ossoff, who is challenging Republican Sen. David Perdue in Georgia‚Äôs race for U.S. Senate, told CNN host Dana Bash, ‚ÄúThe problem we‚Äôve had all year is that politicians have been suppressing and ignoring public health advice. It‚Äôs time to trust the experts, listen to public health professionals in a public health crisis.‚Äù

Bash said the White House Coronavirus Task Force has already indicated that ‚Äúthis is the moment to dramatically increase mitigation‚Äù due to a resurgence of the virus. Bash asked Ossoff, ‚ÄúSo would you support harsher restrictions in Georgia, like closing restaurants and businesses temporarily?‚Äù

The Georgia Democrat responded, ‚ÄúI think we should follow the expertise of public health experts like those of the CDC, which is based here in Georgia, and if that is the consensus of the public health community, we need to take that advice very seriously.‚Äù

Bash further pressed, ‚ÄúSo if they said, ‚ÄòShut things down temporarily,‚Äô you‚Äôd be all for it?‚Äù to which Ossoff replied, ‚ÄúIf the CDC and its leadership gave us strong indication that those kinds of stronger mitigation measures are necessary to save lives and contain the spread of the virus, it would be malpractice for politicians to ignore that advice.‚Äù

The Worldometer reports that Georgia currently has 162,886 active cases of the novel coronavirus, or 1.5 percent, of the state‚Äôs population of 10,617,423. At its peak, Georgia saw 6,209 new daily cases reported on November 21. Since then, new daily cases have substantially dropped, with the latest data showing 1,952 new daily cases reported on November 29.

Ossoff said the spread of the virus ‚Äúis out of control‚Äù and claimed people, including incumbent Perdue, have disregarded advice of public health experts. ‚ÄúThe problem is we‚Äôve ignored the public health experts, so I‚Äôll be listening to them and not to political consultants, pollsters, or folks looking out for their own financial interests, like my opponent.‚Äù

Perdue has advocated for a phased reopening of businesses and described the lockdown measures Ossoff supports as ‚Äúoverreaching‚Äù following Ossoff‚Äôs CNN interview:

If you think the overreaching lockdowns in states like New York and California are scary, know that Jon @Ossoff would support the very same policies ‚Äì for the entire country. pic.twitter.com/RADSX01uMO ‚Äî David Perdue (@Perduesenate) November 30, 2020

In the same interview, Bash also asked Ossoff about his recent endorsement from Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), a self-proclaimed democratic socialist, and whether Ossoff wants Sanders to campaign with him in the weeks leading up to the January 5 Senate runoff election. Ossoff said that while he has not had that conversation with Sanders, he welcomes Sanders‚Äô support.

Georgia GOP spokeswoman Abigail Sigler expressed concern after Ossoff‚Äôs television appearance that the Georgia Democrat‚Äôs support for lockdowns aligns with the socialist ideology‚Äôs tendency for government dependency.

‚ÄúOn January 5th, Georgians have a clear choice between socialism and freedom,‚Äù Sigler said. ‚ÄúJon Ossoff supports a national lockdown and seeks to keep the entire country shut inside until we are completely dependent on the federal government for everything. ‚Ä¶ We must reject Jon Ossoff and the radical Democrats‚Äô socialist agenda.‚Äù

Write to Ashley Oliver at aoliver@breitbart.com.

Title: Georgia‚Äôs Fulton County Recount Delayed After Dominion Server Crash
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
The recount requested by President Trump‚Äôs campaign in Georgia‚Äôs Fulton County experienced a delay after a Dominion Voting Systems mobile server crashed on Sunday, according to Fulton County officials.

‚ÄúTechnicians from Dominion have been dispatched to resolve the issue,‚Äù Fulton County officials said in a statement after the server crashed on Sunday. ‚ÄúThe Georgia Secretary of State‚Äôs office has also been alerted to the issue and is aware of efforts to resolve the problem.‚Äù

Dominion has remained at the center of claims of error and fraud in the 2020 election. While Sidney Powell is not formally part of President Trump‚Äôs legal team, she participated in a joint press conference with his campaign prior to Thanksgiving and detailed the purported issues with the voting machines.

As Breitbart News detailed:

Powell argued that U.S. votes were being counted overseas, and that Dominion voting machines and Smartmatic software were controlled by foreign interests, manipulating algorithms to change the results. Powell noted specifically that Smartmatic‚Äôs owners included two Venezuelan nationals, whom she alleged had ties to the regime of Hugo Chavez and Nicolas Maduro. The legal team alleged that there were statistical anomalies, such as huge batches of votes for Biden, that could not be explained except as manipulation ‚Äî which, they alleged, happened in the wee hours of the morning as vote-counting had stalled. (The companies have disputed these allegations vigorously.)

Powell filed lawsuits challenging the election results in Georgia and Michigan last week, which contained the allegations she previewed at the press conference.

‚ÄúMathematical and statistical anomalies rising to the level of impossibilities, as shown by affidavits of multiple witnesses, documentation, and expert testimony evince this scheme across the state of Georgia,‚Äù Powell alleged, adding that ‚Äúespecially egregious conduct arose in Forsyth, Paulding, Cherokee, Hall, and Barrow County.‚Äù

Researchers have also questioned the reliability of the voting systems, noting that they ‚Äúregister votes in bar codes that the human eye cannot decipher‚Äù which could give voters ‚Äúprintouts that accurately spell out the names of the candidates they picked, but, because of a hack, the bar codes do not reflect those choices.‚Äù

In October, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC) warned that Georgia‚Äôs newly implemented Dominion voting system was vulnerable to cyberattacks. It also noted that Texas rejected the Dominion equipment due to ‚Äúmultiple hardware issues.‚Äù

Top Democrats, including Sens. Elizabeth Warren (MA), Amy Klobuchar (MN), and Ron Wyden (OR) also signaled concern over Dominion‚Äôs technology in 2019. In a letter to the private equity firms controlling the top U.S. election technology companies, the senators expressed concern over ‚Äúvulnerabilities and a lack of transparency in the election technology industry and the poor condition of voting machines and other election technology equipment.‚Äù

However, Dominion has fervently denied what it called ‚Äúfalse assertions about vote switching and software issues‚Äù with their voting systems, and Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp (R) has dismissed Powell‚Äôs accusations.

Fulton and the remaining 158 counties have until December 2 to complete the requested recount.

Title: Trump Urges Georgia Governor to Strengthen Recount
Author: ['Charlie Spiering']
Text:
President Donald Trump on Monday warned Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp (R) of a ‚Äúgoldmine of fraud‚Äù without signature matching for mail-in ballots in the state recount.

‚ÄúWhy won‚Äôt Governor Brian Kemp, the hapless Governor of Georgia, use his emergency powers, which can be easily done, to overrule his obstinate Secretary of State, and do a match of signatures on envelopes,‚Äù Trump asked, referring to Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger (R).

Raffensperger has claimed that matching the signatures is no longer possible because the ballots have been separated from the outer envelope.

But Trump argued that verifying the signatures in the recount would eliminate any potential fraud ‚Äî both in the 2020 election and the Georgia Senate runoff election.

The president also questioned whether the number of envelopes matched up with the number of ballots cast in the Georgia 2020 election, suggesting there were other signs of fraud.

‚ÄúAlso, quickly check the number of envelopes versus the number of ballots,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúYou may just find that there are many more ballots than there are envelopes. So simple, and so easy to do.‚Äù

Title: Newt Gingrich: America's Future Depends on Georgia's Senate Races
Author: ['Robert Kraychik']
Text:
America‚Äôs future depends on the outcomes of the elections for the U.S. Senate in Georgia, said former Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich (R-GA) on Monday, offering his remarks on SiriusXM‚Äôs Breitbart News Daily with host Alex Marlow.

Marlow asked about demoralization among conservatives and Republicans in Georgia rooted in mistrust of the electoral and political systems.

‚ÄúA lot of people in the audience are discouraged,‚Äù Marlow stated. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs the majority, by any means, but there‚Äôs certainly a number of people who‚Äôve been pretty vocal that they‚Äôre discouraged. They think the election process ‚Äî if it‚Äôs not going to be legitimate ‚Äî then there‚Äôs no point in voting and they don‚Äôt want to vote. They‚Äôre going protest in Georgia by not voting. I would like to hope it‚Äôs a small number of people, but a small number of people could swing the whole election. Do you have a message for those people?‚Äù

Gingrich urged Georgians to vote and volunteer as poll watchers.

LISTEN:

Gingrich continued with this advice, ‚ÄúMy message is very simple. The future of the United States depends on the outcome of the Georgia Senate races. If you don‚Äôt want a radical left-wing America dominated by left-wing judges with massive tax increases, with a policy, frankly, of appeasing China, and you don‚Äôt want that kind of future, you have to go out and vote. And then frankly, you have to volunteer as a poll watcher and make sure they don‚Äôt steal the election. But I think these things are vital and I don‚Äôt think we should in any way underestimate how really important the Georgia Senate race.‚Äù

The 2020 election ‚Äúmay be the biggest Presidential theft since Adams and Clay robbed Andrew Jackson in 1824,‚Äù wrote Gingrich on Friday via Twitter.

The more data comes out on vote anomalies that clearly are not legitimate the more it looks like 2020 may be the biggest Presidential theft since Adams and Clay robbed Andrew Jackson in 1824. State legislatures should demand recounts ‚Äî Newt Gingrich (@newtgingrich) November 27, 2020

Gingrich contrasted 1824‚Äôs presidential election with 2020‚Äôs.

‚ÄúIn 1824, Andrew Jackson had At 40 percent of the popular vote, but the guys who came in number two and three combined in the House of Representatives of John Quincy Adams and Henry Clay decided that even though Jackson got the most votes, he wouldn‚Äôt be president,‚Äù Gingrich explained. ‚ÄúSo Jackson spent the next four years attacking them for representing a corrupt establishment and decisively beat Adams in 1828, and really the caused a dramatic uprising against the old order because people were just sick of it.‚Äù

Everything hinges on Georgia's January 5th Senate runoff. https://t.co/obPHqU9nmk ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 26, 2020

Gingrich warned Democrats focus on election mechanics while Republicans focus on political campaigning. He highlighted get-out-the-vote efforts funded by Mark Zuckerberg and other left-wing billionaires and Democrat-driven election law changes as examples of Democrats‚Äô focus on electioneering.

‚ÄúYou have to think of two parallel projects,‚Äù determined Gingrich. ‚ÄúThere is the campaign, which is what the Republicans focus on, and there is the election, which is what the Democrats focus on. If we don‚Äôt find a way to have an honest election, the campaign won‚Äôt matter, because we will be drowned in ballots that are illegally gathered [through] harvested ballots.‚Äù

Gingrich concluded, ‚ÄúThese two Senate seats are the margin between containing Biden and empowering Biden.‚Äù

Title: VIDEO: Trump Supporters Rally Outside GA Secretary of State's Home
Author: ['Amy Furr']
Text:
About 200 of President Donald Trump‚Äôs supporters rallied outside Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger‚Äôs (R) Atlanta home on Saturday to protest the election results.

‚ÄúTrucks flying Trump and ‚ÄòStop the Steal‚Äô flags drove up and down the street outside of Secretary Brad Raffensperger‚Äôs property, honking their horns as they passed by,‚Äù Fox 5 reported.

Organizer Ursula Christie told the outlet she wanted Raffensperger to know ‚Äúwe are silent no more and we want him to know that we are watching and we are listening and we are aware of the actions being taken.‚Äù

Raffensperger, a Republican, said he voted for Trump but has received criticism for his handling of the election.

‚ÄúOn Thanksgiving Day, Trump called Georgia‚Äôs election was [sic] part of a ‚Äòfraudulent system‚Äô and said Raffensperger was an ‚Äòenemy of the people,'‚Äù the Fox 5 report continued.

During an interview with CNN‚Äôs Jake Tapper on November 18, Raffensperger dismissed allegations of voter fraud in his state but acknowledged the possibility of clerical errors:

We have not seen any widespread voter fraud. The president has picked up some votes in a few of the counties that made some clerical errors. It wasn‚Äôt the machines. But at the end of the day, he started with 14,000. He‚Äôs about 12,000 now. But we‚Äôre finishing up, waiting for a few more counties to get back to us, large counties, but I don‚Äôt believe at the end of the day it will change the total results.

When asked if he believed former Vice President Joe Biden would win Georgia, Raffensperger said ‚ÄúYes, I believe that‚Äôs the way it will turn out.‚Äù

However, in a Friday tweet, Trump said ‚ÄúBiden can only enter the White House as President if he can prove that his ridiculous ‚Äò80,000,000 votes‚Äô were not fraudulently or illegally obtained.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen you see what happened in Detroit, Atlanta, Philadelphia & Milwaukee, massive voter fraud, he‚Äôs got a big unsolvable problem!‚Äù he concluded.

Title: Trump: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm Ashamed that I Endorsed‚Äô Governor Kemp in Georgia

Title: Trump Urges Supporters to Vote for Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue
Author: ['Charlie Spiering']
Text:
President Donald Trump on Friday told his supporters to defend the Republican Senate majority by backing Sens. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) and David Perdue (R-GA) in the Georgia runoff elections.

The president reacted to a Newsmax article about Trump supporters in Georgia considering a boycott of the election.

‚ÄúNo, the 2020 Election was a total scam, we won by a lot (and will hopefully turn over the fraudulent result), but we must get out and help David and Kelly, two GREAT people,‚Äù Trump wrote on Twitter.

No, the 2020 Election was a total scam, we won by a lot (and will hopefully turn over the fraudulent result), but we must get out and help David and Kelly, two GREAT people. Otherwise we are playing right into the hands of some very sick people. I will be in Georgia on Saturday! https://t.co/1ziqFq9S6O ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) November 27, 2020

Many Trump supporters are enraged by their state GOP representatives in Georgia, accusing them of failing to back the president in a contentious recount in which former Vice President Joe Biden still holds a roughly 12,000 vote lead.

But Trump said that a boycott would only help Democrats.

‚ÄúOtherwise we are playing right into the hands of some very sick people,‚Äù he wrote.

As Breitbart News reported, Democrats are already exploiting tensions in the state by spreading the message that Republicans should not back the Georgia Republican candidates because of their failure to fight for the president.

Trump‚Äôs son Donald Trump Jr. has also opposed any boycotts.

‚ÄúThat is NONSENSE. IGNORE those people,‚Äù he wrote on Twitter. ‚ÄúWe need ALL of our people coming out to vote for Kelly & David.‚Äù

Trump again promised to hold a campaign rally for Loeffler and Perdue as Republicans work to maintain control of their Senate majority.

‚ÄúI will be in Georgia on Saturday!‚Äù he wrote, referring to his planned rally for December 5.

The president is watching the race closely as Democrats work to flip the state and seize control of the Senate.

Trump described Perdue‚Äôs Democrat opponent, Jon Ossoff, as a ‚Äúlightweight‚Äù in a conversation with reporters on Thursday and Loeffler‚Äôs opponent, Raphael Warnock, as ‚Äúeither a communist or a socialist. I cannot figure that out yet.‚Äù

The Georgia runoff election will take place on January 5.

Title: Hollywood Storms Georgia: Kevin Bacon Hosting Celebrity Fundraiser for Pro-Democrat Group
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Georgia is ground zero in the battle for the balance of power in Washington, D.C., as control of the U.S. Senate now hinges on the outcome of the two Senate runoff races in the Peach State. With the Senate majority leadership within his reach, Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) recently declared, ‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change America.‚Äù Now Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick are reportedly the latest Hollywood celebrities to lend their star power to Democrats in Georgia, hoping to boost the chances of candidates Raphael Warrnock and Jon Ossoff and turn the Senate blue.

The acting power couple will join comedian Billy Eichner and Hamilton star Leslie Odom Jr. in a fundraiser for Swing Left, one of many progressive organizations that is mobilizing Democratic turnout in Georgia, according to The Hollywood Reporter. The Maze Runner producer Ellen Goldsmith-Vein will co-host the December 3 event.

Swing Left is among the many progressive groups that have set their sights on Georgia ahead of the state‚Äôs January 5 runoffs. The organization, which was founded in the wake of President Trump‚Äôs 2016 victory, has specialized in recruiting celebrities to push its agenda, including Broadway and Homeland star Mandy Patinkin.

Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick teamed up with Swing Left in the weeks leading up to the presidential election, participating in podcasts and donating money to the group.

Hollywood celebrities have made Georgia their top political priority in their effort to push Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock across the finish line. A-list stars including George Clooney and Will Smith have poured money into the races, while actors Kumail Nanjiani and Sophia Bush are spearheading WinBothSeats, an initiative to get out the minority vote for Democrats.

Julia Louis-Dreyfus is holding a Veep reunion next month to raise money for America Votes, the left-wing group that is working to boost Democratic chances in Georgia‚Äôs runoffs. Other stars pushing Georgia Democrats on social media include Alyssa Milano and Debra Messing.

Title: Donald Trump Says He Will Campaign in Georgia December 5
Author: ['Charlie Spiering']
Text:
President Donald Trump said Thursday that he would campaign in Georgia Saturday, December 5, to help Republicans in the Senate runoff election.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going on Saturday night. I‚Äôll be in Georgia. We‚Äôll have a tremendous crowd,‚Äù Trump told reporters after speaking to members of the Armed Forces in a teleconference call.

The White House clarified after Trump‚Äôs remarks that he would campaign in the state on Saturday, December 5.

Both Republican Sens. David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler face a runoff election on January 5, as Republicans try to hold on to their Senate majority.

‚ÄúMaybe I‚Äôll go twice. That‚Äôs very important that we win those races. These are great people,‚Äù Trump said.

Trump described Perdue‚Äôs Democrat opponent, Jon Ossoff, as a ‚Äúlightweight‚Äù and Loeffler‚Äôs opponent, Raphael Warnock, as ‚Äúeither a communist or a socialist. I cannot figure that out yet.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is not for Georgia,‚Äù Trump said.

Trump said that he warned Perdue and Loeffler of the voting system in the state of Georgia.

‚ÄúListen, you have a fraudulent system. You have to be very careful,‚Äù he recalled telling them.

Trump said that because of the coronavirus pandemic, he would probably host an outdoor rally in Georgia, most likely at an airport.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre looking for the right site,‚Äù he said.

Trump disputed a reporter‚Äôs assertion that this was his last Thanksgiving in the White House.

‚ÄúWell we don‚Äôt know what is last ‚Äî if you look at what‚Äôs going on. ‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre finding tremendous discrepancies in the votes, and nobody believes those numbers. Those numbers are incorrect numbers.‚Äù

He predicted that more evidence of voter fraud would come out in a number of weeks.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see what happens. Nobody wants to see the kind of fraud that this election has really come to represent,‚Äù he said.

Trump said he would continue fighting the election results, noting that former Vice President Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris opposed his policy of ‚ÄúAmerica First.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt have somebody assume office and already they want to get rid of ‚ÄòAmerica First.‚Äô ‚Ä¶ You know why?‚Äù he asked. ‚ÄúBecause China doesn‚Äôt want it.‚Äù

One reporter asked Trump if he would concede the presidential election if the electoral college voted for Biden on December 14.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a very hard thing to concede because we know there was massive fraud, so as to whether or not I can get this apparatus moving this quickly, because time is not on our side. Everything else is on our side. Facts are on our side,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThis was a massive fraud.‚Äù

Title: Stacey Abrams to Coach Hollywood Elites on How They Can Help Win Georgia
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
Georgia is now ground zero for the battle for the balance of power in Washington, D.C., as control of the U.S. Senate now hinges on the outcome of the two Senate runoff races. With the Senate majority leadership just a couple seats away, Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) recently declared, ‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change America.‚Äù And failed Georgia gubernatorial candidate and Democratic Party power player Stacey Abrams is more than willing to do her part to see that Schumer‚Äôs goal is realized.

Starting on Friday, Abrams will brief Hollywood agents, managers, publicists, and entertainment executives on how they can help elect Georgia U.S. Senate Democrat candidates Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock ahead of the runoff elections in according to the Hollywood Reporter.

On January 5, Georgia will have its runoff elections between senator Kelly Loeffler (R) and candidate Raphael Warnockas (D), as well as senator David Perdue (R) and candidate Jon Ossoff (D).

Abrams‚Äô organization Fair Fight is enlisting celebrities like Selena Gomez, Yara Shahidi, Issa Rae, Keke Palmer and Steph Curry for voting videos, as well as dumping millions of dollars to assist over a dozen organizations in their efforts ahead of the runoffs.

‚ÄúI believe very much in the power of celebrity to cut through the noise of politics,‚Äù Abrams said last week.

Celebrities also now believe that they have a vested interest in the turning the state blue, as tax incentives have brought Hollywood productions from California to Georgia in recent years, bringing the celebrities and other staff to the traditionally red state.

‚ÄúBeing someone who worked in Georgia for two years while I shot [Netflix series] Insatiable, I‚Äôm really aware of how powerful and impactful the organizers are,‚Äù said actress and political activist Alyssa Milano.

New Georgia Project executive director Nse Ufot echoed those sentiments.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been talking for quite a bit of time about how we are trying to change the culture of voting ‚Äî what better way to do that than by partnering with culture workers, people who are literally responsible for helping us shift the narrative and tell better stories about ourselves,‚Äù said Ufot. ‚ÄúOur state is growing by leaps and bounds because of an influx of storytellers and people who support them. I think that that could be a secret weapon as we think about the new Georgia.‚Äù

LaTosha Brown, the co-founder of the Marxist political organization Black Voters Matter, echoed those sentiments as well, and claimed, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not the headquarters for Southern white male racists‚Äù now that Hollywood has imposed itself.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen this transition ‚Äî Georgia is the number one place for film productions, so this city has become more internationalized, I think one,‚Äù said Brown. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs been attractive to bringing diverse folks to the state.‚Äù

You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Facebook and Twitter at @ARmastrangelo, on Parler at @alana, and on Instagram.

Title: Sidney Powell Files Lawsuits Challenging Election Results in Georgia, Michigan
Author: ['Joel B. Pollak']
Text:
Attorney Sidney Powell filed lawsuits Wednesday challenging the results of the presidential vote in Georgia and Michigan, alleging ‚Äúballot stuffing,‚Äù which she alleges was ‚Äúamplified and rendered virtually invisible by computer software created and run by domestic and foreign actors.‚Äù

Powell made similar claims last week at a press conference with President Donald Trump‚Äôs legal team. She was attacked by critics who claimed that she could not prove what she alleged. The legal team distanced themselves from her on Sunday, saying that her claims had gone beyond the evidence they had seen or could prove in court.

Powell ‚Äî who also defended Lt. Gen. Michael Flynn, pardoned by President Trump on Wednesday ‚Äî accepted the decision but pressed ahead regardless.

She alleges in Georgia:

Mathematical and statistical anomalies rising to the level of impossibilities, as shown by affidavits of multiple witnesses, documentation, and expert testimony evince this scheme across the state of Georgia. Especially egregious conduct arose in Forsyth, Paulding, Cherokee, Hall, and Barrow County. This scheme and artifice to defraud affected tens of thousands of votes in Georgia alone and ‚Äúrigged‚Äù the election in Georgia for Joe Biden.

Powell makes similar allegations in Michigan, noting an ‚Äúespecially egregious range of conduct in Wayne County and the City of Detroit, though this conduct occurred throughout the State at the direction of Michigan state election officials.‚Äù

Powell traces the fraud to ‚Äúsoftware and hardware from Dominion Voting Systems Corporation,‚Äù which she said derives from software created by ‚ÄúSmartmatic Corporation, which became Sequoia in the United States.‚Äù

She goes on to allege, in both the Georgia and the Michigan complaints, ‚ÄúSmartmatic and Dominion were founded by foreign oligarchs and dictators to ensure computerized ballot-stuffing and vote manipulation to whatever level was needed to make certain Venezuelan dictator Hugo Chavez never lost another election.‚Äù

Based on the affidavit of a whistleblower, Powell alleges that the systems were designed to make ballot-stuffing hard to detect by a ‚Äúsimple audit.‚Äù They were manipulated, she says, by people who had access to the systems.

In Georgia, she says:

[V]ideo from the State Farm Arena in Fulton County shows that on November 3rd after the polls closed, election workers falsely claimed a water leak required the facility to close. All poll workers and challengers were evacuated for several hours at about 10:00 PM. However, several election workers remained unsupervised and unchallenged working at the computers for the voting tabulation machines until after 1:00 AM.

She also claimed that ‚Äúthe Dominion software was accessed by agents acting on behalf of China and Iran in order to monitor and manipulate elections, including the most recent US general election in 2020.‚Äù One expert, she says, ‚Äúconcludes that hundreds of thousands of votes that were cast for President Trump in the 2020 general election were transferred to former Vice-President Biden.‚Äù

And she adds that ‚ÄúGeorgia‚Äôs election officials and poll workers exacerbated and helped, whether knowingly or unknowingly, the Dominion system carry out massive voter manipulation by refusing to observe statutory safeguards for absentee ballots. Election officials failed to verify signatures and check security envelopes. They barred challengers from observing the count, which also facilitated the fraud.‚Äù

In Michigan, Powell says, in addition to problems with Dominion, there were ‚Äúadditional categories of ‚Äòtraditional‚Äô voting fraud and Michigan Election Code violations, supplemented by healthy doses of harassment, intimidation, discrimination, abuse and even physical removal of Republican poll challengers to eliminate any semblance of transparency, objectivity or fairness from the vote counting process.‚Äù

Powell alleges, citing expert testimony, that Michigan saw tens of thousands of ‚Äúexcess voters,‚Äù where unassigned or blank absentee ballots were filled out by election workers, and nearly all of those votes went to Joe Biden. She also alleges that in four precincts, more ballots were counted than could be physically processed during a two and-a-half hour interval Nov. 4.

She alleges that glitches in Michigan ‚Äî such as one that mistakenly counted 6,000 votes for Biden in Antrim County ‚Äî were always in Biden‚Äôs favor.

There are enough ballots affected, Powell argues, for the courts to set aside the results of the 2020 election in each state.

Attorney L. Lin Wood is also among those listed in the filings.

Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News and the host of Breitbart News Sunday on Sirius XM Patriot on Sunday evenings from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. ET (4 p.m. to 7 p.m. PT). His newest e-book is The Trumpian Virtues: The Lessons and Legacy of Donald Trump‚Äôs Presidency. His recent book, RED NOVEMBER, tells the story of the 2020 Democratic presidential primary from a conservative perspective. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

Title: Tim Scott: Trump Should Campaign in Georgia, He‚Äôs ‚Äòthe Person That Makes Sure‚Äô Those Seats Stay Republican
Author: ['Ian Hanchett']
Text:

Title: Democrat Jon Ossoff Claims ‚ÄòOversight‚Äô in Omitting Payment from Chinese Communist-Linked Company
Author: ['Kristina Wong']
Text:
Georgia Senate Democrat candidate Jon Ossoff‚Äôs campaign is claiming its omission from its financial disclosures in May of a payment from a Chinese Communist Party (CCP)-linked company to Ossoff‚Äôs media production company was due to a ‚Äúpaperwork oversight.‚Äù

After a political ad asserted that Ossoff ignored rules and hid cash from Chinese communists, an Ossoff campaign spokesperson called it a ‚Äúpaperwork oversight.‚Äù

The November 17 Senate Leadership Fund ad said, ‚ÄúJon Ossoff. A trail of dirty money. Ossoff ignored the rules, hiding cash from Chinese communists.‚Äù

The ad was referring to Ossoff‚Äôs initial financial disclosure filings for his Senate candidacy in May 2020. That filing showed that his media production company, Insight TWI, received more than $5,000 in the past two years from 21 TV or broadcasting groups from around the world.

Two months later, in July 2020, Ossoff amended that filing to include 32 companies, including PCCW Media Limited ‚Äî a Hong Kong-based Chinese media company that is partially owned by the Chinese state-run company China Unicom, led by a CCP member.

Ossoff campaign spokesperson Miryam Lipper told FactCheck.org in regard to the ad that Ossoff was not ‚Äúhiding‚Äù the payment and that it was a ‚Äúpaperwork oversight‚Äù that was ‚Äúrectified‚Äù after ‚Äúa normal review of the campaign‚Äôs paperwork.‚Äù

Lipper also wrote to FactCheck.org, ‚ÄúPCCW does not = Chinese communists.‚Äù

However, multiple media reports show direct ties between PCCW Media Limited and the CCP.

PCCW Media Limited is owned by Richard Li ‚Äî who has spoken out against pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, as well as owned by the Chinese state-owned China Unicom, which is run by CEO Wang Xiaochu, a member of the CCP.

Li has a long track record of supporting Beijing. According to the National Review, in 2016, Li released a public statement that said he was ‚Äústaunchly opposed to the independence of Hong Kong.‚Äù

‚ÄúMr. Richard Li and MOOV would like to clearly state that the company and Mr. Li respect freedom of expression,‚Äù the statement said. ‚ÄúHowever, both Mr. Li and the Company are staunchly opposed to the independence of Hong Kong and it is their view that the independence of Hong Kong would not be feasible, and discussing Hong Kong‚Äôs independence is a waste of society‚Äôs resources.‚Äù

At the height of the democracy protests in 2019, Li took out full-page advertisements in seven newspapers to call for the restoration of ‚Äúthe social order with the rule of law,‚Äù backing the recommendations of Beijing‚Äôs Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office of the State Council, according to the National Review.

And Li‚Äôs father, Li Ka-shing, reportedly the richest man in Hong Kong, publicly backed the CCP‚Äôs sweeping national security law in 2020 to crack down on critics and dissenters.

Despite Lipper claiming that PCCW Media Limited ‚Äúdoes not = Chinese communists,‚Äù she still made an effort to distance Ossoff‚Äôs company from PCCW.

She claimed PCCW did not directly pay Insight TWI, despite Ossoff‚Äôs own filing listing the company as those that paid Insight TWI more than $5,000 in the past two years.

‚ÄúIn some instances, as is the case with PCCW, TWI even licenses the documentaries to distributors like Sky Vision who re-license them to TV stations,‚Äù Lipper claimed.

‚ÄúTWI would never have sold anything to PCCW directly, just received a royalty check from Sky Vision when PCCW ran TWI‚Äôs two investigations of ISIS war crimes,‚Äù she added.

She also asserted the payment did not mean PCCW controlled Ossoff.

The structure of Insight TWI ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt leave any room for this notion that he is somehow controlled by these groups in the nefarious way they try to imply,‚Äù she told FactCheck.org.

FactCheck.org also said support for the ad‚Äôs ‚Äúcharges is weak‚Äù and called PCCW Media Limited ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù ‚ÄúChinese communists.‚Äù

Follow Breitbart News‚Äôs Kristina Wong on Twitter or on Facebook.

Title: Rand Paul Urges Georgia Libertarians to ‚ÄòVote Republican‚Äô in Runoff
Author: ['Amy Furr']
Text:
Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) is encouraging Libertarians in Georgia to vote Republican in the January Senate runoff race.

‚ÄúOne of the things that I‚Äôve taken upon myself is to try to encourage‚Ä¶ there was a little over 100,000 people who voted for Shane Hazel, the Libertarian candidate, and I think those people can find a place and reason to vote for Republicans,‚Äù he said Monday on Fox News.

Paul continued:

Look, I get fed up with the Republicans not spending money wisely and adding to our debt, but they are better than the Democrats. Even if only sometimes marginally so. But on some things, like packing the court and D.C. statehood, Republicans will help to protect the country from all branches of government being controlled by the Democrats. So, I think there is some argument‚Ä¶ some of these 100,000 Libertarians to actually vote Republican and I‚Äôm gonna be spending some time trying to encourage them to vote Republican in the runoff.

Democrats from outside the state are trying to create division among Republicans in Georgia.

‚ÄúThe Democrats then intend to exploit those divisions to try to drive down turnout among President Donald Trump‚Äôs supporters in the runoff for the two U.S. Senate seats that will decide which party controls the upper chamber of Congress next year,‚Äù Breitbart News reported.

‚ÄúRepublicans, meanwhile, are pushing back on these efforts, calling them ‚Äòdeceitful campaign tactics‚Äô designed to ‚Äòmanipulate voters‚Äô in Georgia,‚Äù it continued.

A recent ad by the Georgia Republican Party said illegal aliens will earn the right to vote if Americans do not vote in the runoff elections.

‚ÄúWhen the radicals say ‚Äòchange America,‚Äô this is what they mean: opening the border, illegal immigrants voting, total Democrat control,‚Äù the narrator states:

When the radicals say ‚Äúchange America,‚Äù they mean: opening the border and allowing illegal immigrants voting. Georgia, go vote, because if you don‚Äôt, illegal immigrants will. pic.twitter.com/az2pKjnhNr ‚Äî GAGOP (@GaRepublicans) November 23, 2020

‚ÄúSave Georgia. Save America. Go vote. If you don‚Äôt, illegal immigrants will,‚Äù the narrator concludes.

Title: Democrat Jaime Harrison Launches PAC for Runoffs After Record-Breaking Loss in South Carolina
Author: ['Ashley Oliver']
Text:
Democrat Jaime Harrison, who ran against Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham in South Carolina and lost in the most expensive defeat in U.S. Senate race history, announced Tuesday the launch of a political action committee (PAC) aimed at boosting Democrats in Georgia‚Äôs Senate runoff election.

Harrison, who has also been floated as the next Democratic National Committee (DNC) chair, announced the launch of Dirt Road PAC Monday morning on MSNBC‚Äôs Morning Joe. Harrison said he first plans to raise money for Democrats Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff, who are challenging Republican Sens. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue in Georgia‚Äôs high-profile Senate runoff races on January 5:

The new fundraising effort comes on the heels of Harrison outspending any Senate candidate in U.S. history, at $104.1 million, in an attempt to oust Senate Judiciary Committee chairman Graham. Harrison lost to Graham by a definitive margin of ten points.

‚ÄúRome wasn‚Äôt built in a day; South Carolina won‚Äôt flip overnight, but if you sustain the investment in these communities, we‚Äôll see the change that is so necessary and so needed,‚Äù Harrison said on MSNBC as he rationalized his continued pursuit of political donations.

Host Joe Scarborough praised Harrison‚Äôs Senate bid and questioned if South Carolina was ‚Äújust a state that Democrats aren‚Äôt going to be able to win for a very long time‚Äù:

You had so many advantages in this race. You had all the money any candidate could ever dream of having. You ran what most thought was a very effective race against an ineffective opponent, who at times seemed desperate, seemed whiney, had broken his promise to South Carolina voters time and time again ‚Ä¶ and yet Lindsey Graham won the race handily. Is South Carolina just a state that Democrats aren‚Äôt going to be able to win for a very long time?

Harrison responded by emphasizing that flipping red areas to blue requires a ‚Äúlong-term and sustained approach.‚Äù

Harrison‚Äôs PAC launch is one of several Democrat fundraising endeavors zoned in on the consequential Georgia runoff races, which will determine which party next controls the Senate majority. Activist Stacey Abrams, who dropped $10 million at the start of the runoffs through her organization Fair Fight, announced Saturday that Fair Fight will pump $2.7 million into smaller groups intending to strengthen their ‚Äúget-out-the-vote apparatus.‚Äù

Other big names stepping in for the runoffs include Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), former Mayor Pete Buttigieg (D), and ‚ÄúSquad‚Äù leader Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY).

As for Harrison‚Äôs PAC, beyond Georgia, the South Carolina Democrat intends to direct funds toward Virginia‚Äôs 2021 elections, voter registration efforts, and the 2022 midterm elections.

Write to Ashley Oliver at aoliver@breitbart.com.

Title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus Holding ‚ÄòVeep‚Äô Reunion to Turn Out Democrats in Georgia Senate Runoffs
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Georgia is the center of the battle for the balance of power in Washington, D.C., as control of the U.S. Senate now hinges on the outcome of the two Senate runoff races in the Peach State. With the Senate majority leadership just a couple seats away, Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) recently declared, ‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change America.‚Äù Now, actress and anti-Trump activist Julia Louis-Dreyfus will re-live her character‚Äôs humiliating electoral loss in HBO‚Äôs Veep to raise money for Democratic voter turnout in Georgia‚Äôs hotly contested runoff elections.

The Veep cast is set to reunite to perform a virtual reading of the episode ‚ÄúMother,‚Äù in which President Selina Meyer loses the Nevada recount and thus the White House. The streaming event on December 6 will serve as a fundraiser for America Votes, a progressive organization that aims to boost votes for Democratic candidates.

Julia Louis-Dreyfus, who hosted the final night of this year‚Äôs Democratic National Convention, posted a promotional video for the event in which she parodied Rudy Giuliani‚Äôs recent press conference.

2020 won't stop ripping off #VEEP, so we had to do something about it. Our cast is hosting a LIVE virtual table read of the episode everyone was talking about in support of @AmericaVotes' grassroots work to turn out voters for the Georgia Runoffs. Sign up: https://t.co/uAgG2a7mSv pic.twitter.com/r3U1ZT45uF ‚Äî Julia Louis-Dreyfus (@OfficialJLD) November 24, 2020

The official invitation states: ‚ÄúYour donation to America Votes directly supports the Georgia-based groups working to educate and turn out voters for December‚Äôs critical US Senate runoff elections. Join us to #ShowUpForGeorgia.‚Äù

In the Veep episode ‚ÄúMother,‚Äù the Selina Meyer campaign hopes to end the electoral stalemate with the Nevada recount, but things don‚Äôt go as planned. The political cliffhanger comes as Meyer‚Äôs elderly mother suffers a massive stroke, sending Selina into an emotional tailspin.

Louis-Dreyfus previously held a Veep reunion-fundraiser for Wisconsin Democrats in the run-up to the November 3 election. Key counties in the state are undergoing a recount after Milwaukee and Dane counties saw late surges in votes for former Vice President Joe Biden.

The Georgia runoffs are set to take place January 5.

Title: Fitton: Election Update
Author: ['Tom Fitton']
Text:
If you want to effectively express your beliefs about this deliberately chaotic election, I urge you to contact your representatives in your state legislature and Congress. Especially if you live in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Michigan, Wisconsin, Nevada, and Arizona ‚Äì cesspools of fraud and lawlessness all.

I described what we‚Äôre witnessing in an interview with Stephanie Hamill on One America News Network:

Americans see an election that‚Äôs been questioned because of substantial allegations of maladministration of the election ‚Äì that‚Äôs a charitable interpretation of it. And they know there‚Äôs an air of violence and censorship and suppression if they dare raise questions about it or support the president. We who are defending the rule of law are being lectured about the peaceful transfer of power by the likes of President Obama, who during his transition was actually conspiring against President Trump and spying on his team illicitly.

In her Newsmax television show Sovereign Nation, Michelle Malkin complimented Judicial Watch for our work on elections and suggested that we have earned the right to say, ‚ÄúI told you so.‚Äù I take no comfort in that because we have unprecedented fraud occurring across the country.

Michelle asked me what Judicial Watch doing about it. My response:

Our litigators and investigators are figuring out where we can make a stand to preserve the lawful election result. U.S. Code designates this past Tuesday as Election Day. That‚Äôs when we‚Äôre supposed to select the president. Any votes being counted that arrive after that day should be subject to challenge. And any vote counting that occurs after Election Day should be subject to challenge. When you have a pause in counting, that indicates that fraud has taken place.

This is what I said to my Twitter followers about our activity:

Americans should demand courts and state legislatures and Congress protect free and fair elections! Judicial Watch is conducting independent investigations in PA, GA, AZ, NV, MI, WI!

We don‚Äôt know how all of this will play out. The election may well end up in Congress, as I explain in this video:

The electors vote as part of the Electoral College process in the middle of December. Then on January 6, the new Congress is supposed to meet and count the votes and essentially confirm and ratify the Electoral College selection of the president and vice president. Now, if there‚Äôs a challenge, you could get a situation where the House, for instance, wants to bless the Biden electors out of Pennsylvania and the Senate wants to reject them. Frankly, I‚Äôm not sure what happens next.

We have observed and researched and litigated elections for decades, and, as you might imagine, we are following this one extremely closely. We will be deploying our weapon of choice, the Freedom of Information Act, to uncover the truth.

Title: Sen. Kelly Loeffler Donates $38K 4th Quarter Senate Salary to Charity
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
Georgia Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R), who will face Rev. Raphael Warnock (D) in the forthcoming January 5 runoff, donated all her fourth-quarter salary to ten charitable organizations, benefitting various programs and centers focused on assisting children, the homeless, and struggling families.

Loeffler made good on her pledge to donate her salary to charitable organizations, donating her fourth-quarter $38,000 salary to ten charities, giving $3,800 to each. This quarter, the senator gave to a variety of organizations that ‚Äúare helping those in need across the state of Georgia.‚Äù These include a Christian adoption agency, a foster care center, a community home, and a women‚Äôs center, among others.

‚ÄúCharitable organizations and nonprofits embody the best of Georgia and the best of America, and they play a critical role in fostering thriving communities across our state,‚Äù Loeffler said in a statement.

Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) and Democrat Raphael Warnock advanced to the Georgia Senate runoff election on Tuesday, according to projections. https://t.co/W9vQPxKgFp ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 4, 2020

‚ÄúThis quarter, I‚Äôm proud to donate my salary to 10 Georgia-based organizations that are on the frontlines lifting Georgians up and providing life-changing resources and support to so many,‚Äù she continued.

‚ÄúAs we enter the holiday season, it‚Äôs important to give thanks for the selfless sacrifices that so many across our state make for others, and I look forward to seeing all the great work these organizations will continue to do in the months and years to come,‚Äù she added.

Organizations include:

Bartow Family Resources, Cartersville, Georgia

Beacon of Hope, Johns Creek, Georgia

Catoosa County Stocking Full of Love, Ringgold, Georgia

Covenant Care Adoptions, Macon, Georgia

Dream Weavers Foster Care, Alpharetta, Georgia

Family Connection/Communities In Schools of Berrien County, Inc, Nashville, Georgia

Georgia Junior Livestock Foundation, Winder, Georgia

MUST Ministries, Marietta, Georgia

Obria Medical Clinic, Lawrenceville, Georgia

Stewart Community Home, Columbus, Georgia

Similarly, Loeffler donated her first, second, and third quarter salaries to charities and nonprofits, including but not limited to the Georgia Council on Substance Abuse, U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Foundation, Athens Pregnancy Center, Clinch Memorial Hospital, Georgia National Guard Family Support Foundation, Healing4Heroes, and the Boys & Girls Club of Lanier.

Loeffler‚Äôs opponent Rev. Warnock, a black theologian, is a controversial figure who has a well-documented history of radical views. Warnock has said that his approval of abortion is ‚Äúconsistent with my view as a Christian minister‚Äù and has called for the creation of a ‚Äúmilitant church.‚Äù

Rev. Raphael Warnock, the Democrat candidate for Georgia‚Äôs U.S. Senate runoff race, said in a speech in 2016 that ‚ÄúAmerica needs to repent for its worship of whiteness.‚Äù https://t.co/7trzeGqDK4 ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 15, 2020

His mentor, Dr. James Cone, reportedly called for the ‚Äúdestruction of everything white.‚Äù

During last week‚Äôs appearance on America‚Äôs Newsroom, Loeffler warned that ‚Äúso much is at stake‚Äù in these runoffs.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre the firewall against socialism in this country,‚Äù Loeffler said, referring to Sen. David Perdue‚Äôs (R-GA) runoff against Jon Ossoff as well.

Republicans would no longer hold the majority in the Senate if both Loeffler and Perdue lose their respective runoffs.

Failed Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams announced that ‚Äúmore than 750,000 Georgians have requested their ballots‚Äù ahead of the January 5 runoff.

Title: Mike Bloomberg Gun Control Group Descends on Georgia to Back Democrat Ossoff
Author: ['Awr Hawkins']
Text:
Democrat Senate candidate Jon Ossoff (GA) is endorsed by the Mike Bloomberg-founded gun control group, Everytown for Gun Safety.

Everytown originally announced its endorsement of Ossoff on September 15, 2020, then re-announced it following the development of a January 5, 2021, runoff between Ossoff and pro-Second Amendment Senator David Perdue (R-GA).

Moms Demand‚Äôs Shannon Watts said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre ready to send‚Ä¶David Perdue packing because instead of working for Georgians, [he‚Äôs] prioritized special interests like the gun lobby, pandered to extremists in their party, and catered to the views of right-wing conspiracy theorists.‚Äù

Democrat Georgia Senate candidate Jon Ossoff is campaigning on an outright ban on the sale of semiautomatic rifles and a licensing requirement for all semiautomatic firearms already in private hands, whether those firearms are rifles or handguns. https://t.co/ItanczdtMu ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 11, 2020

Watts‚Äô criticism of Sen. Perdue‚Äôs pro-Second Amendment stance is meant to keep attention way from the whole truth regarding Ossoff‚Äôs radical gun control agenda. Also, Ossoff wants to institute red flag laws, universal background checks for gun purchases, and place more restrictions on gun shows.

Title: 2017 Video Shows Democrat Raphael Warnock Believes ‚ÄòRacism‚Äô Is ‚ÄòAmerica‚Äôs Preexisting Condition‚Äô
Author: ['Ashley Oliver']
Text:
Rev. Raphael Warnock preached in 2017 that ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs preexisting condition‚Äù is ‚Äúracism‚Äù during at least two of the several speeches and sermons Warnock has given that have come under scrutiny for their radical messaging.

Warnock, the senior pastor at Ebenezer Baptist Church, said at a New Baptist Covenant event on June 29, 2017, that he ‚Äúwould not be a prophet‚Äù if he did not inform his audience ‚Äúthat racism is America‚Äôs preexisting condition‚Äù:



Warnock said in the clip New Baptist Covenant shared from the event:

We are in a special moment. We are in an evil moment. We are in a tragic moment, and I suggest to you that our politics is symptomatic of our sickness. We‚Äôve got a lot of problems, but I would not be a prophet if I did not tell you that racism is America‚Äôs preexisting condition. Like the insurance companies, nobody wants to go there. Nobody wants to cover it because we wonder what it would cost. We, the land of the free, and the incarceration capital of the world. In this land where we warehouse 25 percent of the world‚Äôs prisoners although we are only five percent of the world, we are to ask ourselves what has it cost us not to cover it, not to face up to it, not to confront it, not to deal with it. Racism is America‚Äôs preexisting condition.

Warnock also preached in a video compilation dubbed ‚Äú2017Year Ender‚Äù that racism, classism, bigotry, and xenophobia comprise America‚Äôs ‚Äúpreexisting condition‚Äù:

Warnock said, ‚ÄúAmerica has a preexisting condition. It‚Äôs called racism. It‚Äôs called classism. It‚Äôs called bigotry. It‚Äôs called xenophobia. And we need God to heal us of our preexisting condition.‚Äù

As Warnock pursues unseating Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) in Georgia‚Äôs highly consequential Senate runoff race on January 5, Warnock‚Äôs connection to provocative and racially charged rhetoric has come into the spotlight.

Warnock appeared on Fox News in 2008 and defended Jeremiah Wright, who served as former pastor to President Barack Obama and is known for a number of incendiary statements ‚Äî which Obama himself has condemned ‚Äî including declaring that ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs chickens are coming home to roost‚Äù in regard to the 9/11 terrorist attacks and giving an impassioned speech in which he repeatedly shouted ‚ÄúGod damn America.‚Äù

Warnock said in 2016 just before the presidential election that ‚ÄúAmerica needs to repent for its worship of whiteness on full display.‚Äù

Warnock has twice praised Dr. James Cone and described Cone as his ‚Äúmentor.‚Äù Cone claimed to fight racism but employed a wealth of anti-white language, including decrying ‚Äúsatanic whiteness‚Äù and calling for the ‚Äúdestruction of everything white‚Äù in society.

In addition to comparing racism in America to a preexisting medical condition, Warnock has made a string of anti-police remarks, including that ‚Äúwe shouldn‚Äôt be surprised when we see police officers act like bullies on the street‚Äù and that ‚Äúoften those who are sworn to protect cause more trouble.‚Äù

Warnock responded to criticism of his past comments in an Atlanta Journal-Constitution interview in March this year, saying, ‚ÄúAny fair-thinking person would recognize that everything a government does, even the American government, is not consistent with God‚Äôs dream for the world.‚Äù

Title: Soros-Linked Group that Backs Defunding Police Campaigns for Warnock
Author: ['Kristina Wong']
Text:
Working Families Party, a third party that supports defunding the police and has received funding from leftist billionaire George Soros, is campaigning for Democrat Senate candidate Raphael Warnock in a Georgia run-off race in December that could determine which party controls the U.S. Senate.

‚ÄúTeam WFP is kicking off our runoff election text banking for @ReverendWarnock in Georgia TONIGHT from 6-9pm ET. Join us! https://wfpus.org/warnock,‚Äù the group tweeted Monday.

Team WFP is kicking off our runoff election text banking for @ReverendWarnock in Georgia TONIGHT from 6-9pm ET.

Join us! https://t.co/IHGC7s096w pic.twitter.com/QO77dZe0SB ‚Äî Working Families Party üê∫ (@WorkingFamilies) November 10, 2020

Warnock is running against incumbent Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA), alongside another Georgia Senate run-off race between Jon Ossoff and incumbent Sen. David Perdue (R-GA).

Republicans have 50 seats in the Senate, and if Democrats win the two Georgia run-off races, they will tie Republicans for control of the U.S. Senate, with Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) casting the deciding vote should she become vice president.

Democrats hope to gain control of the upper chamber in addition to the House to push through major reforms in a prospective Biden administration. A Republican-controlled Senate would provide a backstop against that.

While Warnock‚Äôs campaign claims that he does not want to defund the police, Working Families Party has been clear about its aims.

As recently as September 23, it tweeted: ‚ÄúEnd white supremacy. Transform this country. Defund the police. Defeat those who stand in the way of a world in which #BlackLivesMatter . #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor.‚Äù

End white supremacy. Transform this country. Defund the police. Defeat those who stand in the way of a world in which #BlackLivesMatter. #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor ‚Äî Working Families Party üê∫ (@WorkingFamilies) September 23, 2020

The month before, it tweeted that ‚Äúthe only way to stop police violence is to defund the police and instead create, uplift and fund the community services that keep Black people safe, healthy and free.‚Äù

The only way to stop police violence is to defund the police and instead create, uplift and fund the community services that keep Black people safe, healthy and free. 2/ ‚Äî Working Families Party üê∫ (@WorkingFamilies) August 24, 2020

After a New York Police union endorsed a presidential candidate for the first time ever, Working Families Party tweeted: ‚ÄúDefund, and we can‚Äôt stress this enough.‚Äù

Defund, and we can't stress this enough, this https://t.co/QzqZE0w2rZ ‚Äî Working Families Party üê∫ (@WorkingFamilies) August 15, 2020

‚ÄúDefund the police,‚Äù it tweeted on May 31.

Defund the police. ‚Äî Working Families Party üê∫ (@WorkingFamilies) May 31, 2020

The party received $1 million from Soros-funded Democracy PAC this year, according to Politico, and has a charter that calls for shifting ‚Äúresources away from policing, jails and detention centers, endless wars and agencies that separate families.‚Äù

It adds: ‚ÄúShift resources into schools, housing, healthcare and jobs, to enable all people ‚Äì especially Black and brown people, immigrants, and Indigenous people ‚Äì to thrive.‚Äù

The charter is signed by all four members of the so-called ‚ÄúSquad‚Äù ‚Äî House Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY), Ilhan Omar (D-MN), Rashida Tlaib (D-MI), and Ayanna Pressley (D-MA).

The group has also called for defunding the Department of Homeland Security, and for protecting Planned Parenthood.

Working Families Party plans to organize text banking for Warnock every Tuesday until the run-off election date on January 5.

Title: Democrats Aim to Create, Exploit Divisions Among GOP in Georgia
Author: ['Matthew Boyle']
Text:
Democrats from outside Georgia are actively engaged in an effort to create divisions among Republicans in the state.

The Democrats then intend to exploit those divisions to try to drive down turnout among President Donald Trump‚Äôs supporters in the runoff for the two U.S. Senate seats that will decide which party controls the upper chamber of Congress next year. Republicans, meanwhile, are pushing back on these efforts, calling them ‚Äúdeceitful campaign tactics‚Äù designed to ‚Äúmanipulate voters‚Äù in Georgia.

Really American PAC, a leftwing Super PAC that ran scores of attack ads against President Trump in the general election in 2020, is now crowdfunding on social media to fund billboards in Trump-supporter-heavy areas of Georgia to split Trump supporters from Sens. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) and David Perdue (R-GA). Both GOP senators are headed to Jan. 5 runoffs in the state that will determine which party controls the U.S. Senate next year. As of now, next year Republicans will have 50 seats in the U.S. Senate and Democrats will have 48. These two seats will determine which party controls the Senate, and if the Democrats take both of them‚Äîand Democrat presidential candidate Joe Biden is successful in challenges from President Donald Trump to election results that currently have Biden leading Trump‚Äîthen the Democrats would gain control of the chamber as the would-be Vice President Kamala Harris, now a Democrat senator from California, would be the tie-breaking vote.

As Trump is challenging the election results in Georgia and other states around the country, the Democrats are now trying to imply that Loeffler and Perdue have been insufficiently loyal to the president.

The billboards Really American PAC is seeking to post around Georgia explicitly state this in text that appears alongside images of Loeffler and Perdue: ‚ÄúGeorgia Republicans Didn‚Äôt Fight For Trump. We Won‚Äôt Fight For Them.‚Äù

This revelation that key figures in the Democrat Party‚Äîwho stand to benefit politically from a Democrat-controlled U.S. Senate if their candidates Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock defeat Perdue and Loeffler respectively‚Äîare behind these attempts to create such divisions comes as no surprise to Trump supporters, who are acutely aware that the president‚Äôs supporters are firmly behind the GOP candidates for U.S. Senate in Georgia in the runoffs.

In particular, as Breitbart News reported earlier on Monday, Donald Trump Jr.‚ÄîPresident Trump‚Äôs eldest son‚Äîput to bed any suggestion that Trump supporters should be thinking about sitting out the runoff elections in Georgia.

I‚Äôm seeing a lot of talk from people that are supposed to be on our side telling GOP voters not to go out & vote for @KLoeffler and @PerdueSenate. That is NONSENSE. IGNORE those people. We need ALL of our people coming out to vote for Kelly & David.#MAGA #GASEN ‚Äî Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) November 23, 2020

In response to the Breitbart News article, some of those on the right who had been hyping these concerns about Republicans sitting out the election‚Äîlike activist Ali Alexander, who‚Äôs been behind many of the #StopTheSteal rallies around the country‚Äîassured followers there is no division and Trump supporters will rally behind Loeffler and Perdue.

Trump Jr. Urges Georgians to Back Loeffler, Perdue in Senate Runoffs We will all work this out üá∫üá∏ https://t.co/rWNDXX7HlF ‚Äî Ali #StopTheSteal (@ali) November 23, 2020

We will all be on the same page by Jan 5th. Don‚Äôt attack Don Jr, Lin, me or anyone rowing in the same general direction. I don‚Äôt have time for people cashing in past personal vendettas. If you want to boost GOP Turnout take any action to secure our elections NOW! #ProTip ONWARDüá∫üá∏ ‚Äî Ali #StopTheSteal (@ali) November 23, 2020

Nationally syndicated radio host Rush Limbaugh also suggested on his program on Monday that Trump himself should head to Georgia to rally with the GOP Senators, as Vice President Mike Pence already has since the election. and others in Trump‚Äôs orbit have or intend to do soon.

The idea that Loeffler and Perdue have not stood with Trump all the way through this fight is on its face untrue. They both have issued statements in support of the president‚Äôs recount push and backed him at every turn‚Äîand again, the Trump administration knows this, which is why Pence held two rallies last week with the two senators.

When asked about these billboards from Democrats seeking to divide Republicans, the Georgia Republican Party dismissed them as ‚Äúdeceitful campaign tactics‚Äù designed to ‚Äúmanipulate voters.‚Äù

‚ÄúDemocrats are desperate to elect Radical Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff so they can implement Schumer and Pelosi‚Äôs radical socialist agenda, and unfortunately for Georgians, that includes deceitful campaign tactics to manipulate voters,‚Äù Georgia GOP spokeswoman Abigail Sigler told Breitbart News. ‚ÄúBut their attempts to divide Republicans are pointless. Georgians know that Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue continue to stand with our President.‚Äù

Really American PAC had tweeted the images of the planned billboards and a plea that linked to a fundraising page on ActBlue, the formal Democrat Party fundraising platform. When Breitbart News asked the organization for comment, the group declined‚Äîand then the original tweet disappeared.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre crowdfunding billboards in counties that went for Trump in Georgia to let Trump supporters know that the GA Republicans didn‚Äôt fight for them, they shouldn‚Äôt fight for Loeffler & Perdue,‚Äù the tweet read. It encouraged followers to retweet it, and ‚Äúchip in‚Äù to ‚Äúhelp get this done.‚Äù

As of publication of this article, though, the fundraising plea on ActBlue‚Äôs website is still active.

The ActBlue fundraising plea for the Really American PAC billboards goes even further than the tweet does in attempting to create and foment intra-GOP divisions to help the Democrats take the Senate.

The Democrats‚Äô fundraising website reads:

Trump supporters in Georgia are saying that because David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler couldn‚Äôt deliver a victory in Georgia for Trump, MAGA supporters should not deliver a victory for them in the run-off election. We agree. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre crowdfunding these billboards in the counties in Georgia that voted for Trump in the highest numbers: Georgia Republicans Didn‚Äôt Fight For Trump. We Won‚Äôt Fight For Them.

The battle in Georgia could determine a lot about the future of the country. If Biden does end up overcoming the election challenges from Trump and remains in the lead, then the GOP having a majority in the Senate would be a check on a Biden administration. If the Democrats did take control of the Senate, they would, even though they would have a very slim majority, control the floor and committees in such a scenario that the people of Georgia could stop if they reelect Sens. Perdue and Loeffler.

It remains to be seen what will happen, but Democrats are already aggressively pursuing these seats, as evidenced by this billboard campaign and by efforts that failed former gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams is leading to stuff as many absentee ballots into the public sphere as she can ahead of the election. Abrams bragged earlier on Monday about how, according to her claims, more than three quarters of a million such ballot requests had gone out already after the state began sending them out a few days ago.

Title: Georgia GOP Ad: If Americans Do Not Vote, Illegal Aliens Will
Author: ['John Binder']
Text:
A new ad by the Georgia Republican Party is stating that illegal aliens will earn the right to vote if Americans do not vote in the Senate runoff elections where Senators David Perdue (R-GA) and Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) are facing Democrat challengers.

An ad running in the state quotes Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) and failed Democrat gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams discussing changing the United States amid a ‚Äúblue wave.‚Äù

‚ÄúNow we take Georgia. Then we change America,‚Äù the ad quotes Schumer saying. ‚ÄúWhen the radicals say, ‚ÄòChange America,‚Äô this is what they mean: Opening the border, illegal immigrants voting, total Democrat control.‚Äù

When the radicals say ‚Äúchange America,‚Äù they mean: opening the border and allowing illegal immigrants voting. Georgia, go vote, because if you don‚Äôt, illegal immigrants will. pic.twitter.com/az2pKjnhNr ‚Äî GAGOP (@GaRepublicans) November 23, 2020

‚ÄúBut the thing of it is, the blue wave ‚Ä¶ is comprised of those who are documented and undocumented,‚Äù Abrams says in the ad.

‚ÄúSave Georgia. Save America,‚Äù the ad continues. ‚ÄúGo vote because if you don‚Äôt, illegal immigrants will.‚Äù

Abigail Sigler, a spokeswoman for the Georgia GOP called Perdue and Loeffler‚Äôs Democrat challengers, Raphael Warnock and Jon Osoff, ‚Äúradical,‚Äù with plans for amnesty to 11 to 22 million illegal aliens.

‚ÄúRadical Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff have made it clear they would go to Washington to be rubber stamps for Schumer‚Äôs extreme radical agenda, which includes giving illegal immigrants the right to vote,‚Äù Sigler said in a statement.

‚ÄúThe stakes in the election could not be higher, and Georgians who want to protect the American way of life we treasure must support Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue for Senate,‚Äù Sigler said.

Should the Georgia Senate seats flip, Democrats would have majorities in the House and Senate with a potential incoming Joe Biden administration. Earlier this year, House Democrats attempted to implement a quasi-amnesty for illegal aliens in the workforce in a coronavirus relief package, along with nationwide ballot harvesting.

John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter at @JxhnBinder.

Title: Jimmy Kimmel Mocks Maria Bartiromo: She‚Äôs ‚ÄòAuditioning‚Äô to Become Donald Trump‚Äôs Next Wife

Title: David Mamet Calls Out ‚ÄòExperts‚Äô and Questions Lockdowns: ‚ÄòThe Virus Here Is Government‚Äô
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Acclaimed playwright David Mamet has added his distinctive voice to the growing chorus of dissenters who are questioning the effectiveness of government-mandated masks and lockdowns to combat the coronavirus.

In a recent op-ed for the Wall Street Journal, the Glengarry Glen Ross playwright slams the so-called ‚Äúexperts‚Äù and advisers whose counsel has led to the destruction of large swaths of the U.S. economy. These people will likely never pay the price for their errors, but everyone else will, he noted.

‚ÄúThe virus here is government‚Äîor at least the incompetents who advise our rulers and cannot admit the legitimacy of dissension. Absent intervention, this virus may eventually kill the host organism,‚Äù Mamet wrote.

Those closest to the boss will have the most influence‚Äîand they often keep it, even in failure, writes David Mamet https://t.co/i9OVqCbQvQ ‚Äî WSJ Editorial Page (@WSJopinion) November 28, 2020

‚ÄúWe all have to trust others for their expertise, and we all make mistakes. The horror of a command economy is not that officials will make mistakes, but that those mistakes will never be acknowledged or corrected.‚Äù

The playwright noted that experts have issued contradictory messages about the effectiveness of masks, citing the prestigious New England Journal of Medicine that published an article saying masks are useless outside health-care facilities, only to issue a quasi-retraction.

He also cited the example of a friend who owns a restaurant and is going broke. ‚ÄúOne is ‚Äòpermitted‚Äô to sit at his tables and eat without a mask. Indeed, how would one eat while wearing one? Does the virus know that one is sitting down?‚Äù

David Mamet compares today‚Äôs coronavirus advisers to failed advisers of the past, citing the case of Prof. Frederick Lindemann, a confidant to Winston Churchill. During World War II, Lindemann downplayed the idea that the Germans were developing a rocket capable of bombing London, which became the V-2. He was wrong, but never paid a professional price for his mistake.

Mamet also cites Joseph Stalin‚Äôs science adviser, Trofim Lysenko, who came up with the idea of training crops to grow in winter. It was a disaster that contributed to mass starvation in communist Russia and China.

The playwright even brings up the debate around climate change. ‚ÄúNow we have climate change and its attendant alarmists,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThe news media, backed by those parts of the ‚Äòscientific community‚Äô the media chose to honor, presented this analysis as though it were indisputable fact. In fact, it was riddled with problems.‚Äù

Today, millions of people face economic ruin as a result of the coronavirus and the policies crafted by experts who are advising the government, he wrote.

‚ÄúA pandemic was allowed to destroy the American economy. Tens of millions are driven out of work, cover their faces, and walk down the streets in fear of their neighbors.‚Äù

Title: BBC Studios Imposes 20 Percent Diversity Quota on All New Productions
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
BBC Studios, the largest producer of content in Great Britain, is imposing a 20 percent diversity quota on all new productions in an apparent effort to boost the visibility of ethnic minorities, LGBTQ individuals, and people with disabilities.

The studio announced the quotas on Monday, saying in a press release that the new ‚Äúinclusion rider‚Äù is effective immediately and will apply to on-screen talent and well as behind-the-scenes staff on all new BBC and third-party U.K. commissions. The rider targets so-called ‚ÄúBAME‚Äù individuals ‚Äî black, Asian, minority ethnic people, as well as the disabled and low-income individuals.

‚ÄúThese initiatives are by no means a magic bullet and we‚Äôre also doing a lot of work on culture and education to make our teams more inclusive,‚Äù Ralph Lee, BBC Studios‚Äô director of content, said in a statement. ‚ÄúThe talent in front of and behind the camera will give perspectives that will shape our content, making it more authentic and universal in its depiction of our audiences ‚Äî and ultimately its appeal with them.‚Äù

BBC Studios said that LGBTQ talent won‚Äôt be eligible for off-screen quotas because the company ‚Äúhas already exceeded this target.‚Äù

Among the most popular shows from BBC Studios are Top Gear, Doctor Who, Good Omens, Luther, and the long-running EastEnders. The studio, which is the production arm of the BBC, also creates content for distributors around the world, including Amazon, Apple, and China Mobile.

The initiative is the latest move by the entertainment industry to impose diversity quotas on movies and TV shows. The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced in September that movies must reach certain quotas for women, ethnic minorities, disabled, and LGBTQ people if they are to be considered for the best picture Oscars category.

Follow David Ng on Twitter @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me at dng@breitbart.com

Title: Felicity Huffman Lands Lead in ABC Comedy Following Prison Sentence in College Admissions Bribery Scandal
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
Felicity Huffman is plotting her acting comeback, landing a lead role in an ABC baseball comedy. The role marks Huffman‚Äôs first major acting gig after she pled guilty to fraud stemming from her involvement in the 2019 college admissions scandal.

The comedy, according to a report by Deadline, will star Huffman as Susan Savage, the real-life owner of the minor-league baseball team The Sacramento River Cats. Savage inherited the Triple-A baseball team after her husband passed away.

Felicity Huffman will also executive produce the comedy alongside her co-star actor Zack Gottsagen.

‚ÄúAfter suddenly losing her husband and inheriting his beloved team, she is forced to navigate her new normal with the help of her dysfunctional family, including her oldest son (Gottsagen), a baseball devotee with Down syndrome, her work family and the Sacramento community at large,‚Äù reports Deadline. ‚ÄúThis is the story of a woman navigating grief, local politics and the business of sports and learning not just to adjust, but to thrive.

Last year, the Desperate Housewives actress pleaded guilty to a charge of conspiracy to commit mail fraud and honest services mail fraud. In addition to two weeks in jail, Huffman was also sentenced to a year of supervised release and was ordered to perform 250 hours of community service.

Title: Barbra Streisand Gushes: Biden Will ‚ÄòBring Back Dignity, Honesty, Intelligence, and Compassion‚Äô
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Barbra Streisand is ‚Äúexhilarated‚Äù about the prospect of Joe Biden becoming president, saying that Biden will ‚Äúbring back dignity, honesty, intelligence and compassion to the Oval Office.‚Äù

The Oscar-winning Hollywood leftist also bashed President Donald Trump in an interview with the New York Times, calling him a liar and blaming him for the loss of ‚Äúthousands of lives.‚Äù The accusation is one that Streisand has repeatedly made on social media, having previously claimed that President Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúincompetence and lies‚Äù are responsible for thousands of coronavirus fatalities.

In her talk with the Time‚Äôs T style magazine, Barbra Streisand expressed her thrill at the possibility of Joe Biden, who recently broke his foot, taking office. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm exhilarated ‚Ä¶ [He] will bring back dignity, honesty, intelligence and compassion to the Oval Office. I look forward to that.‚Äù

Neither Streisand nor the Times reporter brought up the Hunter Biden scandal or Tara Reade‚Äôs sexual assault allegations against the presidential hopeful.The singer-actress was a major supporter of Biden‚Äôs campaign, participating in several Hollywood fundraisers for the Democratic candidate.

‚ÄúWhat do I hate most about Trump? He lies every day,‚Äù she told the Times. ‚ÄúHe has the compulsion to lie, even when the facts say something different. The worst lie was about the pandemic. Why not face facts? Why not tell the truth? People are stronger than you think ‚Äî they can handle the truth. It would have saved thousands of lives.‚Äù

Streisand didn‚Äôt clarify her allegation claiming that the president has lied about the pandemic. She can explain why she supports what she does. That‚Äôs what‚Äôs persuasive.‚Äù

Pelosi continued: ‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt have to do this‚Ä¶ She does it out of patriotism. She loves our country.‚Äù

Streisand also told the Times that she reached out to the daughter of George Floyd shortly after he died while in Minneapolis policy custody, setting off race riots around the country.

Streisand said she sent six-year-old Gianna some shares of Disney stock, along with a letter in which she recounted how she also lost her father at a young age.

‚ÄúI think our dads watch over us forever,‚Äù Streisand wrote, according to the Times. ‚ÄúWhen you get older and have a decision to make ‚Ä¶ just close your eyes and ask him for help. And if you listen very carefully, he will lead you to the right choice. I promise!‚Äù
