Title: David Mamet Calls Out ‚ÄòExperts‚Äô and Questions Lockdowns: ‚ÄòThe Virus Here Is Government‚Äô
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Acclaimed playwright David Mamet has added his distinctive voice to the growing chorus of dissenters who are questioning the effectiveness of government-mandated masks and lockdowns to combat the coronavirus.

In a recent op-ed for the Wall Street Journal, the Glengarry Glen Ross playwright slams the so-called ‚Äúexperts‚Äù and advisers whose counsel has led to the destruction of large swaths of the U.S. economy. These people will likely never pay the price for their errors, but everyone else will, he noted.

‚ÄúThe virus here is government‚Äîor at least the incompetents who advise our rulers and cannot admit the legitimacy of dissension. Absent intervention, this virus may eventually kill the host organism,‚Äù Mamet wrote.

Those closest to the boss will have the most influence‚Äîand they often keep it, even in failure, writes David Mamet https://t.co/i9OVqCbQvQ ‚Äî WSJ Editorial Page (@WSJopinion) November 28, 2020

‚ÄúWe all have to trust others for their expertise, and we all make mistakes. The horror of a command economy is not that officials will make mistakes, but that those mistakes will never be acknowledged or corrected.‚Äù

The playwright noted that experts have issued contradictory messages about the effectiveness of masks, citing the prestigious New England Journal of Medicine that published an article saying masks are useless outside health-care facilities, only to issue a quasi-retraction.

He also cited the example of a friend who owns a restaurant and is going broke. ‚ÄúOne is ‚Äòpermitted‚Äô to sit at his tables and eat without a mask. Indeed, how would one eat while wearing one? Does the virus know that one is sitting down?‚Äù

David Mamet compares today‚Äôs coronavirus advisers to failed advisers of the past, citing the case of Prof. Frederick Lindemann, a confidant to Winston Churchill. During World War II, Lindemann downplayed the idea that the Germans were developing a rocket capable of bombing London, which became the V-2. He was wrong, but never paid a professional price for his mistake.

Mamet also cites Joseph Stalin‚Äôs science adviser, Trofim Lysenko, who came up with the idea of training crops to grow in winter. It was a disaster that contributed to mass starvation in communist Russia and China.

The playwright even brings up the debate around climate change. ‚ÄúNow we have climate change and its attendant alarmists,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThe news media, backed by those parts of the ‚Äòscientific community‚Äô the media chose to honor, presented this analysis as though it were indisputable fact. In fact, it was riddled with problems.‚Äù

Today, millions of people face economic ruin as a result of the coronavirus and the policies crafted by experts who are advising the government, he wrote.

‚ÄúA pandemic was allowed to destroy the American economy. Tens of millions are driven out of work, cover their faces, and walk down the streets in fear of their neighbors.‚Äù

Title: Felicity Huffman Lands Lead in ABC Comedy Following Prison Sentence in College Admissions Bribery Scandal
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
Felicity Huffman is plotting her acting comeback, landing a lead role in an ABC baseball comedy. The role marks Huffman‚Äôs first major acting gig after she pled guilty to fraud stemming from her involvement in the 2019 college admissions scandal.

The comedy, according to a report by Deadline, will star Huffman as Susan Savage, the real-life owner of the minor-league baseball team The Sacramento River Cats. Savage inherited the Triple-A baseball team after her husband passed away.

Felicity Huffman will also executive produce the comedy alongside her co-star actor Zack Gottsagen.

‚ÄúAfter suddenly losing her husband and inheriting his beloved team, she is forced to navigate her new normal with the help of her dysfunctional family, including her oldest son (Gottsagen), a baseball devotee with Down syndrome, her work family and the Sacramento community at large,‚Äù reports Deadline. ‚ÄúThis is the story of a woman navigating grief, local politics and the business of sports and learning not just to adjust, but to thrive.

Last year, the Desperate Housewives actress pleaded guilty to a charge of conspiracy to commit mail fraud and honest services mail fraud. In addition to two weeks in jail, Huffman was also sentenced to a year of supervised release and was ordered to perform 250 hours of community service.

Title: BBC Studios Imposes 20 Percent Diversity Quota on All New Productions
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
BBC Studios, the largest producer of content in Great Britain, is imposing a 20 percent diversity quota on all new productions in an apparent effort to boost the visibility of ethnic minorities, LGBTQ individuals, and people with disabilities.

The studio announced the quotas on Monday, saying in a press release that the new ‚Äúinclusion rider‚Äù is effective immediately and will apply to on-screen talent and well as behind-the-scenes staff on all new BBC and third-party U.K. commissions. The rider targets so-called ‚ÄúBAME‚Äù individuals ‚Äî black, Asian, minority ethnic people, as well as the disabled and low-income individuals.

‚ÄúThese initiatives are by no means a magic bullet and we‚Äôre also doing a lot of work on culture and education to make our teams more inclusive,‚Äù Ralph Lee, BBC Studios‚Äô director of content, said in a statement. ‚ÄúThe talent in front of and behind the camera will give perspectives that will shape our content, making it more authentic and universal in its depiction of our audiences ‚Äî and ultimately its appeal with them.‚Äù

BBC Studios said that LGBTQ talent won‚Äôt be eligible for off-screen quotas because the company ‚Äúhas already exceeded this target.‚Äù

Among the most popular shows from BBC Studios are Top Gear, Doctor Who, Good Omens, Luther, and the long-running EastEnders. The studio, which is the production arm of the BBC, also creates content for distributors around the world, including Amazon, Apple, and China Mobile.

The initiative is the latest move by the entertainment industry to impose diversity quotas on movies and TV shows. The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced in September that movies must reach certain quotas for women, ethnic minorities, disabled, and LGBTQ people if they are to be considered for the best picture Oscars category.

Title: Nolte: Coronavirus Speeds Up the Napster-ization of Movies
Author: ['John Nolte']
Text:
Back in 1999, Napster killed the music business forever. And now what happened to music 20 years ago is happening to the movie business ‚Äî and that is a critical piece of analysis missing from this piece from the far-left New York Times looking at the demise of films.

Napster annihilated the music business when it took music digital and got everyone used to not paying much of anything for music. Who‚Äôs going to pay for music after you‚Äôre used to not paying for it?

Worse though, Napster cheapened music. Not to go all In my day on everyone, but there‚Äôs a reason why the biggest music names touring the past few years are almost all aged 80 to 40. Elton John, Metallica, Fleetwood Mac, the Rolling Stones, KISS, Cher, Garth Brooks, Bob Seger, Phil Collins, Bruce Springsteen, Billy Joel, Pink, Eminem, Journey, Def Leppard, U2, Sting, Backstreet Boys, Scorpions, Rod Stewart, Celine Dion, Guns n‚Äô Roses, Justin Timberlake. Sure, Ariana Grande is on the list. I‚Äôm sure a Beyonce or Taylor Swift can fill a venue, but this is like growing up in the 80s and 90s and the biggest grossing tours are Bill Haley and the Comets, the Platters, the Four Seasons, Paul Anka, and Frankie Avalon.

In my day ‚Äî sorry to do that to you again ‚Äî new music was a big deal. You didn‚Äôt hit a button on your Spotify account to listen to it. You saved your money. You went out and bought the album. You recorded the album on cassette so you wouldn‚Äôt wear out the vinyl and could listen to it in your car. You put on headphones. Laid down on the bed. Listened to both sides, and when you flipped it over you were careful not to touch anything but the edges, and then you stared at the album cover the whole time ‚Äî read the liner notes. Then your friends came over. You listened to it again and again, talked about it, and waited to see what the first top 40 single would be.

There‚Äôs none of that now. Music is just a commodity today, a product, and oftentimes a product used to sell another product. You listen, you move on. The specialness is gone. The sense that a new release is meaningful is gone. Worse still, the sense the art itself is meaningful, that it speaks to you in some way, is gone. It‚Äôs all just disposable junk now. That, by the way, is not my commentary on the quality of today‚Äôs music, but how people perceive music today.

Music is now just something else on the Internet, like a YouTube video or tweet or blog post. What used to fill a meaningful gap in people‚Äôs lives now just fills four minutes of their time.

This is what‚Äôs going to happen to movies, and what has been happening to movies for a long while now‚Ä¶

And when I talk about movies, I‚Äôm talking about movie-movies, not TV movies.

I really enjoyed Martin Scorsese‚Äôs The Irishman, but it was a made-for-TV movie (Netflix) and is therefore a TV movie‚Äì a point I‚Äôll circle back to in a bit. But let‚Äôs first look at how Hollywood had already cheapened the art, even before the coronavirus hit‚Ä¶

When movies were still around what were they? It was all CGI and spectacle and a big roller coaster ride. Except for cheapie horror, movies had become one big and bloated $400 million gamble after another, and with Marvel having run its course with the Avengers, and Disney running out of cartoons to bring to real (CGI) life and the DC brand running more cold than hot, and the Fast and Furious crew about to qualify for AARP, the movie business was already about to hit a wall and was already becoming something hollow and forgettable.

Sure, some of these movies are a good time, but so is reading Twitter and watching YouTube.

Art is more than a good time. It stays with you, affects you, maybe even changes you; it inspires you, makes you think, makes you want to re-experience it thinking you might have missed a deeper meaning that first time. Yeah, sure, there are exceptions that tell a human story, a Once Upon a Time in Hollywood or Ford v. Ferrari, but those are exceptions. Rare exceptions.

I just wonder, now that the coronavirus has shut the movie business down, are people really missing it?

And now that the coronavirus is forcing blockbuster movies like Soul and Wonder Woman 1984 and Coming to America 2 and Mulan and a whole bunch of others to go direct to streaming, that means the movies are one step closer to Napster-izing themselves. All these movies are going to go the route of The Irishman ‚Äî cheapened and lost in the literal bottomless black hole that is Netflix‚Äôs (or whoever‚Äôs) endless selection.

We watch the Irishman and Hillbilly Elegy and countless others just like them as though they are commodities, time fillers, and with streaming blowing up like it has, with it becoming a primary source of income for the studios, we‚Äôre going to see a whole lot more movies cheapened in the same way ‚Äî most of them, in fact.

And no, it‚Äôs not like when a movie would premier on TV before there was home video, which used to be a big deal, an event. Or when a movie premiered on home video, which was also something to get excited over. Because those movies had been in theaters, so they came with that imprimatur, and that imprimatur meant something. And they were more than just a video game or roller coaster ride brought to life.

Now, no matter how good or great it is, countless movies (and more are coming) are dumped in the massive universe of the streaming carousel, just another digital product, just another tweet, just another YouTube video to fill your day.

Music used to be special. Now it‚Äôs not.

Movies used to be special, and now they are less so every day.

Title: Nolte: Coronavirus Catastrophe at Thanksgiving Box Office
Author: ['John Nolte']
Text:
The Croods: New Age, the top movie over the Thanksgiving weekend, grossed a terrible $14.2 million. That was over the five-day weekend ‚Äî meaning Wednesday through Sunday. Over three days (Friday- Sunday), it grossed just $9.7 million.

A good faith look at the top ten movies over Thanksgiving weekend finds that they did not top $20 million total. What I mean is that all ten movies did not bring in more than $20 million together. Three of the movies in the top ten are old enough to drive: Elf (2003), The Santa Clause (1994), and Christmas Vacation (1989).

What‚Äôs interesting, though, is that Croods: New Age bottomed out with just $14.2 million over five days, even though it was released in 2,211 theaters. That‚Äôs a lot of theaters. Granted, that‚Äôs about half the number of theaters it would have been released into in pre-coronavirus America but that‚Äôs still a sizable number of theaters, enough theaters ‚Äî even with social distancing, to gross a respectable amount, which tells me that even though theaters are open near them, people are still not going to the movies.

For example, last Thanksgiving, Frozen II was playing on 4,440 screens and grossed $34.1 million on Thanksgiving Day alone. Just on that one day. Over that five day weekend, it cleared $110 million on only twice as many screens as the Croods. I should also point out that was Frozen II‚Äôs second weekend, not its opening weekend.

So the number of screens is not the problem in the age of the coronavirus. The problem is that people aren‚Äôt going to the movies even where they can go to the movies.

The horror film Freaky, in its third week of release, grossed just $1.1 million in 1,735 theaters. Over the course of its run, it‚Äôs grossed just $7 million, so social distancing or not, it is playing to very, very empty houses.

Keep in mind that movie theaters are only open in areas where the government is telling people it is safe to go to the movies, where movies theaters are practicing social distancing. Nevertheless, people still aren‚Äôt going.

People who can go to the movies are not going to the movies.

No wonder Hollywood is worried.

Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.

I think they need to stage some sort of intervention at this point because he is now damaging the Republican Party even further with all of this rhetoric.‚Äù

Title: Music Festivals Offer to Put on Mass Vaccinations in Belgium
Author: ['Breitbart London']
Text:
BRUSSELS (AP) ‚Äì With nothing on their agendas for months to come, music festival organizers in Belgium want to use their know-how to help the country‚Äôs coronavirus vaccination campaign.

The Belgian government has set a goal of vaccinating about 70% of the country‚Äôs population, about 8 million people, when approved COVID-19 vaccination shots become available.

As the vaccines are expected to arrive in multi-dose vials for shots to be administered all on the same day, Belgium health authorities are planning to vaccinate people in groups as much as possible. The task will pose many logistical challenges, including the creation of vaccination centers that festival organizers say they can help set up.

Enjoying a strong reputation in the music world, Belgian festival experts have proven experience in both building huge pop-up structures and in crowd management.

With the music industry hit hard by the pandemic‚Äôs economic, several festivals in the French-speaking region of Wallonia and the Brussels area have created a federation to better defend their interests. They have a large network of technicians who are currently unemployed and are ready to help out.

‚ÄúOur sector has been at a standstill for many months, and our many staff are eager to bring their creativity and dedication to the fight against coronavirus,‚Äù said federation president Damien Dufrasne.

One of the hardest-hit countries in Europe, Belgium has reported some 577,000 confirmed cases and more than 16,500 deaths linked to the virus.

Last week, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said COVID-19 vaccinations could start in the European Union‚Äôs 27 nations before the end of December. The commission, the EU¬¥s executive arm, has agreements with six potential vaccine suppliers and is working on a seventh contract. The deals allow it to purchase over 1.2 billion doses, more than double the population of the EU.

Belgian Police Will Knock on Doors at Christmas to Enforce Coronavirus Rules https://t.co/tj1ve4vR5x ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) November 24, 2020

Title: Delingpole: Laurence Fox Has Lunch with Friends. Quick! Fine Him!
Author: ['James Delingpole']
Text:
Actor turned political activist Laurence Fox is in trouble again.

He enjoyed a lunch with friends, gave them hugs, then boasted about it on Twitter.

Here is the shocking proof:

Just had a large group over to lunch and we hugged and ate and talked and put the world to rights. It was lovely. You‚Äôll never take that away from people. Stay out. Protect your rights. If the @nhs can‚Äôt cope, then the @nhs isn‚Äôt fit for purpose. Compliance is violence. ‚Äî Laurence Fox (@LozzaFox) November 29, 2020

In a decade or so‚Äôs time, when historians look back on the madness of 2020, they are going to examine tweets like this in a state of utter disbelief.

‚ÄúCan it really be that in 2020 the very act of having lunch with a bunch of people, talking to them and hugging them was considered to be something dangerously reactionary and irresponsible?‚Äù they‚Äôll ask.

And for confirmation, they‚Äôll only have to look at some of the responses.

Here‚Äôs a snitch called Darryl ‚Äî one of several ‚Äî who wants to report Fox to the police and land him a ¬£10,000 fine.

@metpoliceuk Hello. I‚Äôd like to report a breach of the lockdown guidelines. Please ensure Mr Fox gets his ¬£10,000 fine. ‚Äî DarryI (@DarrylInnes) November 29, 2020

And here are a few more examples of the furious comments Fox received.

Get fucked, you desperate, deranged, narcissistic gusset stain. I hope your sprouts get overcooked to mush and that the copy of The Wicker Man you put on your Christmas list turns out to be the Nicolas Cage remake. Dear oh dear, I can‚Äôt quite believe the sheer nerve of this. I am an actor, currently working within the NHS on a Covid contract to keep the wolf from the door until our industry recovers. Just can‚Äôt quite believe the brazen lack of respect for what is right. And when one of that group falls ill and they and their family suffers as have people I have known, remember your freedom. Lets hope it‚Äôs not when you are on a ventilator. Exceptionalism is not a vaccine Laurence. I know people who‚Äôve died, people I loved. I‚Äôm currently Covid positive, it‚Äôs real, it‚Äôs awful. Messages like this, some people will listen and relax their guard. You could kill people. One of the people you hugged, you could have killed them. It‚Äôs bleak, but true. THINK. Wasn‚Äôt going to get involved with the Laurence Fox stuff, but now he‚Äôs bragging about putting my family at risk, I figure why not. I was once up against him for a US TV role ‚Äì to play the son of James Fox‚Äôs character. As in, Laurence‚Äôs actual dad. I got it.

There are many more in this vein. What they reveal, I fear, is that Britain is even more bitterly divided than ever it was during Brexit: between those who believe that Covid-19 is a deadly threat which could easily kill off their nearest and dearest and those, like Fox, who believe that it has been horribly overblown by government propaganda and that the time has come for us all to get on with our lives, reclaim our freedoms and get the economy back up and running.

The two positions are so intractably opposed that it‚Äôs hard to see how they can easily be resolved, especially when there‚Äôs so much righteous indignation on both sides.

But let‚Äôs take a step back for a moment. In what kind of sane universe would it be possible for a man to attract so much rage, so much bitter hatred merely for the crime of enjoying a lunch with friends.

Before 2020 it would have been literally inconceivable that anyone could consider the act of having lunch with friends anything but a healthy, happy, and perhaps above all, unexceptionable activity. It wouldn‚Äôt have been a problem at the height of either of the two World Wars. It wouldn‚Äôt even have been considered a problem during the Bubonic Plague.

I‚Äôd say all those angry hotheads bloviating against Laurence Fox need to look in the mirror and ask themselves: ‚ÄúWhat have I become?‚Äù

And Boris Johnson‚Äôs administration needs to look at itself too and ask: ‚ÄúWhat kind of monster have I created?‚Äù

Title: Actor Laverne Cox Claims to Be Victim of Transphobic Attack in L.A.
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
Transgender actor Laverne Cox detailed an attack in which the Orange Is the New Black star‚Äôs friend was apparently beaten by a man who ‚Äúvery aggressively asked for the time‚Äù in Los Angeles.

‚ÄúThe guy was hitting my friend,‚Äù said Cox, who explained in a ten-minute Instagram video what had allegedly happened while the actor and a friend went for a walk in Griffith Park. ‚ÄúWe passed this guy, and the guy very aggressively asked for the time,‚Äù said Cox, describing the lead-up to the fight between the stranger and the actor‚Äôs friend.

Watch Below:

View this post on Instagram A post shared by laverne cox (@lavernecox)

‚ÄúThe friend that I‚Äôm with looks at his watch and tells him the time, and then the guy who asked for the time says to my friend, ‚ÄòGuy or girl?'‚Äù said Cox. ‚ÄúMy friend says, ‚ÄòFuck off.'‚Äù

After that brief exchange, Cox‚Äôs friend and the stranger proceed to fight, according to Cox.

‚ÄúAll of the sudden, the guy is attacking my friend, and I look back ‚Äî and the guy is, like, hitting my friend, and then my friend is, like, going towards him, and I‚Äôm, like, ‚Äòholy shit,‚Äô and I pull out my phone, and I call 911 ‚Äî to dial 911, and all of the sudden it‚Äôs over,‚Äù said Cox. ‚ÄúAnd the guy is gone, and so I put my phone away, and then I‚Äôm like, what just happened? It just happened really quickly.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not safe in the world,‚Äù Cox affirmed. ‚ÄúAnd I don‚Äôt like to think about that a lot, but it‚Äôs the truth. It‚Äôs the truth and it‚Äôs not safe if you‚Äôre a trans person. Obviously, I know this well. It‚Äôs just really sad.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat my friend thinks is that the guy really wanted me to answer so he could, like, you know, spook whether, like, you know, I‚Äôm trans or not,‚Äù said Cox. ‚ÄúDefinitely in shock, definitely triggered,‚Äù said Cox, who added that this type of incident has ‚Äúhappened a lot.‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, it doesn‚Äôt always come to blows,‚Äù the actor elaborated. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt always get physical, but yeah ‚Äî I‚Äôve had a long history of street harassment in New York, sort of being clocked or spooked, and, you know, sort of called out on the street or whatever. And I just can‚Äôt believe that, like, it got physical. I guess I can believe it.‚Äù

The Charlie‚Äôs Angels actor hadn‚Äôt been leaving the house in general due to the coronavirus pandemic, and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna stay inside now, I‚Äôm really not going to go out now. Living in fear is, like, not a good thing. It doesn‚Äôt matter who you are, you can be, like, Laverne Cox ‚Äî if you‚Äôre trans, you‚Äôre gonna experience stuff like this.‚Äù

Cox concluded the 10-minute video by stating that it‚Äôs important to remember ‚Äúit‚Äôs not your fault‚Äù if other people attack you because they don‚Äôt want you to ‚Äúexist in the world‚Äù due to being transgender.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for me to remind myself, and remind you that when these things happen, it‚Äôs not your fault,‚Äù said Cox. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not your fault that there are people who are not cool with you existing in the world.‚Äù

Cox‚Äôs received support from many celebrities who commented on the video.

Actress Jamie Chung was among the celebrities who commented, writing: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry you and your friend were attacked. This is infuriating. I hope he was reported and you gave them his description.‚Äù

Cox did not specify whether or not 911 was called and if there was a police report filed.

Title: James Corden: Trump Jokes Are About ‚ÄòGood Versus Evil‚Äô
Author: ['Pam Key']
Text:
CBS‚Äôs ‚ÄúLate Late Show‚Äù host James Corden said Sunday during an interview with ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù that he thinks of jokes about President Donald Trump and his administration as ‚Äúgood versus evil.‚Äù

Corden said, ‚ÄúI will say that as time‚Äôs gone on, as we‚Äôve been living under this administration, I don‚Äôt even consider it to be politics. I consider it to be right and wrong. I consider it to be good versus evil.‚Äù

That‚Äôs really what we love to do. And I‚Äôll really stop at nothing to try. It may not always work, but I‚Äôll give it my best shot, you know?‚Äù

Title: London: Pop Star Rita Ora Hit with Fines for Lavish Birthday Party
Author: ['Ben Kew']
Text:
British pop star Rita Ora has admitted to a ‚Äúserious error of judgement‚Äù after she was busted for hosting a lavish 30th birthday party for herself at her restaurant in London.

According to the Daily Mail, the ‚ÄúHot Right Now‚Äù singer invited at least seven friends to the bash at the Casa Cruz restaurant in Notting Hill where they partied ‚Äúuntil the early hours‚Äù of Sunday morning.

After being alerted to the possible infringement of Britain‚Äôs nationwide lockdown measures, the London Metropolitan Police attempted to gain access to the venue at around 9pm on Saturday evening, but with no success.

However, officers continued their investigation into whether an event was taking place, and reportedly slapped Ora with a ¬£10,000 fine for her flouting of the lockdown rules. Ora has since acknowledged her mistake, describing it as a ‚Äúserious and inexcusable error of judgement.‚Äù

‚ÄúHello all, I attended a small gathering with some friends to celebrate my 30th birthday,‚Äù she posted on her Instagram story as reports began to hit the media. ‚ÄúIt was a spur of the moment decision made with the misguided view that we were coming out of lockdown and this would be OK. I‚Äôm deeply sorry for breaking the rules and in turn understand that this puts people at risk.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis was a serious and inexcusable error of judgement,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúGiven the restrictions, I realise how irresponsible these actions were and I take full responsibility.‚Äù

A source close to Ora told the Mail: ‚ÄúRita knows her actions were wrong which is why she has voluntarily paid the ¬£10,000 ($13,367 USD) fine to the council. She hopes this will go some way to making up for her error of judgement.‚Äù

Ora‚Äôs ignoring of the rules follows countless reports of celebrities and public officials urging the public to abide by lockdown measures imposed as a response to the Chinese coronavirus before being caught violating the rules themselves.

Earlier this month, the cast and crew of the upcoming Matrix 4 film reportedly skirted Germany‚Äôs ban on parties and large social gatherings by throwing a party scene within the movie.

According to the newspaper Dild, the some 200 actors and production crew attending the bash at the Studio Babelsberg in Potsdam, Berlin, enjoyed everything from a DJ and pyrotechnics to tattoo stations and food caravans handing out sushi and fancy desserts.

In August, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo allowed musicians and celebrities to skirt the state‚Äôs mandatory 14-day quarantine rules so that they could perform at the MTV Video Music Awards.

Title: UK Govt. Says ‚ÄòThe Crown‚Äô Viewers Should Be Warned Netflix Show Is Fiction, Not Fact
Author: ['Simon Kent']
Text:
The UK culture secretary wants the creators behind the TV series ‚ÄòThe Crown,‚Äô based on the lives of the Royal Family, to include a warning for viewers up front indicating the show is fiction and not a factual documentary.

‚ÄúI fear a generation of viewers who did not live through these events may mistake fiction for fact,‚Äù Oliver Dowden told the Mail on Sunday.

‚ÄúWithout this, I fear a generation of viewers who did not live through these events may mistake fiction for fact.‚Äù

Dowden is expected to write to Netflix this week to express his view. Netflix did not immediately respond to a request for comment, according to a report by The Associated Press.

The fourth series of the drama, which stars Olivia Colman as the Queen, has attracted criticism from some quarters for its depiction of royal events, in particular the breakdown of the marriage of the Prince and Princess of Wales.

The Mail on Sunday has led calls for a disclaimer to be added to the series lest people think they are watching a documentary rather than an interpretative piece of fiction.

Final Volume of Thatcher's Authorised Biography Confirms 'Iron Lady' Backed #Brexit https://t.co/1h2LUe73xG ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) September 28, 2019

Earl Spencer, brother of the late Diana, Princess of Wales, previously told ITV‚Äôs Lorraine Kelly he was worried some viewers would take the storylines ‚Äúas gospel,‚Äù the BBC reports.

‚ÄúI think it would help ‚ÄòThe Crown‚Äô an enormous amount if, at the beginning of each episode, it stated that: ‚ÄòThis isn‚Äôt true but it is based around some real events‚Äô,‚Äù he said.

Title: Report: NHS Will Use 'Sensible' Celebrities to Front Vaccines Campaign
Author: ['Jack Montgomery']
Text:
Britain‚Äôs National Health Service (NHS) will launch a campaign fronted by ‚Äúvery sensible‚Äù celebrities to persuade people to take coronavirus vaccines, according to reports.

‚ÄúThere will be a big national campaign [to drive take-up],‚Äù a source told the Guardian.

‚ÄúNHS England are looking for famous faces, people who are known and loved. It could be celebrities who are very sensible and have done sensible stuff during the pandemic.‚Äù

The left-wing newspaper says Marcus Rashford, a professional football player who has been harrying the government over issues such as free school meals in recent months, is one of the names being considered.

100 million doses of the Oxford University/AstraZeneca vaccine have been ordered by Boris Johnson‚Äôs government, along with several million American-made vaccines

The Guardian reports that the NHS is seeking to recruit ‚Äúairline cabin crew, firefighters and the jobless‚Äù by the ‚Äútens of thousands‚Äù to administer vaccines via a Kitchener-style ‚ÄòYour NHS needs you‚Äô recruitment drive.

Sadiq Khan Demands Minorities Get Preferential Access to Coronavirus Vaccines https://t.co/uKn6Pp9YbN ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) November 19, 2020

‚ÄúIt will be vital that there are clear culturally-tailored communications delivered by trusted local and community leaders, and targeted at the most vulnerable and harder-to-reach communities, and that it is made easy for these populations to access vaccination,‚Äù remarked Dr Penelope Toff, who co-chairs the public health medicine committee of the British Medical Association (BMA).

There is concern in some quarters that black and minority ethnic (BAME) people, who are being infected by the Chinese virus at a disproportionate rate, may be particularly reluctant to be vaccinated, with the chief executive of St George‚Äôs hospital trust in London, Jacqueline Totterdell, saying she thinks that ‚Äúthere is a lot of anxiety [among staff], and some of the polls we‚Äôve done around south-west London show that as little as 50 per cent of people are willing just to have it without any [assurance about its safety].‚Äù

‚ÄúWe might all think people might be rushing to have it, but actually we might find that‚Äôs not quite the case,‚Äù she added.

Title: Celebrity-Backed Time‚Äôs Up Spent Big on Executive Salaries, Little on Victims of Sexual Harassment
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Time‚Äôs Up, the anti-sexual harassment organization created by Hollywood celebrities in the wake of the Harvey Weinstein scandal, has spent big bucks on executive salaries but has skimped on helping actual victims, according to a new report.

The group raised an impressive $3,670,219 during its founding year of 2018, but spent $1,407,032 on salaries and just $312,001 on the Time‚Äôs Up Legal Defense Fund for victims of sexual harassment, the New York Post reported, citing tax filings.

In addition, the group reportedly spent tens of thousands of dollars on advertising, and $940,328 on ‚Äúlegal‚Äù costs, with the bulk of that figure going to Arnold & Porter Kaye Scholer, the multinational law firm.

Time‚Äôs Up boasts a slew of Hollywood celebrities and former Obama associates in leadership roles. The group‚Äôs governing board includes former Obama senior adviser Valerie Jarrett, mega TV producer Shonda Rhimes, CNN personality Ana Navarro, as well as actresses Eva Longoria and Ashley Judd.

Tina Tchen, who served as an assistant to former President Obama and chief of staff for Michelle Obama, is currently Time‚Äôs Up president and chief executive officer. She is also co-founder of the Time‚Äôs Up Legal Defense Fund.

The Time‚Äôs Up Foundation‚Äôs ‚Äúglobal leadership board‚Äù includes a bevy of celebrities including Jessica Chastain, Brie Larson, Amy Schumer, Reese Witherspoon, Alyssa Milano, Julianne Moore, Mira Sorvino, and Padma Lakshmi. Oprah Winfrey serves as a ‚Äúvisionary ambassador‚Äù for the group.

The Post reported that Time‚Äôs Up spent $58,395 on travel and $112,435 on Rally, a public relations firm, during 2018. Charity watchdog groups recommend that non-profits spend 75 percent of their revenue on their mission and 25 percent on administration. Time‚Äôs Up spent 38 percent on salaries alone, according to the Post.

Last year, Time‚Äôs Up experienced a leadership shake-up after sexual harassment allegations were made against the son of then-president Lisa Borders. Tina Tchen succeeded Borders as the head of the group.

Title: David Prowse, British Weightlifter Who Played Darth Vader, Passes Away
Author: ['Breitbart London']
Text:
LONDON (AP) ‚Äì Dave Prowse, the British weightlifter-turned-actor who played Darth Vader in the original Star Wars trilogy, has died. He was 85.

Prowse died Saturday after a short illness, his agent Thomas Bowington said Sunday.

Born in Bristol, southwest England, in 1935, Prowse represented England in weightlifting at the Commonwealth Games in the 1950s before breaking into movies with roles that emphasized his commanding size, including Frankenstein‚Äôs monster in a pair of horror films.

Director George Lucas saw Prowse in a small part in ‚ÄúA Clockwork Orange‚Äù and asked the 6-foot-6-inch (2-metre) actor to audition for the villainous Vader or the Wookie Chewbacca in Star Wars.

Prowse later told the BBC he chose Darth Vader because ‚Äúyou always remember the bad guys.‚Äù

Physically, Prowse was perfect for the part. His lilting English West Country accent was considered less ideal, and his lines were dubbed by James Earl Jones.

Prowse was also known to a generation of British children as the Green Cross Code Man, a superhero in a series of road safety advertisements

Ant-Man director Edgar Wright paid tribute to Prowse on Twitter.

‚ÄúAs a kid Dave Prowse couldn‚Äôt be more famous to me; stalking along corridors as evil incarnate in the part of Darth Vader & stopping a whole generation of kiddies from being mown down in street as the Green Cross Code man,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúRest in Peace, Bristol‚Äôs finest.‚Äù

Title: Jon Voight Warns ‚ÄòWe Are in Great Danger if We Fall Under a Biden Administration‚Äô

Title: Actor Faizon Love Sues Universal for Cutting Black Stars Out of ‚ÄòCouples Retreat‚Äô Publicity Posters
Author: ['Alana Mastrangelo']
Text:
Actor Faizon Love is suing Universal Studios for cutting him and his fellow black co-star Kali Hawk out of international publicity posters for the 2009 film, Couples Retreat.

The 52-year-old actor filed a lawsuit on Wednesday stating that he was ‚Äúaghast‚Äù when he saw himself and Hawk removed from publicity posters overseas, according to a report by The Hollywood Reporter.

‚ÄúUniversal Studios had no problem featuring Black actors in the comedic film. But when it came to publicizing the film to international audiences, Universal Studios chose to segregate the motion picture‚Äôs White and Black actors‚Ä¶‚Äù the lawsuit states. ‚ÄúRather than enjoy maximum visibility with the film‚Äôs release, Mr. Love was demoted to the proverbial ‚ÄòInvisible Man,‚Äô as penned by Ralph Ellison,‚Äù the complaint continued, referring to Ralph Ellison‚Äôs civil rights novel.

‚ÄúAlthough Couples Retreat achieved a first-place box office opening weekend ranking, and went on a spectacular run that grossed more than $171 million worldwide, Universal Studios placed Mr. Love in the back seat of the ride enjoyed by his six White costars,‚Äù the suit added.

Universal Studios had apologized when the doctored poster was first exposed, and according to Love, went on to promise him ‚Äúlucrative, career-making film roles‚Äù in the future, which he says have never materialized.

The lawsuit also accuses Universal of fraud, breach of contract, and violation of California‚Äôs fair employment act and civil rights law.

The suit goes on to accuse the film‚Äôs lead actor Vince Vaughn of telling Love ‚Äúthat making a big deal about his removal from the poster would not be good for his career.‚Äù

Love explained his reasoning for filing the lawsuit more than a decade after the film‚Äôs release in a tweet on Thursday.

‚ÄúPeople ask why now? One because Universal is still using the edited poster to promote the movie overseas, two no one said any thing when they went back ten years and ask [Kevin Hart] to explain his ‚Äòtweet‚Äô that kept him from hosting the Oscars‚Ä¶ not one person said why now‚Ä¶‚Äù wrote Love.

People ask why now? One because Universal is still using the edited poster to promote the movie overseas, two no one said any thing when they went back ten years and ask @KevinHart4real to explain his ‚Äùtweet‚Äù that kept him from hosting the Oscars‚Ä¶not one person said why now‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Faizon Love AKA Alvin Tostig (@FAIZONLOVE) November 26, 2020

The actor was referring to comedian and A-list actor Kevin Hart, who stepped down from hosting the 91st Academy Awards in 2018 amid a backlash over the resurfacing of previous gay jokes and tweets.

Love told Variety that he is seeking redress on behalf of black actors who have been mistreated by the industry.

‚ÄúThey have not only hurt me financially, they have hurt me in a deeper way by dismissing me because of my blackness ‚Äî and they have hurt all Black performers by continuing to perpetuate racism in the movie industry,‚Äù said Love. ‚ÄúI want to ensure that future generations don‚Äôt have to endure the racism and whitewashing that I have experienced.

You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Facebook and Twitter at @ARmastrangelo, on Parler at @alana, and on Instagram.

Title: The Pandemic Is Changing Hollywood, Maybe Forever
Author: ['Breitbart News']
Text:
NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî ‚ÄúNo New ‚ÄòMovies‚Äô Till Influenza Ends‚Äù blared a New York Times headline on Oct. 10, 1918, while the deadly second wave of the Spanish Flu was unfolding.

A century later, during another pandemic, movies ‚Äî quotes no longer necessary ‚Äî are again facing a critical juncture. But it‚Äôs not because new films haven‚Äôt been coming out. By streaming service, video-on-demand, virtual theater or actual theater, a steady diet of films have been released under COVID-19 every week. The Times has reviewed more than 460 new movies since mid-March.

Watch below:

Yet until recently ‚Äî with only a few exceptions ‚Äî those haven‚Äôt been the big-budget spectacles Hollywood runs on. Eight months into the pandemic, that‚Äôs changing. Last month, the Walt Disney Co. experimented with the $200 million ‚ÄúMulan‚Äù as a premium buy on its fast-growing streaming service, Disney+ ‚Äî where the Pixar film ‚ÄúSoul‚Äù will also go on Dec. 25. WarnerMedia last week announced that ‚ÄúWonder Woman 1984‚Äù ‚Äî a movie that might have made $1 billion at the box office in a normal summer ‚Äî will land in theaters and on HBO Max simultaneously next month.

Much remains uncertain about how the movie business will survive the pandemic. But it‚Äôs increasingly clear that Hollywood won‚Äôt be the same afterward. Just as the Spanish Flu, which weeded out smaller companies and contributed to the formation of the studio system, COVID-19 is remaking Hollywood, accelerating a digital makeover and potentially reordering an industry that was already in flux.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think the genie will ever be back in the bottle,‚Äù says veteran producer Peter Guber, president of Mandalay Entertainment and former chief of Sony Pictures. ‚ÄúIt will be a new studio system. Instead of MGM and Fox, they‚Äôre going to be Disney and Disney+, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, HBO Max and Peacock.‚Äù

Many of the pivots in 2020 can be chalked up to the unusual circumstances. But several studios are making more long-term realignments around streaming. WarnerMedia, the AT&T conglomerate that owns Warner Bros. (founded in 1923), is now run by Jason Kilar, best known as the former chief executive of Hulu. Last month, Disney chief executive Bob Chapek, the Robert Iger heir, announced a reorganization to emphasize streaming and ‚Äúaccelerate our direct-to-consumer business.‚Äù

Universal Pictures, owned by Comcast, has pushed aggressively into video-on-demand. Its first major foray, ‚ÄúTrolls,‚Äù kicked up a feud with theater owners. But as the pandemic wore on, Universal hatched unprecedented deals with AMC and Cinemark, the largest and third-largest chains, respectively, to dramatically shorten the traditional theatrical window (usually about three months) to just 17 days. After that time, Universal can move releases that don‚Äôt reach certain box-office thresholds to digital rental.

While the nation‚Äôs second largest theater chain, Regal Cinemas, has resisted such deals, there‚Äôs widespread acknowledgement that the days of 90-day theatrical runs are over. It‚Äôs something the studios have long sought for the potential benefit of covering both platforms with one marketing campaign. Many see the pandemic as accelerating a decades-long trend.

‚ÄúWindows are clearly changing,‚Äù says Chris Aronson, distribution chief for Paramount Pictures. ‚ÄúAll this stuff that‚Äôs going on now in the business was going to happen, the evolution is just happening faster than it would have. What would have taken three to five years is going to be done in a year, maybe a year and a half.‚Äù

That condensed period of rapid change is happening at the same time as a land rush for streaming market share, as Disney+, HBO Max, Apple and Peacock wrestle for a piece of the home viewing audience dominated by Netflix and Amazon. With theme parks struggling and worldwide box office down tens of billions, streaming is a bright spot for media companies, and the pandemic may offer a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to lure subscribers. ‚ÄúWonder Woman 1984‚Äù and ‚ÄúSoul‚Äù are essentially very expensive advertisements for those streaming services.

Watch below:

Each studio, depending on their corporate ownership and streaming positioning, is taking a different approach. Paramount, like Sony Pictures, doesn‚Äôt have a streaming service to offload films to. Both have held back their tentpole releases while selling more midsized films to streamers. For Paramount, ‚ÄúA Quiet Place: Part II,‚Äù ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù and ‚ÄúMission: Impossible 7‚Äù are waiting for 2021 while ‚ÄúThe Trial of the Chicago 7‚Äù fetched a reported $56 million from Netflix and Eddie Murphy‚Äôs ‚ÄúComing to America 2‚Äù went to Amazon Prime Video for a reported $125 million.

HBO Max has had a bumpier rollout than Disney+, so ‚ÄúWonder Woman 1984‚Äù is an especially critical gambit for WarnerMedia following the audacious release of ‚ÄúTenet.‚Äù As the first tentpole to test theaters reopened with safety protocols and reduced capacities, it has made about $350 million worldwide ‚Äî a lot considering everything but far less than originally hoped for. Credit Suisse analyst Douglas Mitchelson called the ‚ÄúWonder Woman‚Äù plans ‚Äî which include rolling theatrical runs in China, Europe and elsewhere ‚Äî ‚Äúa grand experiment that could have-lasting implications if successful.‚Äù

Director Patty Jenkins acknowledged the simultaneous release was a kind of sacrifice, not just to HBO Max but to families stuck at home. ‚ÄúAt some point you have to choose to share any love and joy you have to give, over everything else,‚Äù Jenkins wrote on Twitter.

It can be easy to cheer such moves, even if their financial performance remain cloudy (no studio has been transparent about its viewership numbers or digital grosses) and their long-term viability uncertain. Can you replicate $1 billion in box office in new subscriptions? And for how long will the one-time bounce of a new movie (unlike a series staggered over weeks or months) drive subscribers once streaming services are closer to tapping as many homes as they can?

‚ÄúThe whole thing is more complicated than people want it to be,‚Äù says Ira Deutchman, the veteran independent film producer and Columbia University professor. ‚ÄúThe way movies are made and distributed, certainly at the studio level, has been really in need of change and hopefully this will bring it on. But when people hear that, it‚Äôs like: The pandemic is the straw that broke the camel‚Äôs back and now theatrical is dead. I personally feel that‚Äôs garbage.‚Äù

Deutchman considers the idea that people, after a year of quarantines and lockdowns, won‚Äôt want to leave their living room ‚Äúludicrous.‚Äù But he does imagine continued mergers and acquisitions, and ‚Äúa new equilibrium‚Äù for distributors and theater owners.

So what could that mean on the other side of COVID, if moviegoers are once again comfortable sitting in packed theaters on opening weekend? It will almost certainly mean the months-long runs of films like ‚ÄúTitanic‚Äù or ‚ÄúGet Out‚Äù are a thing of the past. It could mean variable pricing on different nights. It could mean an even greater division between the franchise films of the multiplex and the boutique art house, with everything in between going straight to streaming.

But after decades of slow but steady decline in attendance, most think movie theaters will have to innovate in a way other than raising ticket prices.

‚ÄúThe outlook is pretty dire in terms of being a major theatrical exhibitor,‚Äù says Jeff Bock, senior box-office analyst for Exhibitor Relations. He imagines shortened windows will mean few films ‚Äî even the Marvel releases ‚Äî ascending to $1 billion in worldwide box office. He can see some studios, like Disney, operating their own theaters as ‚Äúmini-theme parks‚Äù with merchandising stuffing the lobbies.

In the meantime, theaters are hoping for much-needed relief from Congress. With the virus surging, about 40% of U.S. theaters are open; in New York and Los Angeles, they‚Äôve stayed shut since March. Chains have taken on loans to stay afloat and avert bankruptcy. Cineworld, owner of Regal Cinemas (currently entirely closed) on Monday announced a deal for a $450 million rescue loan.

It will be a very different holiday season ‚Äî usually the most lucrative corridor in theaters ‚Äî for the movie business. How different 2021 and beyond will be remains to be seen. Some things, though, may never change.

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre going to be in this business, no matter what you do or where it plays, whether it‚Äôs streaming or in cinemas, you‚Äôre going to make hits and you‚Äôre going to make flops,‚Äù says Guber. ‚ÄúThe idea is to make more hits than flops.‚Äù

Title: Music Legends Van Morrison and Eric Clapton Team for Anti-Lockdown Anthem ‚ÄòStand and Deliver‚Äô
Author: ['Warner Todd Huston']
Text:
Rock music legends Van Morrison and Eric Clapton have teamed up for ‚ÄúStand and Deliver,‚Äù a song that takes coronavirus lockdowns to task.

‚ÄúThere are many of us who support Van and his endeavors to save live music; he is an inspiration,‚Äù Clapton said according to Variety. ‚ÄúWe must stand up and be counted because we need to find a way out of this mess. The alternative is not worth thinking about. Live music might never recover.‚Äù

Clapton also said that the end of live entertainment due to coronavirus lockdowns is ‚Äúdeeply upsetting.‚Äù

Proceeds for the track ‚Äî set to be released on December 4 ‚Äî will go to Morrison‚Äôs Lockdown Financial Hardship Fund, which works to lend financial assistance to musicians left struggling during the global pandemic and the mitigation lockdowns imposed across the world.

‚ÄúIt is heartbreaking to see so many talented musicians lack any meaningful support from the government, but we want to reassure them that we are working hard every day to lobby for the return of live music, and to save our industry,‚Äù Morrison added upon release of news of his Clapton collaboration.

According to his website, Morrison‚Äôs fund has already disbursed its first allotments. Still, the group promises that more money will soon be raised for a second round of donations to struggling artists.

Van Morrison has already released several songs that are critical of the lockdowns, including ‚ÄúBorn To Be Free,‚Äù ‚ÄúAs I Walked Out,‚Äù and ‚ÄúNo More Lockdown.‚Äù

Morrison‚Äôs criticism of lockdowns has stirred controversy in certain circles, especially among government officials. The ‚ÄúMoondance‚Äù singer recently drew criticism from Northern Ireland‚Äôs health minister Robin Swann who called the protest songs ‚Äúdangerous.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know where he gets his facts. I know where the emotions are on this,‚Äù Swann told BBC in September, ‚Äúbut I will say that sort of messaging is dangerous.‚Äù As Rolling Stone reported, Morrison has for decades voiced grievances through song, but ‚Äúthis time, Morrison‚Äôs preferred method of venting might also cause harm to others.‚Äù

Title: Bette Midler: Doctors Should Sue over SCOTUS Protecting Rights of ‚ÄòSuper Spreader‚Äô Churches, Synagogues
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Bette Midler wants doctors and nurses to sue over the Supreme Court‚Äôs recent 5-4 ruling confirming the First Amendment rights of people to gather for religious purposes. The Hollywood star said that these ‚Äúsuper spreader‚Äù events will eventually become a burden on health-care workers.

On Monday, Midler tweeted her disbelief that the high court is allowing people to gather in houses of worship.

‚ÄúPacking the Supreme Court really works, but for whom? Why do the religious get to gather in super spreader groups, if they will sicken rest of us?‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúAnd when they get sick why should any stressed out health-care worker be forced to look after them? Doctors and nurses should sue.‚Äù

The Hocus Pocus star made no mention of the Black Lives Matter demonstrations and riots that have taken place in cities across the country, bringing together thousands of protestors in close proximity during the coronavirus pandemic.

Packing the Supreme Court really works, but for whom? Why do the religious get to gather in super spreader groups, if they will sicken rest of us? And when they get sick why should any stressed out health-care worker be forced to look after them? Doctors and nurses should sue. ‚Äî bettemidler (@BetteMidler) November 27, 2020

Andrew Cuomo‚Äôs (D) restrictions, which limited house of worship attendance to 10 to 25 people. The plaintiffs argued that the limits violated religious freedom under the First Amendment.

Title: Former Aide Mocks Andrew Cuomo for Victory Book, ‚ÄòDepressing' Emmy Win
Author: ['Joshua Caplan']
Text:
Alexis Grenell, a former aide to Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D), has slammed her former boss over his conduct during the coronavirus pandemic in a searing op-ed published Thursday in The Nation.

‚ÄúThe Andrew Cuomo New Yorkers know and mostly tolerate, the snarling attack dog who gaslights fellow Democrats and deploys staff to call his female critics ‚Äòf‚Äî-g idiots,‚Äô dropped down to Earth last week. It was a hard landing after a long-distance love affair with a fanbase in a galaxy far, far away,‚Äù said Grenell, who served as Cuomo‚Äôs deputy director of intergovernmental affairs during his time as New York‚Äôs attorney general.

Grenell took aim at Cuomo for penning a victory-lap book ‚Äî American Crisis: Leadership Lessons from the COVID-19 Pandemic ‚Äî touting his handling of the pandemic, which has yet to conclude.

‚ÄúIt all boils down to this: Any dissent is a partisan attack on our very lives, and Andrew Cuomo is our only hope,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúTo solidify the narrative, he‚Äôs even written a self-congratulatory book at what he calls ‚Äòhalf-time‚Äò in the crisis. Kind of like how every coach puts out a press release mid-game and Winston Churchill wrote the history of World War II in 1943. Oh, wait‚Ä¶‚Äù

Grenell then mocked Cuomo for accepting an International Emmy award for his televised briefings on the pandemic.

‚ÄúThe whole thing was already very Through the Looking Glass before the International Academy of Television Arts and Sciences announced on Friday that they were awarding the governor an Emmy for his ‚Äútelevision shows with characters, plot lines, and stories of success and failure,‚Äù the former aide wrote.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something genuinely depressing about seeing the son of a man who refused a seat on the Supreme Court so eager to be flattered by Ben Stiller,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost hard to remember how he ridiculed two-time Emmy Award‚Äìwinner Cynthia Nixon back in 2018 for being an unqualified celebrity.‚Äù

Cuomo and his office have not yet responded to Grenell‚Äôs essay.

Grenell‚Äôs sharp criticism came as the U.S. Supreme Court dealt a hard blow to Cuomo‚Äôs restrictions on religious services.

As Breitbart News reported:

On Wednesday evening, the high court ruled in favor 5-4 with the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn and Orthodox Jewish synagogues in their lawsuit alleging Cuomo‚Äôs gathering restrictions, which limited house of worship attendance from 10 to 25 people, violated religious freedom under the First Amendment.

Cuomo bitterly dismissed the Court‚Äôs ruling, calling the decision ‚Äúirrelevant.‚Äù

Title: Hollywood Storms Georgia: Kevin Bacon Hosting Celebrity Fundraiser for Pro-Democrat Group
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Georgia is ground zero in the battle for the balance of power in Washington, D.C., as control of the U.S. Senate now hinges on the outcome of the two Senate runoff races in the Peach State. With the Senate majority leadership within his reach, Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) recently declared, ‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change America.‚Äù Now Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick are reportedly the latest Hollywood celebrities to lend their star power to Democrats in Georgia, hoping to boost the chances of candidates Raphael Warrnock and Jon Ossoff and turn the Senate blue.

The acting power couple will join comedian Billy Eichner and Hamilton star Leslie Odom Jr. in a fundraiser for Swing Left, one of many progressive organizations that is mobilizing Democratic turnout in Georgia, according to The Hollywood Reporter. The Maze Runner producer Ellen Goldsmith-Vein will co-host the December 3 event.

Swing Left is among the many progressive groups that have set their sights on Georgia ahead of the state‚Äôs January 5 runoffs. The organization, which was founded in the wake of President Trump‚Äôs 2016 victory, has specialized in recruiting celebrities to push its agenda, including Broadway and Homeland star Mandy Patinkin.

Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick teamed up with Swing Left in the weeks leading up to the presidential election, participating in podcasts and donating money to the group.

Hollywood celebrities have made Georgia their top political priority in their effort to push Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock across the finish line. A-list stars including George Clooney and Will Smith have poured money into the races, while actors Kumail Nanjiani and Sophia Bush are spearheading WinBothSeats, an initiative to get out the minority vote for Democrats.

Julia Louis-Dreyfus is holding a Veep reunion next month to raise money for America Votes, the left-wing group that is working to boost Democratic chances in Georgia‚Äôs runoffs. Other stars pushing Georgia Democrats on social media include Alyssa Milano and Debra Messing.

Title: Bruce Springsteen, Jon Stewart, Bon Jovi Pose for Coronavirus Billboards in New Jersey: ‚ÄòWear a Friggin‚Äô Mask!‚Äô
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Drivers in New Jersey are receiving a mandatory lecture on the coronavirus thanks to a new series of billboards demanding that everyone wears a mask. The effort comes courtesy of three famous sons of the Garden State ‚Äî Jon Stewart, Bruce Springsteen, and Jon Bon Jovi.

The billboards come as New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy (D) is facing widespread criticism after he and his family were caught dining out without masks after he imposed further statewide restrictions on social gatherings.

New Jersey officials unveiled the billboards this week along highways throughout the state. ‚ÄúWear a friggin‚Äô mask!‚Äù the billboards say. The three celebrities teamed up on the initiative with the New Jersey Department of Health and the New Jersey Pandemic Relief Fund.

First lady Tammy Murphy tweeted that ‚Äúas we enter the holiday season, it‚Äôs important to stay vigilant about #COVID19.‚Äù She also used the hashtag #MaskUpNJ.

Gov. Murphy (D) has come under fire after a video showed his family dining out without wearing masks. The family was accosted by passersby who hurled obscenities at them. The governor recently imposed further social restrictions on residents, ordering people to limit indoor gatherings to ten individual and outdoor gatherings to 150.

He also told New Jerseyites to keep their Thanksgiving gatherings ‚Äúas small as possible.‚Äù

As we enter the holiday season, it‚Äôs important to stay vigilant about #COVID19. @JonBonJovi, @Springsteen, and Jon Stewart teamed up with @NJ_PRF and @NJDeptofHealth to remind you to wear a friggin‚Äô mask! #MaskUpNJ pic.twitter.com/dLbSSIBr6o ‚Äî Tammy Murphy (@FirstLadyNJ) November 25, 2020

Bruce Springsteen also promoted the billboards on social media. The Freehold, N.J.-native wrote: ‚ÄúTeamed up with some fellow New Jerseyans to encourage everyone this holiday season to wear a friggin‚Äô mask. Let‚Äôs all come together and #MaskUpNJ so we can get back to what we do best ‚Äì singing along and dancing together.‚Äù

Teamed up with some fellow New Jerseyans to encourage everyone this holiday season to wear a friggin‚Äô mask. Let‚Äôs all come together and #MaskUpNJ so we can get back to what we do best ‚Äì singing along and dancing together. @FirstLadyNJ @NJ_PRF @NJGov pic.twitter.com/djovXOxiIu ‚Äî Bruce Springsteen (@springsteen) November 25, 2020

Springsteen recently promised to flee the United States and move to Australia if President Donald Trump wins a second term.

New Jersey has the highest COVID-19 death rate in the country. Early in the pandemic, Gov. Murphy ordered the state‚Äôs nursing homes to accept COVID-19 patients, which is believed to have helped the virus spread rapidly among the elderly population.

Title: Rihanna Sends Support to ‚ÄòMourning‚Äô Native Americans On Thanksgiving
Author: ['Warner Todd Huston']
Text:
Pop star Rihanna, whom Forbes recently named among the richest self-made women in America, with a net worth of $600 million, celebrated Thanksgiving by showing her support for Native Americans who are ‚Äúmourning‚Äù during the holiday.

The Diamonds singer posted a message to her Instagram Story reading, ‚ÄúSome are celebrating today‚Ä¶ many are mourning! Sending love to all my Native American brothers and sisters.‚Äù

The ocean‚Äôs 8 actress often spews political rants on her social media. A few months ago, Rihanna went on the attack against Kentucky officials over the Breonna Taylor grand jury decision. And last year, the Grammy-winner loudly rejected an offer to perform at the Super Bowl because the league had still not given national anthem protester Colin Kaepernick a job.

Rihanna was not the only pop singer to attack the Thanksgiving tradition.

Singer Demi Lovato also jumped to Instagram to undermine the Thanksgiving holiday with a series of images she took from a left-wing activist group named Showing Up For Racial Justice that made to ‚Äúdebunk‚Äù many of the facts people believe about the first Thanksgiving.

View this post on Instagram A post shared by Demi Lovato (@ddlovato)

The memes the 28-year-old HEAL singer posted were entitled ‚ÄúDecolonizing Thanksgiving.‚Äù

Lovato‚Äôs posts included one that debunked the claim that the first Thanksgiving occurred in 1621. ‚ÄúFact,‚Äù Lovato‚Äôs meme read, ‚ÄúNo one really knows when the ‚Äòfirst‚Äô Thanksgiving occurred.‚Äù

The meme posts continued with another that relayed the claim from the Wampanoag tribe‚Äôs ‚Äúoral traditions‚Äù that claim that the pilgrims did not celebrate the day by inviting the Indians to a feast, and no invitation was ever offered to the local tribes, they claim.

Lovato‚Äôs memes also insist that it is a ‚Äúmyth‚Äù that the Pilgrims and the Indians became friends and insisted that English soldiers ‚Äúmassacred roughly 700 Pequot men, women, and children at Mystic Fort, burning many of them alive in their homes and killing those who fled.‚Äù

But as Breitbart News editor-at-large Rebecca Mansour notes in a lengthy piece, the American left‚Äôs ‚Äú‚Äònarrative of Thanksgiving‚Äô is historically inaccurate garbage. We know who the Pilgrims are and what they did because they meticulously documented everything for posterity.‚Äù

Title: Terrorist Friend of Ariana Grande Concert Bomber Getting Out of Prison
Author: ['Victoria Friedman']
Text:
Abdalraouf Abdallah, who was friends with Salman Abedi and was communicating with him in the months leading up to the Manchester Arena terror attack, is due to be released from prison this week.

The inquiry into the Manchester bombing has heard in recent months the details of the two terrorists‚Äô close relationship. Abedi had been friends with Abdallah since 2014, and they had ‚Äúconversed about martyrdom‚Äù between July and November of that year. When Abdallah was on bail, Abedi took him to mosques.

The Manchester bomber then visited Abdallah in prison in 2015 and then again two years later, maintaining contact with the convicted terrorist in the intervening years. He called Abdallah regularly in the months leading up to the terror attack, notably on the same day that he received a delivery of chemicals for his suicide pack. Despite requests from lawyers, Abdallah, 27, has refused to cooperate with authorities conducting the inquiry.

Sources confirmed to Sky News on Thursday that Abdallah is due for release on licence ‚Äî similar to parole ‚Äî this week, after having been jailed in 2016 following a conviction for trying to help his brother and two other Islamists to travel to Syria to join Islamic State.

Some of the relatives of the victims have expressed their shock at Abdallah‚Äôs forthcoming release. The lawyer of 12 of them told The Times that it was ‚Äúbeyond belief‚Äù he was being released given his refusal to cooperate with the Manchester bombing inquiry, as he could shed light on many aspects of the investigation.

Lawyer Victoria Higgins of Slater & Gordon said: ‚ÄúThe contact this man had with Salman Abedi in the weeks and months before the Arena bomb is something that the inquiry will be exploring in great detail.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is truly devastating news at what has already been a hugely distressing experience for the families sitting through this inquiry,‚Äù Ms Higgins added.

"Irrespective of his supposedly strict licensing conditions, releasing Abdallah ‚Äî a man who has close links to the Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi ‚Äî poses a clear threat to British public safety." My quote in @Telegraph.https://t.co/arbSHY2HtJ ‚Äî Dr Rakib Ehsan (@rakibehsan) November 27, 2020

Abdallah has fully completed the custodial portion of his short sentence. He may be recalled to prison if he breaches the terms of his licence, although such conditions have failed to stop early-release terrorists before.

Abdallah was born in Libya and grew up in the same part of Manchester as the Abedi brothers. In 2010, he travelled to Tripoli to fight and was shot and seriously injured in 2011. The NHS treated him for his injuries, giving what was described as life-saving treatment, after his parents had flown him back to Britain. The jihadist was paralysed from the waist down and is wheelchair-bound.

The terrorist will be subject to a tag on his release and be restricted on his access to electronic devices such as computers. He will be banned from interacting with certain people and will be prohibited from entering Manchester city centre. Additionally, he will be ordered to attend a deradicalisation programme.

The effectiveness of deradicalisation programmes has come under scrutiny in the past 12 months, following the London Bridge terror attack committed in November 2019 by Usman Khan, who was attending a rehabilitation event when he launched his stabbing spree, killing two of the course‚Äôs facilitators. Khan was considered a ‚Äúsuccess story‚Äù of an Islamist who turned his life around. King‚Äôs College London published a paper in July revealing that terrorists are pretending to be reformed in order to secure early release.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson has previously admitted that ‚Äúreally very few‚Äù Islamists are successfully reformed.

Security Guard Ignored Ariana Grande Concert Bomber ‚ÄòFor Fear of Being Branded a Racist‚Äô https://t.co/eiSKbSGbzm ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) October 28, 2020

Terrorism expert Dr Rakib Ehsan of the Henry Jackson Society warned that Abdallah still represents a risk to national security and should be detained in prison for the full nine-and-a-half years of his sentence.

Dr Ehsan told The Telegraph: ‚ÄúIrrespective of his supposedly strict licensing conditions, releasing Abdallah ‚Äî a man who has close links to the Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi ‚Äî poses a clear threat to British public safety.

‚ÄúGiven he was released automatically, without a parole hearing, we simply have no idea if he has been ‚Äòderadicalised‚Äô or remains a hardened fundamentalist. All this tells a story of a fundamentally flawed system for dealing with Islamist terrorists.‚Äù

The inquiry into the May 2017 terror attack revealed that Britain‚Äôs domestic security agency MI5 was aware that Abedi was in contact with Abdallah before the attack, but did not reopen their investigation into Abedi.

Title: Trump Jr. Warns Georgians: 'My Father‚Äôs Accomplishments Are on Your Ballot'
Author: ['Hannah Bleau']
Text:
Donald Trump Jr. is warning Georgians that President Donald Trump‚Äôs accomplishments are on the ballot in the January 5th runoffs, as the results will determine the balance of power in the U.S. Senate, which has helped enact the president‚Äôs MAGA agenda.

The president‚Äôs eldest son, who has urged Republicans in Georgia to support Republican Sens. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue against their radical left opponents, is featured in a six-figure radio ad which dropped in the Peach State on Tuesday. In the ad, Trump Jr. explains that his father‚Äôs accomplishments remain on the ballot.

The ad begins with a soundbite of Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) celebrating in the streets after the media declared former Vice President Joe Biden the victor of the 2020 presidential election.

‚ÄúNow we take Georgia, and then we change the world!‚Äù a maskless Schumer exclaimed at the time.

‚ÄúThe radical left wants to tear down everything we‚Äôve accomplished,‚Äù Trump Jr. begins in the Save the U.S. Senate PAC ad.

‚ÄúDefunding the police, destroying private health insurance, and dismantling the Supreme Court. They‚Äôll take away our Second Amendment rights and make it harder for law-abiding citizens to defend themselves in their own homes,‚Äù he continued.

‚ÄúOn January 5th, the U.S. Senate is on the line, and my father‚Äôs accomplishments are on your ballot,‚Äù he stressed, adding, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let Chuck Schumer and the radical left succeed. On January 5th, vote Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue for Senate.‚Äù

According to Axios, the ad will air statewide on both conservative talk radio and country music stations.

Trump Jr. has remained outspoken in the weeks leading to the Georgia runoffs, addressing the rumors of ‚Äúpeople that are supposed to be on our side‚Äù urging Republicans not to vote for the GOP incumbents.

‚ÄúThat is NONSENSE. IGNORE those people,‚Äù the president‚Äôs eldest son said, laying into those encouraging Republicans to sit on the sidelines in the January 5th runoffs. ‚ÄúWe need ALL of our people coming out to vote for Kelly & David‚Äù:

I‚Äôm seeing a lot of talk from people that are supposed to be on our side telling GOP voters not to go out & vote for @KLoeffler and @PerdueSenate. That is NONSENSE. IGNORE those people. We need ALL of our people coming out to vote for Kelly & David.#MAGA #GASEN ‚Äî Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) November 23, 2020

His November 23 plea followed chatter from other conservative voices, who have publicly suggested that they will not support the GOP senators in next month‚Äôs runoffs.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs speak truth about @SenLoeffler & @sendavidperdue. Why are they doing little or nothing to support efforts by GA citizens to address unlawful election & need for @BrianKempGA to order special session of legislature?‚Äù attorney Lin Wood asked.

‚ÄúIf not fixed, I will NOT vote in GA runoff. Will you?‚Äù Wood inquired:

Let‚Äôs speak truth about @SenLoeffler & @sendavidperdue. Why are they doing little or nothing to support efforts by GA citizens to address unlawful election & need for @BrianKempGA to order special session of legislature? If not fixed, I will NOT vote in GA runoff. Will you? ‚Äî Lin Wood (@LLinWood) November 21, 2020

Loeffler‚Äôs and Perdue‚Äôs victories are crucial for the GOP to maintain its Senate majority. The bigger picture, as Trump Jr. alluded to in the ad, is maintaining a majority to uphold the vast accomplishments Trump‚Äôs achieved over the course of the last four years.

If Democrats were to snag these two seats, it would split the Senate 50-50, giving the tiebreaker to the team controlling the White House. If Trump is successful in his various legal challenges, Vice President Mike Pence would serve as the tiebreaker. However, in a Biden White House, Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA), who was once rated the most leftist senator in the upper chamber, would determine the direction of the Senate.

The Democrat senate candidates, Rev. Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff, both have histories of radical positions. A recently emerged video shows Warnock mocking the prospect of churchgoers for arming themselves:

BOMBSHELL: Newly found video shows Georgia Senate candidate @ReverendWarnock LAUGHING at church-goers who defend themselves with guns. First Warnock goes after our veterans, now our Second Amendment. Georgians have a clear choice Jan. 5! #gapol #gasen pic.twitter.com/YFtGdiqkOi ‚Äî NRA (@NRA) November 30, 2020

On Sunday, Perdue‚Äôs challenger, Jon Ossoff, confessed that he would support a statewide lockdown of businesses to fight the Chinese coronavirus, adding that ‚Äúit‚Äôs time to trust the experts‚Äù:

If you think the overreaching lockdowns in states like New York and California are scary, know that Jon @Ossoff would support the very same policies ‚Äì for the entire country. pic.twitter.com/RADSX01uMO ‚Äî David Perdue (@Perduesenate) November 30, 2020

Both of those issues ‚Äî preserving the Second Amendment and reviving the economy following coronavirus lockdowns ‚Äî have remained central to Trump‚Äôs agenda, speaking to the central point Trump Jr. makes in the Georgia ad.

Title: Watch: Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey Appears to Decline Call from President Trump
Author: ['Kyle Olson']
Text:
Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey appeared to decline a call from President Donald Trump on Monday as he was signing an election certification document.

Ducey was sitting in front of reporters, pen in hand, when his phone rang:

Watch the Governor of Arizona completely blow off Trump when he calls him in the middle of certifying Arizona‚Äôs election results for Joe Biden. pic.twitter.com/Ogv4AYaEwq ‚Äî Mike Sington (@MikeSington) December 1, 2020

The ring tone, ‚ÄúHail to the Chief,‚Äù could be heard as Ducey took the phone out of his jacket pocket. He appeared to look at the screen, decline the call, and place the phone screen-down on the table.

MSNBC noted Ducey previously said he changed Trump‚Äôs ring tone to the presidential song so he could more easily recognize his calls.

‚ÄúI had to change the ring tone on my phone and it rings ‚ÄòHail to the Chief‚Äô because I didn‚Äôt want to miss another phone call directly from the White House,‚Äù Ducey said in early July.

As Ducey was signing the document effectively awarding Arizona‚Äôs 11 electoral votes to Joe Biden, legislators were taking testimony from Trump‚Äôs lawyer, former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani, and witnesses to alleged voter fraud in the state.

Trump called into the hearing and blasted Ducey, accusing him of rushing the certification process, Breitbart News reported.

‚ÄúOn top of it, you have a governor named Ducey,‚Äù the president said as the crowd booed. ‚ÄúHe just rushed to sign certificates ‚Ä¶ what‚Äôs that all about? He didn‚Äôt have to sign it. I say, why would he sign when you have these incredible hearings going on that‚Äôs showing such corruption and such horrible fraud?‚Äù

Republican Arizona Governor Doug Ducey caves to far-Left Nike. ‚Äú‚Ä¶ we welcome @Nike to our state‚Ä¶‚Äù https://t.co/eov7PxjOAt ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) July 13, 2019

The audience applauded in approval.

‚ÄúYou have to figure out what that‚Äôs all about with Ducey. He couldn‚Äôt go fast enough,‚Äù Trump said.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not going to forget what Ducey just did.‚Äù

Breitbart News has not been able to confirm that it was indeed Trump.

Kyle Olson is a reporter for Breitbart News. He is also host of ‚ÄúThe Kyle Olson Show,‚Äù syndicated on Michigan radio stations on Saturdays‚Äìdownload full podcast episodes. Follow him on Parler.

Title: Pompeo: Israel a ‚ÄòKey Partner, Not a Problem‚Äô in Fight Against Iran
Author: ['Deborah Danan']
Text:
Israel is a key partner in fighting Iran and not the problem, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said Tuesday.

‚ÄúWe recognize the violent nature of the revolutionary Iranian regime, and we understand that when it comes to countering Tehran and many other important issues, Israel is a key partner, and not a problem,‚Äù Pompeo said at the virtual opening of the first U.S.-Bahrain Strategic Dialogue.

His remarks come in the wake of the assassination of the Islamic Republic‚Äôs nuclear weapons mastermind Mohsen Fakhrizadeh on Friday, which Tehran alleged Israel was behind.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday said the U.S.-Israel alliance has ‚Äúnever been stronger‚Äù and expressed hope America‚Äôs current Middle East policy would continue. https://t.co/zF3LBZpfD5 ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 1, 2020

Pompeo called Iran ‚Äúthe number one threat to the Gulf‚Äôs security and to peace-loving people throughout the entire region.‚Äù Apparent president-elect Joe Biden has said he would revert to the Obama-led 2015 nuclear deal with Iran, from which President Donald Trump pulled out in May 2018. The deal would have seen Iran acquire the nuclear bomb by 2030. Biden has said he would seek changes to the so-called sunset clause.

According to leaked diplomatic cables, Germany, France and Britain urged the Trump administration in October to reconsider his maximum pressure campaign against Iran, in particular his sanctions on the Islamic Republic‚Äôs banks, arguing that the move would damage legitimate humanitarian trade, the Reuters news wire reported Tuesday.

Bahraini Foreign Minister Abdullatif bin Rashid Al Zayani, who also attended the U.S.-Bahrain Strategic Dialogue, called on the U.S. to continue exerting maximum pressure on Iran.

It is ‚Äúessential that the international community maintains its resolve to recognize and confront such behavior, with unrelenting pressure on Iran to become a responsible actor,‚Äù Zayani said in his opening remarks.

The world should thank Israel for the assassination of Iran‚Äôs nuclear mastermind Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, a senior Israeli official said. https://t.co/rXiICEA5eK ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 30, 2020

‚ÄúWe want our partnership with the US to be an integral part of this process, in exposing the ongoing challenges of the theocratic [Iranian] regime and its proxies, but also ensuring Bahrain and other regional allies continue to have the capabilities to effectively protect their people against such threats,‚Äù he said.

Zayani thanked the U.S. for paving the way for the tiny Gulf kingdom to establish diplomatic relations with Israel and ‚Äúa genuine, warm peace.‚Äù

Follow @danandeborah on Twitter

Title: Jimmy Kimmel Mocks Maria Bartiromo: She‚Äôs ‚ÄòAuditioning‚Äô to Become Donald Trump‚Äôs Next Wife
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
ABC‚Äôs left-wing late night host Jimmy Kimmel took a shot at Fox Business anchor Maria Bartiromo during his late-night ABC show on Monday, mocking her recent interview with President Donald Trump and joking that she is ‚Äúauditioning‚Äù to become the president‚Äôs new wife.

President Trump gave his first post-election interview to Maria Bartiromo on her Fox News show Sunday Morning Futures. During the phone interview, the president attacked the mainstream media for its refusal to run negative stories about Joe Biden, calling it ‚Äúsuppression by the press.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have freedom of the press in this country. We have suppression by the press. They suppress,‚Äù the president said. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt have a scandal if nobody reports about it. This is the greatest fraud in the history of our country, from an electoral standpoint.‚Äù

Jimmy Kimmel used the Fox News interview to mock Bartiromo, calling her ‚Äúalways sycophantic‚Äù when it comes to the president.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what happened to her, but she appears to be auditioning for the position of Donald Trump‚Äôs next wife because that was some interview,‚Äù he said.

Watch below:

Speaking of sycophantic, Kimmel recently interviewed former President Barack Obama, gushing over the former commander in chief by asking a series of softball questions to promote Obama‚Äôs new memoirs, A Promised Land.

During Monday‚Äôs show, Kimmel also mocked the annual Macy‚Äôs Thanksgiving Day Parade, saying that he has always hated the annual holiday tradition ‚ÄúI hate parades. To me, it‚Äôs just traffic with balloons.‚Äù
