Title: Watch Live: Michigan Senate Committee Holds Hearing on Absentee Ballot Counting
Author: ['Kyle Olson']
Text:
The Michigan Senate Oversight Committee is holding a hearing on Tuesday regarding absentee ballot counting during the presidential election in Detroit.

The committee, chaired by state Sen. Ed McBroom, will take testimony related to ‚Äúabsentee ballot counting at the TCF Center,‚Äù according to the committee‚Äôs website.

Controversy erupted over the weekend when the committee refused to include President Trump‚Äôs attorney, former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani.

Over 100 observers of the ballot counting process in Detroit have filed affidavits testifying to what they witnessed, which included allegations of ballots being counted multiple times, procedures not being followed, observers being blocked from being able to watch the process, and mysterious vehicles showing up in the middle of the night to deliver additional ballots.

The Wayne County Board of Canvassers initially declined to certify the results from the jurisdiction that includes Detroit, before the two Republican members reversed their votes after hours of withering personal attacks by Joe Biden supporters and Democrat activists.

They then attempted to reverse the reversal, but were unsuccessful. The State Board of Canvassers certified Michigan‚Äôs results 3-0, with one Republican abstaining from the vote.

Sources tell Breitbart News that the hearings are intended to collect information that may influence potential reforms for future elections.

House Oversight Committee chairman Matt Hall announced on Tuesday that Giuliani will now be appearing in person on Wednesday.

Kyle Olson is a reporter for Breitbart News. He is also host of ‚ÄúThe Kyle Olson Show,‚Äù syndicated on Michigan radio stations on Saturdays‚Äìdownload full podcast episodes. Follow him on Parler.

Title: GOP Rep. Stefanik: Pelosi Losing Leverage, Controlled by the Far-Left in AOC
Author: ['Jeff Poor']
Text:
Tuesday on FNC‚Äôs ‚ÄúFox & Friends,‚Äù Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-NY) laid out a dynamic in the House of Representatives as the White House, and the Senate Republicans worked to hammer out an agreement with House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) on a COVID-19 relief package.

According to Stefanik, Pelosi‚Äôs grip on the control of the House was slipping as more so-called progressive Democrats, like Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY), were on the rise.

For example, additional aid to small businesses who are continuing to suffer, particularly as we head into this holiday and retail season. Direct support for K-12 schools. That legislation would be signed into law today or yesterday if Speaker Pelosi would negotiate in good faith. Instead, she played politics leading up to the election, and she lost.‚Äù

She is losing her leverage by the day. And I think the reality is if she can get her votes for speaker, which is still an open question, she is controlled by the far-left in AOC. So she‚Äôs going to have to go to them to get their approval.‚Äù

Title: Cotton: ‚ÄòShortsighted,‚Äô ‚ÄòDangerous‚Äô for Biden to Reenter Iran Nuclear Deal
Author: ['Jeff Poor']
Text:
In an appearance on Fox News Channel‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Story‚Äù on Monday, Sen. Tom Cotton (R-AR) warned against the United States rejoining the Iran nuclear deal canceled by President Donald Trump under a potential future Biden administration.

The Arkansas Republican lawmaker said the act would be shortsighted and dangerous.

Are they really going to go back into a deal that doesn‚Äôt touch on any of Iran‚Äôs activity besides its nuclear arsenal, some of which is already starting to sunset because the deadlines in that nuclear deal five years ago were so short, but that‚Äôs what it would take to reenter this nuclear deal? That‚Äôs why it would be so shortsighted and so dangerous.‚Äù

Title: Boris Johnson to Repeal Election-Busting Law That Almost Killed Brexit
Author: ['Oliver Jj Lane']
Text:
A David Cameron-era law that left Britain‚Äôs government paralysed and Brexit at the mercy of what transpired to be an unrepresentative Parliament is being repealed, returning a small part of the UK constitution to the long-term historical norm.

The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act is set to be repealed by Boris Johnson‚Äôs Conservative government just nine years after it was voted into power by another Conservative Prime Minister, David Cameron. The law, which changed the way general elections were called from being events that could either be voluntary by the government or forced on them by events, to being fixed on a permanent five-year cycle, was passed during the 2010 coalition government to appease the junior governing partner, Nick Clegg‚Äôs Liberal Democrats.

While the concept of fixed-term parliaments was part of a raft of major changes to Britain‚Äôs unwritten, and generally quite longstanding and time-tested, constitution wanted by the Liberal Democrats ‚Äî including a total change to the nation‚Äôs election system to benefit smaller challenger parties like themselves ‚Äî the introduction of the law had very specific consequences in the life of the last parliament, as members weaponised the job security it gave them to delay and sabotage the Brexit process for six painful months.

British broadsheet The Times reports the remarks of a Tory insider who said of the decision to push ahead with scrapping the act: ‚ÄúThe Fixed-term Parliaments Act caused constitutional chaos last year which, when combined with gridlock in parliament, meant the previous government couldn‚Äôt deliver what it was asked to do. Ultimately, at critical moments, we trust the public to decide. So we are going back to the system that lets elections happen when they are needed.‚Äù

Would Turkeys Vote For Christmas? Why MPs Will Resist Boris Johnson‚Äôs Snap Election https://t.co/yaWidxRhwh ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) September 4, 2019

Through the leadership of Theresa May and Boris Johnson, the government was repeatedly defeated on Brexit votes, events under the old system that would have seen the government collapse and a new general election called. But because the law prevented that from happening, anti-Brexit rebels on both sides of the house were able to constantly throw roadblocks in the way of the Brexit process but not face the judgement of the voters.

In an effort to block the deadlock, Boris Johnson attempted to call a general election three times, but was prevented by doing so by rebel MPs invoking the act on every occasion. Even though it was becoming increasingly clear the country supported Brexit being done, a legacy parliament that did not represent that attitude clung on to power beyond its natural life through the act.

Eventually, the government was able to pass a simple law overriding the act to sign into existence a one-off election, which the Conservatives ‚Äî campaigning heavily on a platform of making Brexit happen ‚Äî won in a major landslide, even taking northern left-wing seats that hadn‚Äôt voted Conservative in generations. The haughty attitude of Labour‚Äôs London-based ‚Äòmetropolitan elite‚Äô leaders towards Brexit was widely blamed for this defeat.

Another promise made by the Conservatives in that election was to repeal the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act, to prevent a so-called ‚Äòzombie parliament‚Äô holding the country to ransom again, both by preventing the government from governing while at the same time preventing a new government from being elected. As Breitbart London reported in December when the government started to move forwards with abolishing the act, Vernon Bogdanor, Professor of Government at King‚Äôs College London outlined some of the issued with the act that would be dismissed with its repeal.

Professor Bogdanor said the 2011 law was ‚Äúfull of holes‚Äù and, perhaps being charitable, remarked that when it was written the authors may have not foreseen the situation which came to pass where ‚Äúthe government had lost control of the Commons, Her Majesty‚Äôs Opposition would, for tactical reasons, refuse an election‚Äù.

The ability of the government to collapse is, the professor said, in fact a ‚Äúvital safeguard against inter-party manoeuvrings and shenanigans‚Äù.

Title: Boris Faces Massive Tory Rebellion over Coronavirus Restrictions
Author: ['Victoria Friedman']
Text:
Boris Johnson is facing a rebellion of up to 100 Conservative MPs planning to vote against putting 99 per cent of England under the top two strictest coronavirus measures.

The prime minister‚Äôs proposals from last week revealed that despite England being under a month-long lockdown during November, more of the country will find itself in a higher tier coming out of shutdown than going in, with just Cornwall, the Isles of Scilly, and the Isle of Wight in Tier 1.

Conservative MPs were outraged by the recommended demarcations, calling the measures ‚Äúauthoritarian‚Äù, with others saying that the ‚Äúwheels are coming off the government‚Äôs arguments‚Äù to continue imposing them.

14.6 million more people in England are now in Tier 3 compared to pre-lockdown, when cases were also falling. Meanwhile, non-Covid deaths at home are rising way above the 5 year average as many are too scared or unable to get to hospital. Lockdowns don‚Äôt work. pic.twitter.com/wtNDkMJjli ‚Äî The Brexit Party (@brexitparty_uk) November 29, 2020

MPs are set to vote on the measures in the House of Commons today, with media reporting that as many as between 50 and 100 Tories will rebel against their own government and vote against them, including Sir Graham Brady, chairman of the influential backbench 1922 Committee.

The Guardian has also reported that Labour plans to abstain from voting, because the financial support, derived from taxpayers, for the hospitality industry must go further than the government‚Äôs recovery package.

Tier 2 bans socialising indoors with anyone outside their house or support bubble and limits it to six outdoors, while Tier 3 prohibits any mixing with people not in your household or bubble inside or in most outdoor settings. Tier 3 also sees pubs, bars, and restaurants close unless they can function as takeaways, while in Tier 2, alcohol at hospitality venues can only be served with a ‚Äòsubstantial meal‚Äô.

Conservative lockdown sceptics from the COVID Recovery Group won a minor battle in forcing the Johnson administration to release the impact assessments that informed the government‚Äôs decision, but MPs are said to be disappointed with the document, described as ‚Äúthin‚Äù and containing a ‚Äúrehashed‚Äù and frustrating analysis.

UK Minister: You Might Be Banned from Venues Without Vaccine Passport https://t.co/f0UOh7YnkY ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) December 1, 2020

Chairman of the Covid Recovery Group, Mark Harper, said: ‚ÄúEven with so little time, the government‚Äôs analysis seems to be collapsing under the glare of scrutiny.

‚ÄúBefore the current lockdown, incorrect death and hospital capacity modelling was leaked into the public domain to justify it. We asked for full details. We have asked repeatedly for the information that vindicates these hospital projections, and they have not been forthcoming.

‚ÄúWe are now seeing that, once again, the wheels are coming off the government‚Äôs arguments.‚Äù

Former Conservative Party leader Sir Iain Duncan Smith called the document a ‚Äúcut and paste job‚Äù, insinuating that the government had provided no new analysis at all.

However, despite the anticipated massive Tory rebellion and Labour abstaining, the proposals are expected to pass with support from the Conservative ‚Äúpayroll vote‚Äù government ministers and Johnson loyalists in the backbench, as well as a handful of Labour MPs defying Sir Keir Starmer.

Title: David Mamet Calls Out ‚ÄòExperts‚Äô and Questions Lockdowns: ‚ÄòThe Virus Here Is Government‚Äô
Author: ['David Ng']
Text:
Acclaimed playwright David Mamet has added his distinctive voice to the growing chorus of dissenters who are questioning the effectiveness of government-mandated masks and lockdowns to combat the coronavirus.

In a recent op-ed for the Wall Street Journal, the Glengarry Glen Ross playwright slams the so-called ‚Äúexperts‚Äù and advisers whose counsel has led to the destruction of large swaths of the U.S. economy. These people will likely never pay the price for their errors, but everyone else will, he noted.

‚ÄúThe virus here is government‚Äîor at least the incompetents who advise our rulers and cannot admit the legitimacy of dissension. Absent intervention, this virus may eventually kill the host organism,‚Äù Mamet wrote.

Those closest to the boss will have the most influence‚Äîand they often keep it, even in failure, writes David Mamet https://t.co/i9OVqCbQvQ ‚Äî WSJ Editorial Page (@WSJopinion) November 28, 2020

‚ÄúWe all have to trust others for their expertise, and we all make mistakes. The horror of a command economy is not that officials will make mistakes, but that those mistakes will never be acknowledged or corrected.‚Äù

The playwright noted that experts have issued contradictory messages about the effectiveness of masks, citing the prestigious New England Journal of Medicine that published an article saying masks are useless outside health-care facilities, only to issue a quasi-retraction.

He also cited the example of a friend who owns a restaurant and is going broke. ‚ÄúOne is ‚Äòpermitted‚Äô to sit at his tables and eat without a mask. Indeed, how would one eat while wearing one? Does the virus know that one is sitting down?‚Äù

David Mamet compares today‚Äôs coronavirus advisers to failed advisers of the past, citing the case of Prof. Frederick Lindemann, a confidant to Winston Churchill. During World War II, Lindemann downplayed the idea that the Germans were developing a rocket capable of bombing London, which became the V-2. He was wrong, but never paid a professional price for his mistake.

Mamet also cites Joseph Stalin‚Äôs science adviser, Trofim Lysenko, who came up with the idea of training crops to grow in winter. It was a disaster that contributed to mass starvation in communist Russia and China.

The playwright even brings up the debate around climate change. ‚ÄúNow we have climate change and its attendant alarmists,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThe news media, backed by those parts of the ‚Äòscientific community‚Äô the media chose to honor, presented this analysis as though it were indisputable fact. In fact, it was riddled with problems.‚Äù

Today, millions of people face economic ruin as a result of the coronavirus and the policies crafted by experts who are advising the government, he wrote.

‚ÄúA pandemic was allowed to destroy the American economy. Tens of millions are driven out of work, cover their faces, and walk down the streets in fear of their neighbors.‚Äù

Title: Report: 12 Shot Monday Alone in Mayor Lightfoot‚Äôs Chicago
Author: ['Awr Hawkins']
Text:
Twelve people were shot, one fatally, on Monday alone in Mayor Lori Lightfoot‚Äôs (D) Chicago.

The Chicago Sun-Times reports the lone fatality was a 16-year-old boy who was shot in a parking garage by two attackers. He was shot around 2:35 a.m. and transported to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

One of Monday‚Äôs non-fatal shootings involved two moving vehicles ‚Äúin the 4800 block of West Patterson Avenue‚Äù around 7:15 p.m. As the vehicles passed one another an occupant from one opened fire, striking a 30-year-old and a 41-year-old in the other vehicle.

The 30-year-old ‚Äúwas struck in the face and shoulder‚Äù while the 41-year-old ‚Äúwas struck in the arm and head.‚Äù

Monday‚Äôs violence follows a weekend in which 28 were shot, seven fatally, in Mayor Lightfoot‚Äôs Chicago.

Breitbart News reported 50 people were shot last weekend in Mayor Lighfoot‚Äôs Chicago, and five of those shooting victims succumbed to their wounds. Twenty-three people were shot on Monday, November 16, 2020, alone, and that Monday followed a weekend in which over 20 were shot, one fatally, in the city.

Five people were shot, including a 16-year-old boy, on Thanksgiving Day, in Mayor Lighfoot‚Äôs Chicago.

AWR Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart News and the writer/curator of Down Range with AWR Hawkins, a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter: @AWRHawkins. Reach him at awrhawkins@breitbart.com. You can sign up to get Down Range at breitbart.com/downrange.

Title: Labour Party Could Expel ‚ÄòThousands‚Äô of Members for Anti-Semitism
Author: ['Kurt Zindulka']
Text:
The deputy leader of the British Labour Party, Angela Rayner, has threatened that thousands of members could be expelled from the party an effort to purge anti-Semitism from their ranks.

On Sunday, Mrs Rayner told members of the party that Labour has to ‚Äúget real‚Äù about anti-Semitism after a Jewish member was forced to leave a constituency party meeting in Nottingham due to a ‚Äúhostile‚Äù environment as some pushed for a restoration of the whip to former leader Jeremy Corbyn.

In response to the incident, the deputy leader said per Sky News: ‚ÄúWe should have a bit of humility, humbleness, and we should be listening and we should be aware of how hurt and upset people are.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd if I have to suspend thousands and thousands of members, we will do that. Because we cannot and we will not accept an injury to one, because an injury to one is an injury to all. That‚Äôs what we say in our movement,‚Äù Rayner warned.

In October, the Equalities and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) released a report on antisemitism, which found that the Labour Party was responsible for ‚Äúunlawful acts of harassment and discrimination‚Äù against Jewish people under the leadership of radical socialist Jeremey Corbyn.

Mr Corbyn rejected the findings of the report, claiming that the issue of anti-Semitism issue within the party was ‚Äúdramatically overstated for political reasons‚Äù. As a result of his refusal to accept blame or apologise, Corbyn was suspended by the party.

While he was later reinstated, Corbyn‚Äôs replacement as leader, Sir Keir Starmer, has refused to restore the whip to him in parliament, meaning he cannot sit as a Labour MP.

Labour Antisemitism Report Found Borderline ‚ÄòNeo-Nazis‚Äô in the Party https://t.co/ItUKwGXsF9 ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) April 17, 2020

Mrs Rayner said that she ‚Äúknew‚Äù that Corbyn would refuse to accept the report, saying: ‚ÄúBecause I don‚Äôt think Jeremy really quite gets how upsetting it is, how really upsetting it is when he made those comments.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is a matter of public record now that I contacted Jeremy to try and get him not to say what he said, and to apologise and withdraw it afterwards,‚Äù she said.

Sir Keir Starmer has also taken aim at the former far-left leader of the party, describing Corbyn‚Äôs response to the EHRC report as ‚Äújust about as bad as you could get‚Äù.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got this very wrong in recent years and I‚Äôm determined we‚Äôre going to turn this around,‚Äù he said, adding: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve made it my number one priority and I think we made some progress in the early months.‚Äù

Campaign Against Antisemitism: Corbyn‚Äôs Labour Party ‚ÄòExistential Threat‚Äô to Jews https://t.co/4OtE5jKW4W ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) June 10, 2019

The latest dust-up over the anti-Semitism issue came in response to a Constituency Labour Party (CLP) meeting in Nottingham last Friday, in which the chair of the meeting, Louise Regan, allowed a motion to restore the whip to Mr Corbyn to be tabled, in violation of the party‚Äôs rules.

A local Jewish constituent present at the meeting, Steve Lapsley, 50, said that the environment was so ‚Äúhostile‚Äù against him that he was forced to leave.

Lapsley told the members during the meeting that he had previously been told by another party member ‚Äúwe do not want Jews in the party‚Äù, yet claimed that a witness to incident denied that there was anti-Semitism in the party on Friday.

‚ÄúIt was very triggering. The suspension of Jeremy Corbyn has really upped the anger,‚Äù he said but went on to proclaim that despite everything, he will remain in the Labour Party.

Follow Kurt Zindulka on Twitter here: @KurtZindulka

Title: Team Biden Defends Press Secretary Jen Psaki‚Äôs Pink Hammer and Sickle Hat
Author: ['Charlie Spiering']
Text:
Vice President Joe Biden‚Äôs transition team Monday defended a photo of press secretary Jen Psaki wearing a pink hammer and sickle hat.

The photo of Psaki was revisited by Trump Campaign Deputy Director of Communications Matt Wolking who shared the image on social media.

Here‚Äôs Jen Psaki hugging Russia's Foreign Minister and Russia‚Äôs chief foreign affairs propagandist while wearing a pink hammer and sickle hat pic.twitter.com/WMJytaxd7J ‚Äî Matt Wolking (@MattWolking) November 30, 2020

‚ÄúHere‚Äôs Jen Psaki hugging Russia‚Äôs Foreign Minister and Russia‚Äôs chief foreign affairs propagandist while wearing a pink hammer and sickle hat,‚Äù he wrote.

Psaki is standing next to Russian ambassador Sergey Lavrov in the 2014 photo as well as Russian spokeswoman Maria Zakharova. At the time she worked for former President Barack Obama‚Äôs State Department. Then-Secretary of State John Kerry is also in the photo.

The Russians also tweeted an image of the Psaki wearing the hat in 2014.

The Biden team explained it was a gift from the Russians according to Fox News reporter Sam Dorman, and noted such exchanges were common on foreign trips. They cited an instance where former Secretary of State John Kerry gave Lavrov two Idaho potatoes.

John Kerry pulling out all the stops to woo "Minister Nyet" with‚Ä¶potatoes?http://t.co/kW7pxJUDfQ by @hannakozlowska pic.twitter.com/MUv6VsMhRD ‚Äî Foreign Policy (@ForeignPolicy) January 13, 2014

It‚Äôs not the first time that Obama officials raised eyebrows regarding Russian symbols. Former White House press secretary Jay Carney was mocked in 2014 after posters of Soviet propaganda were spotted in his home.

Title: Paul Krugman Claims ‚ÄòDemocrats Never Said Trump Was Illegitimate‚Äô; Krugman Said So in 2017
Author: ['Joel B. Pollak']
Text:
Byron York of the Washington Examiner caught New York Times columnist Paul Krugman in an easily disprovable lie on Tuesday: claiming that Democrats never called President Donald Trump illegitimate, when he himself did so in 2017.

Krugman, a Nobel Prize-winning economist-turned-partisan pundit, wrote Monday:

When Joe Biden is inaugurated, he will immediately be confronted with an unprecedented challenge ‚Äî and I don‚Äôt mean the pandemic, although Covid-19 will almost surely be killing thousands of Americans every day. I mean, instead, that he‚Äôll be the first modern U.S. president trying to govern in the face of an opposition that refuses to accept his legitimacy. And no, Democrats never said Donald Trump was illegitimate, just that he was incompetent and dangerous.

As York noted, Krugman published a column on January 16, 2017 ‚Äî four days before Trump‚Äôs inauguration ‚Äî in which he quoted Democrat Rep. John Lewis calling Trump illegitimate, and agreed with them. The title of the column was ‚ÄúWith All Due Disrespect.‚Äù In it, Krugman wrote:

But let‚Äôs not talk about Mr. Trump‚Äôs ravings. Instead, let‚Äôs ask whether Mr. Lewis was right to say what he said. Is it O.K., morally and politically, to declare the man about to move into the White House illegitimate? Yes, it is. In fact, it‚Äôs an act of patriotism. ‚Ä¶ [N]o previous U.S. president-elect has had less right to the title. So why shouldn‚Äôt we question his legitimacy?

York noted that leading Democrats, including former Vice President Joe Biden, openly declared that Trump was illegitimate and spent four years trying to remove him by any means possible, including the flimsy impeachment of 2019-2020.

York concludes: ‚ÄúThe attempt to throw it all down the memory hole is more than just an embarrassment for Krugman and the New York Times. It also encourages a sense of grievance ‚Äî They won‚Äôt accept Biden‚Äôs legitimacy! ‚Äî that is utterly ignorant of recent events. Some Democrats not only declared Donald Trump an illegitimate president before he was even sworn in ‚Äî they spent the next years trying to remove him from office, abusing the powers of investigation in the hope that even if he survived he would be so weakened that he could not win re-election. No one should forget ‚Äî or ignore ‚Äî what happened.‚Äù

Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News and the host of Breitbart News Sunday on Sirius XM Patriot on Sunday evenings from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. ET (4 p.m. to 7 p.m. PT). His newest e-book is The Trumpian Virtues: The Lessons and Legacy of Donald Trump‚Äôs Presidency. His recent book, RED NOVEMBER, tells the story of the 2020 Democratic presidential primary from a conservative perspective. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

Title: World Urged to Drink Australian Wine to Hit Back at 'Bully' Beijing
Author: ['Simon Kent']
Text:
Buy an Australian bottle of wine or two (or three) in December and show Chinese President Xi Jinping the world will not be cowed by his ‚Äúbullying of Australia.‚Äù

That was the simple call Tuesday from the Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China (IPAC), comprising more than 200 MPs from a range of political parties and representing 19 country legislatures.

The political grouping has launched a campaign to convince people to enjoy Australian wine in December, as a show of solidarity with the land Down Under, as The Sydney Morning Herald reports.

The call to drink up comes just three days after Beijing turned the screws on Australian wine exports with punitive tariffs of up to 212 percent, essentially closing off a U.S.$1 billion market.

As Breitbart News reported, biting new Chinese trade tariffs across the board have stoked fears Australia‚Äôs virus-weakened economy is being targeted for political retribution and the two countries may be sliding into a shadow trade war after a year-long confrontation that began with claims over the origins of the coronavirus.

Australia confronted the World Health Organization over claims it supports so-called wet markets reopening in the Chinese city of Wuhan. https://t.co/TjH4HmGDzv ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) April 17, 2020

The Herald reports the global alliance of cross-party representatives, who have banded together to try to counter China‚Äôs increasing aggression particularly against Australia, released a video in which MPs from Japan, Italy, Germany, the United States and even Australia‚Äôs wine-producing rival New Zealand, among others, urge their citizens to enjoy an Australian drop.

‚ÄúItaly is the country that exports the most wine of any country in the world,‚Äù Italian Democratic Party Senator Roberto Rampi says in Italian, holding up a bottle of Italian red. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, who needs wine when you have Aquavit?‚Äù jokes Norway‚Äôs former Liberal party leader and MP Trine Skei Grande. #SolidaritywithAustralia

üç∑üá∫ pic.twitter.com/u3ksj9v4YD ‚Äî Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China (@ipacglobal) December 1, 2020 ‚ÄúYou know what? Japanese sake is the best!‚Äù says Shiori Yamao, an independent member of Japan‚Äôs House of Representatives before Republican Senator Ted Yoho declares ‚Äútwo words ‚Äì Napa Valley‚Äù, before saying it is time to ‚Äúdrink something a little bit different‚Äù and buy Australian wine, ‚Äúbecause our friends need our help‚Äù. ‚ÄúWe are asking you all to join us in standing against Xi Jinping‚Äôs authoritarian bullying,‚Äù says Miriam Lexmann, a Christian Democrat Member of the European Parliament. ‚ÄúBy drinking a bottle or two of Australian wine and letting the Chinese Communist Party know that we will not be bullied,‚Äù says Swedish Christian Democratic, Elisabet Lann, a municipal councillor who holds up a glass of Penfolds. Even the U.S. National Security Council has joined the fray. It tweeted Australian wine would be featured at a White House function this week. ‚ÄúPity vino lovers in China who, due to Beijing‚Äôs coercive tariffs on Aussie vintners, will miss out,‚Äù the post said, along with the hashtag ‚ÄúAussieAussieAussieOiOiOi‚Äù.

Title: Prince Harry Climate Plea: 'What If Every One of Us Was a Raindrop?'
Author: ['Simon Kent']
Text:
Prince Harry admits his world view has changed since parenthood, urging humans to care more and be ‚Äúlike raindrops‚Äù which ‚Äúrelieve the parched ground‚Äù to tackle climate change.

The Duke of Sussex, 36, who lives with his family on a $14.65-million estate in California, spoke of his passion for nature and Africa during a television exchange to feature in an upcoming documentary, continuing his love of offering advice on climate matters that peaked 12 months ago with his enthusiastic endorsement of Greta Thunberg, as Breitbart News reported.

Speaking about his son Archie, now 19 months, the Daily Mail reports Harry said: ‚ÄúBeing in nature is the most healing part of life, I truly believe that‚Äôs one reason why it‚Äôs there.‚Äù

Prince Harry, Meghan Markle Flying (Again) to Africa with Climate Message https://t.co/prMEmC9xdH ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) September 22, 2019

He then said ‚Äúthe moment you become a father, everything really does change because then you start to realise, well, what is the point in bringing a new person in to this world when they get to your age and it‚Äôs on fire?‚Äù

Harry spoke of the importance of ‚Äúputting the dos behind the says‚Äù when it comes to tackling climate change and conservation, before imploring everyone on the planet to examine their souls, musing:

Every single raindrop that falls from the sky relieves the parched ground. What if every single one of us was a raindrop, and if every single one of us cared?

Harry reflected on the ‚Äúuniversally tough year‚Äù everyone has experienced during the coronavirus epidemic, adding he has found comfort in nature, which he believes is the ‚Äúmost healing part of life.‚Äù

‚ÄúSomeone said to me right at the start of the pandemic, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs almost as though Mother Nature has sent us to our rooms for bad behaviour‚Äô,'‚Äùhe observed.

The Duke has long stressed his concern for the future of the planet, offering thoughts and solutions along with active campaigning while flying around the globe.

Barefoot Prince Harry Warns World: Climate Change Must Be Addressed https://t.co/9q7Zkbfqau ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) August 1, 2019

As Breitbart News reported, in September last year he stood on African soil and declared the world was in a state of ‚Äúemergency‚Äù and ‚Äúlosing‚Äô‚Äù the battle against climate change, an event he declared that ‚Äúcannot be denied.‚Äù

The Duke stressed saving the environment was a race against time, adding everyone should look to young people like Greta Thunberg for inspiration and guidance: ‚ÄúLed by Greta, the world‚Äôs children are striking.‚Äù

Just weeks before, a barefoot duke stood before an elite audience of business leaders and celebrities gathered at Google‚Äôs annual deluxe retreat in Sicily to warn immediate action is needed to avoid an approaching climate catastrophe.

Title: Pope Francis Calls for ‚ÄòNew Social Justice‚Äô to Challenge Utopia
Author: ['Thomas D. Williams']
Text:
ROME ‚Äî Pope Francis called for a ‚Äúnew social justice‚Äù Sunday in which all well-intentioned people will challenge the reigning utopia.

Addressing ‚Äúsocial justice judges‚Äù from the African and American continents via streaming, the pope congratulated them for their commitment to ‚Äúsocial rights,‚Äù asserting that the very fact that men and women ‚Äúcome together to think about their work and to build the new social justice is, without a doubt, excellent news.‚Äù

The pontiff, who has been a vocal proponent of a ‚Äúgreat reset‚Äù after the coronavirus pandemic, urged his hearers to ‚Äúnot lose sight of the distressing picture in which a small part of humanity lives in opulence, while an increasingly large number lives without dignity with their most elementary rights ignored or violated.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe cannot think disconnected from reality,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd this is a reality that you must bear in mind.‚Äù

Pope Francis has called on Christians to break down walls and embrace a love without borders in a new encyclical letter released on Sunday. https://t.co/6THB1aGBPb ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) October 4, 2020

The pope insisted that social justice is ‚Äúa collective work‚Äù in which all people of good will challenge the reigning utopia. ‚ÄúJustice is a task that has to be conquered every day, because the imbalance is a temptation of every minute,‚Äù he said.

Justice also involves overcoming the temptation to ignore others, ‚Äúespecially the weakest,‚Äù Francis said, lamenting that ‚Äúwe have become used to sidestepping or ignoring situations until they impact us directly.‚Äù

‚ÄúUnconditional commitment means taking charge of the pain of the other and not slipping into a culture of indifference,‚Äù he added.

In their task of bringing about a ‚Äúnew social justice for the planet,‚Äù the pope urged his hearers to pay attention to history, to draw inspiration from ‚Äúthe struggles, the triumphs, and the defeats‚Äù of those who gave their lives for ‚Äúa full and integrated humanity.‚Äù

This effort will only succeed if it takes place as a grassroots initiative involving all people, ‚Äúwithout pretending to be an enlightened elite,‚Äù Francis said, because ‚Äúwhat God asks of us believers is to be God‚Äôs people, not God‚Äôs elite.‚Äù

In the battle for social justice solidarity is necessary to overcome ‚Äúthe structural causes of poverty, inequality, lack of work, land and housing,‚Äù he said.

Pope Francis reflected Wednesday on the importance of the intercession of the Virgin Mary, proposing that without her intervention at the wedding feast in Cana the guests would have drunk milk rather than wine. https://t.co/zwMeQtwEtI ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 19, 2020

We must fight, he said, ‚Äúagainst those who deny social and labor rights‚Äù and ‚Äúagainst a culture that leads people to use others, to enslave others, and ends up taking away the dignity of others.‚Äù

When we give essential things to the poor, he said, ‚Äúwe do not give them our things, or that of third parties, but we give them back what is theirs.‚Äù

The Christian tradition ‚Äúnever recognized the right to private property as absolute and untouchable,‚Äù he added, but ‚Äúalways emphasized its social function in any of its forms.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere is no social justice that can be based on inequity, which involves the concentration of wealth,‚Äù he said.

Follow @tdwilliamsrome

Title: Coronavirus Robs Biblical Bethlehem of Christmas Cheer
Author: ['Breitbart News']
Text:
BETHLEHEM, West Bank (AP) ‚Äî The coronavirus has cast a pall over Christmas celebrations in Bethlehem, all but shutting down the biblical town revered as Jesus‚Äô birthplace at the height of the normally cheery holiday season.

Missing are the thousands of international pilgrims who normally descend upon the town. Restaurants, hotels and souvenir shops are closed. The renowned Christmas tree lighting service will be limited to a small group of authorized people, as will church services on Christmas Eve.

‚ÄúBethlehem is dead,‚Äù said Maryana al-Arja, owner of the 120-room Angel Hotel on the outskirts of Bethlehem.

The hotel was the site of the West Bank‚Äôs first coronavirus outbreak ‚Äî when a group of Greek tourists came down with the virus last March.

She kept her 25 workers on staff for several months but ultimately couldn‚Äôt continue to pay them. Al-Arja, who herself was infected with the virus, said she has been forced to close the hotel and lay off the entire staff because there is no sign of the pandemic ending or tourists visiting anytime soon.

‚ÄúWe had 351 tourist groups booked in our hotel this year, each one 150 people,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut they all canceled.‚Äù

Elyas al-Arja, the head of the city‚Äôs hotel association, said Bethlehem received some 3 million tourists in 2019. With Israel, the main entry point for international visitors to the region, banning tourists because of the coronavirus crisis, and the West Bank‚Äôs border crossing with Jordan closed to foreigners, that number is close to zero this year, he said.

‚ÄúSixty percent of the city relies on tourism, and their income disappeared when the tourists disappeared,‚Äù said al-Arja, a cousin of the Angel Hotel owner.

The Ambassador Hotel, which is located near the Church of the Nativity, built on the site where Christians believe Jesus was born, has reopened one floor in hopes that some local visitors may want to come celebrate in the coming weeks.

Mahmoud Tarman, the hotel‚Äôs receptionist, said the Ambassador has brought back eight of its 60 workers to serve local guests. But with the West Bank‚Äôs economy devastated by repeated lockdowns, it remains unclear how many people will come.

‚ÄúAt this time of the year, this empty hotel would be bustling with life. But as you see, there is no life, not even a Christmas tree yet,‚Äù he said as he pointed at the empty lobby.

The Palestinian Authority, which administers parts of the Israeli-occupied West Bank, this week imposed a new nighttime lockdown to help contain a spike in coronavirus cases. People must remain indoors from 7 p.m. until 6 a.m., and Bethlehem is included in the lockdown.

Officials say the lockdown could be extended through Christmas and into the new year if the infection levels don‚Äôt come down. The Health Ministry has reported a total of about 65,000 coronavirus cases in the West Bank, and over 620 deaths.

Bethlehem‚Äôs mayor, Anton Salman, said the city had planned to receive 3,000 invited guests, including local scout troops and musical bands from around the world that normally entertain visitors during Christmas Eve festivities.

He said the famed Christmas tree lighting, scheduled on Thursday, will be limited to just 15 guests, including local mayors, the district governor and the Latin Patriarch and other clergy. The 85-year-old Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, who usually joins the celebration, has been invited but has not said whether he will attend.

Midnight Mass, a solemn event led by the Latin Patriarch that is usually attended by religious leaders, local VIPs and hundreds of pilgrims from around the world, has also been scaled back, Salman said. He said officials are still working on the guest list, but it is expected to include religious leaders and some foreign diplomats. The event will be closed to the general public but broadcast live for people to watch.

‚ÄúNo one can hold the responsibility of inviting large numbers of people to Christmas events,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúNothing will be the same during the pandemic.‚Äù

Title: SF Archbishop Says New Church Closures Violate Religious Freedom
Author: ['Thomas D. Williams']
Text:
San Francisco Archbishop Salvatore Cordileone said this weekend a new ban on worship violates a ‚Äúa natural and a Constitutional right.‚Äù

Archbishop Cordileone objected to the state‚Äôs lumping together of religious worship with ‚Äúnon-essential indoor activities such as gyms, movie theaters, and museums‚Äù while arbitrarily allowing ‚Äúfor indoor retail at 25 percent capacity and permits massage parlors, hair and nail salons, and tattoo parlors to operate indoors.‚Äù

In his statement, the archbishop criticized a new health order from the state of California that places San Francisco and San Mateo Counties into a more restrictive ‚Äúpurple‚Äù tier of coronavirus restrictions, which unfairly denigrates the right to religious worship.

‚ÄúThis is precisely the kind of blatant discrimination to which the Supreme Court gave injunctive relief in New York,‚Äù Cordileone said, in reference to last Wednesday‚Äôs SCOTUS ruling barring the state from enforcing certain attendance limits at houses of worship.

Even in a pandemic, ‚Äúthe Constitution cannot be put away and forgotten,‚Äù Justice Neil Gorsuch wrote in the 5-4 decision. ‚ÄúThe restrictions at issue here, by effectively barring many from attending religious services, strike at the very heart of the First Amendment‚Äôs guarantee of religious liberty.‚Äù

England‚Äôs faith leaders have united in calling on the UK government to permit public worship during the forthcoming lockdown in England, insisting that such worship is ‚Äúessential.‚Äù https://t.co/FohO0VnRAE ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 3, 2020

The San Francisco archbishop insisted in his statement that for Catholic Christians, worship of God and the reception of the sacraments are ‚Äúessential‚Äù activities.

‚ÄúThe government is demoting worship to the same status as watching a movie: ‚Äònon-essential,‚Äô‚Äù Cordileone said. ‚ÄúBut worship is both a natural and a Constitutional right. My people want to receive the Body and Blood of Christ; they need it, and have every right to be free to do so.‚Äù

Cordileone also insisted that his archdiocese has adhered scrupulously to measures mandated to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

‚ÄúCatholics in San Francisco are absolutely committed to public safety in conducting worship services,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOur protocols require masks, social distancing, sanitation and ventilation.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut the government still chooses to treat worship as less important than shopping for shoes,‚Äù he added.

While declaring that he is ‚Äúdeeply sympathetic to public health concerns about a surge in COVID hospitalizations,‚Äù the archbishop also noted that ‚Äúwe know of no cases of transmission of the virus as a result of in-person worship inside of our churches.‚Äù

Follow @tdwilliamsrome

Title: No Twitter ‚ÄòFact Check‚Äô Warning on Chinese Official‚Äôs Fake Photo of Australian Soldier Beheading Child
Author: ['Simon Kent']
Text:
Twitter on Tuesday rejected Canberra‚Äôs calls to remove a Beijing official‚Äôs gruesome tweet targeting Australian troops, choosing instead to stand with the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).

As Breitbart News reported, Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has demanded Beijing apologize after a top CCP official posted an obviously contrived image on Twitter depicting an Australian soldier with his knife to a child‚Äôs throat, appearing to prepare to behead the victim.

Morrison described the post by the official Twitter account of Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian as an ‚Äúoutrageous and disgusting slur‚Äù at a virtual news conference in Canberra on Monday.

Shocked by murder of Afghan civilians & prisoners by Australian soldiers. We strongly condemn such acts, &call for holding them accountable. pic.twitter.com/GYOaucoL5D ‚Äî Lijian Zhao ËµµÁ´ãÂùö (@zlj517) November 30, 2020

AFP reports Twitter said it had since marked the tweet as ‚Äúsensitive,‚Äù but added comments on topical political issues or ‚Äúforeign policy sabre-rattling‚Äù by official government accounts were generally not in violation of its rules.

Twitter is banned for most citizens in China and Beijing has for decades been accused of widespread human rights abuses.

Some Australian allies expressed concern over the tweet, including New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, with the support coming as Australia looks to strengthen its alliances in the Indo/Pacific region as a guard against Beijing‚Äôs increasingly strident diplomacy.

Australia will join Japan in a regional defense pact designed to bolster their standing against Beijing‚Äôs growing military power and assertiveness in the Indo-Pacific region. https://t.co/ZYhlX6LwSA ‚Äî Breitbart News (@BreitbartNews) November 10, 2020

‚ÄúIn this case an image has been used that is not factually correct, that is not a genuine image, so we have raised that directly with Chinese authorities,‚Äù she told reporters.

The French foreign affairs ministry said the post was ‚Äúunworthy of the diplomatic standards we have the right to expect from a country like China‚Äù.

A spokesperson for the Chinese embassy in Canberra dismissed the criticism, instead accusing Australia of making too much of the incident.

‚ÄúThe rage and roar of some Australian politicians and media is nothing but misreading of and overreaction to Mr. Zhao‚Äôs tweet,‚Äù the spokesperson said.

Ôªø

The embassy suggested Australian officials were attempting to ‚Äúdeflect public attention from the horrible atrocities by certain Australian soldiers‚Äù and ‚Äústoke domestic nationalism.‚Äù

AFP contributed to this report

Title: UK Minister: You Might Be Banned from Venues Without Vaccine Passport
Author: ['Victoria Friedman']
Text:
The UK‚Äôs new vaccine minister Nadim Zahawi has said that while coronavirus vaccinations will not be mandatory, Britons may be barred from going to the cinema or getting on an aeroplane without it if service providers demand proof of inoculation.

Conservative MP Nadim Zahawi is the newly-appointed Minister for COVID Vaccine Deployment and will oversee the rollout of the vaccination in England.

Mr Zahawi said that of the three vaccines currently being developed in the UK ‚Äî by Oxford/AstraZeneca, Pfizer/BioNTech, and Moderna ‚Äî the Pfizer product is the most far along and likely to be widely rolled out first.

Speaking to BBC Radio 4‚Äôs World at One on Monday, Mr Zahawi confirmed that the vaccine would not be compulsory and would remain voluntary.

However, the demand for ‚Äúimmunity passports‚Äù to secure service ‚Äî such as by Australian airline Qantas ‚Äî may make the jabs effectively compulsory by any other definition.

When host Sarah Montague asked if could follow that British businesses could demand an immunity passport before a person can go to a stadium to watch a football match, the COVID vaccination minister did not deny such an outcome, rather adding that the government was looking for a system comparable to the NHS‚Äôs ‚ÄòTest and Trace‚Äô app, which tracks the spread of coronavirus.

Mr Zahawi said: ‚ÄúWe are looking at the technology and of course a way of people informing their GP that they‚Äôve been vaccinated.

‚ÄúBut also I think you‚Äôll probably find that restaurants, bars, and cinemas and other venues ‚Äî sports venues ‚Äî will probably also use that system as they‚Äôve done with the app.‚Äù

Minister ‚ÄòCan‚Äôt Rule Out‚Äô THIRD Lockdown, Says No Normality Until Summer https://t.co/sUwnCaISlR ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) November 30, 2020

The Times had reported on Monday that the NHS is working on updating the Test and Trace app to include the information in its data architecture so that Britons can confirm their inoculation status.

The vaccine tsar admitted that without the availability of Big Government‚Äôs tech, there would be no demand for such ‚ÄòCOVID passports‚Äô by service providers, saying: ‚ÄúIn many ways, the pressure from both ways: from service providers who will say, ‚ÄòDemonstrate to us that you‚Äôve been vaccinated,‚Äô but also we will make the technology as easy and accessible as possible.‚Äù

Sarah Montague asked Mr Zahawi whether or not it would become ‚Äúvirtually impossible to do anything if you don‚Äôt have the vaccine‚Äù, with the minister responding: ‚ÄúI think people have to make a decision, but I think you‚Äôll probably find many service providers will want to engage in this in the way they did with the [Test and Trace] app.‚Äù

The minister‚Äôs comments come after reports that the government is also working on coronavirus stamps for passports in order to boost the travel and tourism industry. The government is also reportedly working on so-called ‚Äúfreedom passes‚Äù for those who have tested negative for the Chinese coronavirus, which could allow them to be free from having to wear a mask or to visit family members during lockdowns.

Former Brexit Party MEP, now Lady Fox of Buckley in the House of Lords, Claire Fox responded to Zahawi‚Äôs remarks on Monday evening, saying: ‚ÄúWhen Boris assured us that no-one would be forced to vaccinate, he forgot to add, ‚Äòbut if you don‚Äôt, you will be effectively prevented from being part of the public sphere, ever‚Äô. Public shaming next? I want to be an enthusiastic advocate for vaccines. This COERCION doesn‚Äôt help.‚Äù

Title: Farage: China is ‚ÄòLicking its Chops‚Äô at the Thought of a Biden Presidency
Author: ['Kurt Zindulka']
Text:
The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is ‚Äúlicking its chops‚Äù at the thought of a Joe Biden presidency, warned Brexit leader and longtime ally of President Donald Trump, Nigel Farage.

Mr Farage argued that China ‚Äúhas ruined the world in 2020‚Äù through its handling of the Wuhan coronavirus, for which it should be forced to pay ‚Äúvery heavy reparations‚Äù. Yet, he predicted that with Joe Biden preparing to ascend to the presidency, the CCP will continue its push for global supremacy.

‚ÄúChina‚Äôs economy is powering ahead, and its leaders are bullying weaker Western nations,‚Äù Farage wrote in Newsweek. Indeed, British newspaper The Times reports Tuesday that the Chinese economy is on track to be the first worldwide to bounce back from the impacts of the pandemic.

‚ÄúWith Trump all but gone from the White House, and faltering Joe Biden preparing to move in, it now looks as though China‚Äôs quest for world domination is back on track. What a calamity,‚Äù Mr Farage lamented.

Mr Farage went on to recall a speech he gave during a Trump campaign rally in Arizona, remarking that the line which resonated with the crowd the most was when he asked the crowd: ‚ÄúWho else among Western leaders has the courage to stand up to the rapacious Chinese Communist Party if not Donald J. Trump?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe crowd roared, knowing full well that Biden would not show such strength in the face of the Chinese threat,‚Äù Farage said.

Farage Predicts UK-Style Postal Voting Fraud Will Be Found, Trump Will Be Back in 2024 If He Loses https://t.co/lUuq4BfATB ‚Äî Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) November 5, 2020

Mr Farage said that in the wake of Joe Biden‚Äôs apparent victory, China has ‚Äúwasted no time in trying to reassert its authority over the world‚Äù, noting the increasingly tough rhetoric coming from the communist government and state-linked businesses.

He pointed to statements from Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian in November, in which he threatened the Five Eyes intelligence alliance of the United States, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand, after the bloc criticised the CCP‚Äôs move to ban four opposition leaders from the Hong Kong Legislative Council.

Mr Zhao said: ‚ÄúNo matter how many ‚Äòeyes‚Äô you have, be careful not to be poked and get blind by harming China‚Äôs sovereignty, security and development interests.‚Äù

Farage characterised the rhetoric as ‚Äúthe language of a thuggish mafia don,‚Äù questioning: ‚ÄúWho would wish to have anything to do with an individual who spoke in such a way?‚Äù

The veteran Brexit campaigner went onto decry the veiled threats from Hauwei Vice President Victor Zhang, who said that the UK should reconsider its ban on Huawei equipment from its 5G networks, claiming that the decision was motivated by pressure from the Trump administration during its trade war with China, rather than for security purposes.

Title: CA Democrat Christy Smith Concedes to Republican Rep. Mike Garcia
Author: ['Kristina Wong']
Text:
Democrat candidate California State Assemblywoman Christy Smith conceded to incumbent Rep. Mike Garcia (R-CA) Monday in the race for California‚Äôs 25th Congressional District ‚Äî former Rep. Katie Hill (D-CA)‚Äôs seat before she resigned.

Garcia had a slim lead of just 339 votes, but Smith said it was clear that amount could not be overcome. She wrote on Facebook:

This is not the end result we fought for, but I am proud of the strong, grassroots campaign we ran. Over the last few weeks, our attorneys reviewed thousands of uncounted ballots, and our campaign volunteers undertook an extraordinary effort to cure hundreds of votes throughout the district that otherwise may not have been counted. We exhausted every possible option, and did everything within our power to ensure that every voice in this election was heard. Nonetheless, we came up short.

Garcia, a Navy combat pilot, issued a statement on Monday that said his focus is on representing all constituents in the district.

Garcia said, according to CBSLA.:

My focus is on representing all constituents in CA-25. In the short term, this means pushing to get federal relief to those who are most impacted by COVID, individuals and small businesses. It‚Äôs been a tough election, but the fight has been worth it. I am looking forward to two more years. Thank you CA-25!

After a special election in March for Hill‚Äôs seat did not produce a candidate with a majority of votes, Smith and Garcia faced a run-off in May. Garcia won and was sworn in. The November 3 race is for a full two-year term.

Garcia called the race an ‚Äúexistential fight‚Äù for the nation in an October interview with SiriusXM‚Äôs Breitbart News Saturday.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm making sure that what‚Äôs happened to our state of California doesn‚Äôt happen at the national level. We have some of the highest taxes, thick bureaucracy that‚Äôs killing small businesses and making people want to leave California, and there‚Äôs a reason for that,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúA lot of the ills that we‚Äôre experiencing here in what should be a very beautiful state, a very thriving state, are now being uploaded to the federal level,‚Äù he said.

He also blasted California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D-CA)‚Äôs COVID policies that were handcuffing the economy. ‚ÄúWe need to get our kids back in school, we need to get our business back online, reopen the amusement parks and start realizing the full potential that we have,‚Äù he said.

Garcia, a former Navy pilot, added: ‚ÄúSo that‚Äôs the fight we‚Äôre fighting right now, and people are paying attention.‚Äù

Follow Breitbart News‚Äôs Kristina Wong on Twitter or on Facebook.

Title: Kentucky AG: Closing Religious Schools Violates First Amendment, ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Ready‚Äô to Send Lawsuit to SCOTUS
Author: ['Ian Hanchett']
Text:
On Monday‚Äôs broadcast of the Fox News Channel‚Äôs ‚ÄúFox & Friends,‚Äù Kentucky Attorney General Daniel Cameron (R) stated that he will send his lawsuit arguing that Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear‚Äôs (D) school closures violate the First Amendment because they have closed down religious schools to the Supreme Court.

Cameron said that the governor has ‚Äúrepeatedly‚Äù infringed on ‚Äúthe First Amendment free exercise of religion here in the commonwealth of Kentucky. Again, I respect his responsibility to keep people safe. But we have to safeguard our religious freedoms here in Kentucky. And so, when you tell folks who send their kids to religious-affiliated schools, which is an act of worship within itself, that they cannot go to school, it infringes upon the First Amendment rights.‚Äù

He added, ‚ÄúWe won at the federal district court, who said that there was ‚Äî it was appropriate to issue a statewide injunction because he‚Äôd infringed upon First Amendment rights. A panel at the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals disagreed and stayed that injunction. And so, now we‚Äôre ready to send our case to the Supreme Court. We‚Äôll be applying for review by the Supreme Court, hopefully, today.‚Äù

Title: Stacey Abrams Voter Registration Group Denies Impropriety
Author: ['Kyle Morris']
Text:
Brad Raffensperger, Georgia‚Äôs Republican Secretary of State, resurrected a tired and false claim against the New Georgia Project‚Äôs legitimate efforts to register eligible Georgians to participate in elections in a press conference held Monday morning, November 30th.

Nse Ufot, Executive Director of the New Georgia Project said:

As Georgians are turning out in record numbers to have their voices heard at the polls, the Secretary of State is resorting to desperate attempts to smear law-abiding organizations and scare eligible Georgians from registering to vote in critical upcoming elections. We will not be deterred. This attack on our organization comes at a time when people across the country have witnessed the strength of our program and the collective power of a new Georgia electorate that embraces a system of inclusivity and opportunity for all Georgians. The timing is not accidental.

The organization also stated that it will ‚Äúcontinue its mission to register eligible voters in advance of the December 7th deadline‚Äù in its efforts to make sure that Georgia residents ‚Äúhave their voices heard at the polls and freely and fairly cast their ballots for those who would represent them.‚Äù

Raffensperger announced earlier Monday that his office will launch an investigation into voting groups accused of encouraging non-Georgia residents to register to vote in the runoff elections, which are set to take place on January 5.

‚ÄúWe have opened an investigation into a group called America Votes, who is sending absentee ballot applications to people at addresses where they have not lived since 1994,‚Äù Raffensperger said during a press conference, adding:

Voting in Georgia when you are not a resident of Georgia is a felony, and encouraging college kids to commit felonies with no regard for what [it] might mean for them is despicable. These third-party groups have a responsibility to not encourage illegal voting. If they do so, they will be held responsible.

Other organizations set to face scrutiny from the investigation include America Votes, Operation New Voter Registration Georgia, and Vote Forward.

Last week, Abrams announced that 900,000 Georgians had requested a mail-in ballot for the runoff elections between Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) and her Democrat challenger Raphael Warnock, and another between Sen. David Perdue (R-GA) and his Democrat opponent Jon Ossoff.

Interestingly, the Washington Free Beacon reported that Warnock served as the CEO of The New Georgia Project until February of this year.

‚ÄúWarnock was listed as CEO of the New Georgia Project from 2017 until Feb. 21, 2020, according to the group‚Äôs corporate filings,‚Äù the report stated. ‚ÄúHe has been identified as the New Georgia Project‚Äôs chairman and spokesman in media reports and has said he organized voter mobilization drives for the group, including a push to register 80,000 new minority voters in 2014.‚Äù

Title: Sarah Fuller‚Äôs Halftime Speech Has Some Accusing Vanderbilt of a Publicity Stunt
Author: ['Lara Gwinn']
Text:
Vanderbilt senior kicker Sarah Fuller made history on Saturday, becoming the first woman to play on the field in a Power 5 college football game, during the second-half kickoff against the Missouri Tigers. However, recent reports about what happened at halftime before her history-making kick have some believing that her presence on the field may have had more to do with publicity than football.

ESPN reporter Courtney Cronin tweeted on Sunday that she had just ended a Zoom interview with Fuller, where the history-making kicker detailed her halftime locker room speech. ‚ÄúI had coaches come up to me and say ‚ÄòI‚Äôve been wanting to say that for awhile now,'‚Äù Fuller reportedly said:

I just got off a Zoom call with Vanderbilt kicker Sarah Fuller, who detailed the halftime speech she gave and the reception it received. "I had coaches come up to me and say 'I‚Äôve been wanting to say that for awhile now,'" Fuller said. pic.twitter.com/AjoEEjJbeh ‚Äî Courtney Cronin (@CourtneyRCronin) November 29, 2020

Fuller reportedly said to her new teammates:

If I‚Äôm going to be honest, I was a little pissed off at how quiet everybody was on the sideline. ‚Ä¶ We made a first down, and I was the only one cheering and I was like ‚Äì what the heck? What‚Äôs going on? And I tried to get them pumped up, and I was like, ‚ÄòYou guys need to start [cheering] your team on.‚Äô

My main thing was during the SEC tournament, my entire team was cheering the entire time. It didn‚Äôt matter if we were in the locker room or if they were on the sidelines, I think that‚Äôs what won it for us. Everybody was cheering non-stop. I just went in there, and I said exactly what I was thinking. I was like, ‚ÄòWe need to be cheering each other on. This is how you win games. This is how you get better by calling each other out for stuff, and I‚Äôm going to call you guys out.‚Äô We need to be supporting one another. If we get a first down, if an interception happens, it‚Äôs our fault. We need to be lifting each other up. That‚Äôs what a team‚Äôs about. I think this team has struggled, and that‚Äôs been part of it. We really just need to build that team camaraderie where they can all lean on one another. It was an adjustment going from that team mentality where ‚Äì hey, we‚Äôre all here supporting one another, and I just wanted to bring that to this team.

Some took issue with Fuller‚Äôs locker room speech in particular. Joe Kinsey from Outkick questioned Fuller‚Äôs and Vanderbilt‚Äôs intent:

If you were on the fence about whether Vanderbilt using soccer goalie Sarah Fuller as a fill-in kicker for Saturday‚Äôs game against Missouri was a publicity stunt or a necessity, you got your answer on Sunday when it was announced that Fuller had given a halftime speech to her new teammates. Keep in mind, Fuller hadn‚Äôt yet stepped foot on the field for her kickoff before giving this speech. ‚Ä¶ As for this speech, you mean to tell me that a kicker who was pulled off the women‚Äôs soccer team and who started practicing with the football team on Tuesday was given the floor to lecture teammates on Saturday?‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you think freshman players on the women‚Äôs soccer team who‚Äôve never seen the field get up and give speeches to players who‚Äôve given four years to a program? Nope. Not happening,‚Äù Kinsey said.

Responses to Cronin‚Äôs tweet also questioned the validity of Vanderbilt‚Äôs intentions, with one person saying, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm all for her kicking, but this is absurd. Imagine a male walk on kicker of any sort showing up 7 games into the season, not even kicking yet, then lecturing the team about not cheering hard enough bc that‚Äôs what they did on his soccer team.‚Äù

I'm all for her kicking, but this is absurd. Imagine a male walk on kicker of any sort showing up 7 games into the season, not even kicking yet, then lecturing the team about not cheering hard enough bc that's what they did on his soccer team. ‚Äî Jackie Chiles (@ChilesJackie) November 29, 2020

Another response read, ‚ÄúI mean man or woman, what gives a soccer player who‚Äôs been on the team 3 days the RIGHT to stand up and call out players. Imagine being a senior in this locker room. What gives her the authority to do this? Especially a kicker?? Nah.. this ain‚Äôt it.‚Äù

I mean man or woman, what gives a soccer player who's been on the team 3 days the RIGHT to stand up and call out players. Imagine being a senior in this locker room. What gives her the authority to do this? Especially a kicker?? Nah.. this ain't it. ‚Äî Aaron Kizer (@AaronKizer53) November 29, 2020

Others supported Fuller‚Äôs place on the team as a needed move for Vanderbilt. Radio host Pat McAfee said, ‚ÄúShe was not out asking for this.. An opportunity presented itself,‚Äù and that it was not a publicity stunt:

I don't think @SarahFuller_27 becoming the first woman to kick for a Power 5 school was a publicity stunt. She was not out asking for this.. An opportunity presented itself #PatMcAfeeShowLIVE pic.twitter.com/0DhQEUPcAh ‚Äî Pat McAfee (@PatMcAfeeShow) November 30, 2020

Fuller had a response to her critics during a recent interview. When host Holly Rowe asked Fuller how she handles her critics, Fuller took it in stride, saying, ‚ÄúAt this point, like, what are you doing? You know? I am a [Division 1] soccer player. I‚Äôm going to Vanderbilt University. I‚Äôm getting my degree from here. I‚Äôve done amazing things,‚Äù she said:

Hear @sarahfuller_27 on the crazy reactions

-speaking to team at halftime

-what‚Äôs next

-how NEVER QUITTING led her to this historic moment for @vandyfootball @espnw @espncfb

Photo credits: Vanderbilt Athletics pic.twitter.com/njDDGodX1I ‚Äî Holly Rowe (@sportsiren) November 29, 2020

Vanderbilt head coach Derek Mason said on Wednesday, ‚ÄúRight now, we‚Äôre just looking at all options. ‚Ä¶ For us, talking to Sarah, she‚Äôs a champ, and no pun intended. Just coming off an SEC Championship in soccer‚Ä¶ She‚Äôs a complete competitor. She‚Äôs an option for us. Right now, that‚Äôs where we sit.

‚ÄúFor us, every week is [about] getting to the practice field and about making sure that we put the best possible kicker out there, so we‚Äôre competing,‚Äù Mason said.

Two other women, Katie Hnida of New Mexico and April Goss of Kent State, have played football at the FBS level. The Power 5 conferences consist of teams from the SEC, ACC, Big 10, Big 12, and Pac 12. Vanderbilt is a member of the SEC.

Title: FNC‚Äôs Geraldo Rivera: Trump Must Stop Attacking Election Results ‚Äî ‚ÄòEnough Is Enough Now‚Äô
Author: ['Pam Key']
Text:
Fox News Channel‚Äôs Geraldo Rivera called on President Donald Trump to stop attacking the presidential election as fraudulent because it could cost the Republican Party the Georgia Senate races and control of the Senate during an appearance on Monday‚Äôs broadcast of ‚ÄúThe Story.‚Äù

Rivera said, ‚ÄúIf people lose faith in Georgia‚Äôs electoral system and not show up, then they will be gifting Democrats control of the United States Senate. The stakes are so very high. They are astronomical. You know, as a person who has been accused of giving the president too much of the benefit of the doubt, I can‚Äôt imagine why the Republican senators aren‚Äôt rallying around the Georgia Republicans ‚Äì the secretary of state and the governor there ‚Äì and saying that, ‚ÄòThe system in Georgia will work. You got to vote. Everything is at stake here.‚Äô Rather than attacking the system, not only in Georgia but nationwide, undermines faith in the system, discourages people.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúI think that the president is on the wrong course here. I think he has got to take a real gut check between now and Saturday. With all due respect, and you know I love the guy, but enough is enough now.‚Äù

He added, ‚ÄúThis is the job he has now as the head of the GOP, as the commander-in-chief of the country ‚Äì he‚Äôs gotta rally the voters in Georgia. Control of the Senate is in the balance now, and if he allows his personal, you know, annoyance with the secretary of state and Governor Kemp to rule, then I think it‚Äôs going to be a devastating loss for the Republican Party.‚Äù
