Title: 'It's lovely to be back': on the streets of three-tier England as lockdown lifts
Text:
England‚Äôs second national lockdown lifted on Wednesday, with 99% of the population placed under the second and third tiers of a three-tier regime. However, non-essential shops are allowed to open under every tier, giving shop owners hope for a much-needed high street boost ahead of Christmas. The Guardian went out on Wednesday to take the mood across the different zones.

Tier 1: St Ives

The Three Ferrets pub in the Cornish harbour-side town of St Ives was buzzing with chatter and laughter.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs lovely to be back,‚Äù said Richard Cockling, 83, a retired merchant seaman and fisherman as he sipped on a celebratory gin and tonic. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve missed this place. The latest lockdown has been the worst ‚Äì long and boring. I couldn‚Äôt wait to get back into this place.‚Äù

Keith Tickner, 59, a cleaner, settled down in his usual cosy spot in front of the blazing fire with a group of friends. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt realise how much you miss your mates and your routine until you‚Äôre allowed back,‚Äù he said.

St Ives, a long-beloved retreat for artists, beach lovers and surfers, was recently judged the happiest place to live in the UK. On the day it and the rest of Cornwall became the only area in mainland England to begin life in tier 1 it felt a jolly town to be in.

From first light, the town was packed with delivery lorries restocking the shops, cafes and restaurants. Bleary-eyed kitchen staff emerged from furlough to begin prepping for dinner time while shopkeepers polished windows and scrubbed floors.

Sarah Allen outside her cafe Sky‚Äôs Diner in St Ives. Photograph: Jim Wileman/The Guardian

‚ÄúLook at that cobweb,‚Äù said Paul Clegg, a potter who specialises in lucky Cornish piskies, his take on the leprechaun, as he buffed his windows. ‚ÄúThis is the best place in the country anyway. So many people who live here came on holiday, then just decided to stay because it‚Äôs so nice. But it does feel a particularly good day today.‚Äù

Opposite, Sarah Allen was putting up Christmas lights outside her cafe, Sky‚Äôs Diner. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good to be back.‚Äù She expected to be busy. ‚ÄúI think we‚Äôll get visitors coming from all over the country who want a taste of life in tier 1,‚Äù she said.

Cornwall council‚Äôs leader, Julian German, called it a ‚Äúhuge moment‚Äù for the county but asked people not to drop their guard. ‚ÄúCovid doesn‚Äôt care what tier we‚Äôre in,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄòWe live in a bit of a bubble here‚Äô: Raven Williams, owner of the Common Wanderer outdoor shop. Photograph: Jim Wileman/The Guardian

The advantages of living in tier 1 include being allowed to have a drink in a pub without a meal and to meet in a group of up to six indoors as well as outside.

People from tier 3 areas have been urged by the council not to visit Cornwall and the police this week revealed that up to 10 extra cars would be patrolling Devon and Cornwall to deal with Covid rule-breakers.

The council said people from tier 2 areas should bring the restrictions they are subject to at home with them ‚Äúlike hand luggage‚Äù. For example, those in tier 2, should have a ‚Äúsubstantial meal‚Äù with their pub drink.

Of course, enforcing such rules are difficult. The Pilchard Press, a real ale pub tucked up an alley near the harbour, was taking no chances. It had fixed a notice to its railings reading: ‚ÄúCornwall residents only‚Äù.

At the Golden Lion pub, licensee Matt Squires said he would be politely asking people where they are from if he did not recognise them. ‚ÄúWe plan to keep people from different tiers separate,‚Äù he said. Locals will be able to use the front bar looking on to the street, visitors the back bar.

Raven Williams, owner of the Common Wanderer outdoor clothes shop, said that tier 1 living would not change much for many people. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good for the shops but actually we live in a bit of a bubble here, close to nature and the water. It‚Äôs why people like it.‚Äù SM

Tier 2: Liverpool

‚ÄòPeople don‚Äôt seem as scared to come out‚Äô: Rob Pritchard, manager at vintage clothes shop Resurrection in Liverpool. Photograph: Christopher Thomond/The Guardian

Vans lined up outside the independent shops and restaurants on Liverpool‚Äôs Bold Street in the morning drizzle to deliver stock to eager staff. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre feeling festive, we‚Äôve got our Christmas music on and our twinkly lights on,‚Äù said Nicki Whatling, a manager at Rennie‚Äôs Arts and Crafts, as picture frames were unloaded into the store.

While the shop has only 23 days to make up the bulk of lost sales over lockdown, she said she was hopeful the business could ‚Äúhave a fairly decent December‚Äù.

As the day wore on, Whatling‚Äôs wishes began to look more likely, with throngs of Christmas shoppers trickling up and down the city‚Äôs streets. At the vintage clothes store Resurrection, where students were sifting through leisurewear and parents were picking out gifts, the director Rob Pritchard said there had ‚Äúbeen a buzz about the place‚Äù in the middle of the day.

Usually, he said, the store would be much quieter in early December after the Black Friday sales weekend, but he predicted the store would continue to be busy throughout this month. ‚ÄúA lot of people are saying they‚Äôre taking the chance to get back into the city again. I‚Äôve heard so many people say that today,‚Äù he said.

Staff put out tables at Crust pizza restaurant on Bold Street in Liverpool. Photograph: Christopher Thomond/The Guardian

‚ÄúWhen we ended the last lockdown some people were still too scared to come out. This time maybe because the infection rates have fallen so much in Liverpool, they don‚Äôt seem as scared to come.‚Äù

Meanwhile, at the pizza restaurant Crust, the manager Antonio Fornaro was grateful the venue had been able to open ahead of Christmas. ‚ÄúWhen they announced it, I had calls from all my colleagues saying, ‚ÄòYes! We‚Äôre going to be able to open‚Äô,‚Äù he said.

Throughout England‚Äôs second national lockdown, takeaway sales had dropped off as people reigned in spending, said Fornaro. But on Wednesday afternoon, the reduced tables and chairs in the restaurant were full once again.

Shoppers in Liverpool. Photograph: Christopher Thomond/The Guardian

Outside the trainer store Size?, university student Adam Macholc, 18, was one of a small socially distanced group of sneakerheads waiting for the latest Adidas drop as staff inside got ready to open. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm buying them for myself,‚Äù he said, adding that despite a turbulent first term, ‚Äúit feels like there‚Äôs a bit more hope‚Äù after the news that the UK had approved the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine.

In Liverpool‚Äôs main commercial shopping district, around the Liverpool ONE shopping centre, other shoppers seemed to be feeling confident too. A queue snaked around the city‚Äôs Primark store, while shoppers trickled in and out of Debenhams to pick up a bargain.

Willing some of them to stop for a substantial meal and a drink on their way home, was the manager of the Doctor Duncan‚Äôs pub, Amy McCarthy. Under tier 2 regulations, a key difference with tier 1 is alcohol cannot be served without food and there must be no multiple household mixing in venues like Doctor Duncan‚Äôs. The pub, located away from the main shopping centre next to Liverpool Lime Street station, had a quiet day with only a handful of customers.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre right next to the bus stops where people usually head to football games and are known for being the first and the last stop. So it‚Äôs different territory for us having to emphasise our pub grub,‚Äù she said. AW

Tier 3: Nottingham

Tallulah Harries-Pugh with her mum, Gina, in Nottingham as the second lockdown lifts. Photograph: Fabio De Paola/The Guardian

After a month cooped up indoors, shoppers in Nottingham seized the opportunity to return to the city centre on Wednesday.

The east Midlands city is back in tier 3, and is therefore subject to England‚Äôs toughest coronavirus restrictions. Shops, hair salons and gyms have been allowed to reopen, but hospitality venues must offer takeaway or delivery only.

In the city centre, stallholders were preparing for this weekend‚Äôs opening of the Christmas market on Old Market Square, in the heart of the city.

The prime location is overlooked by an imposing six-storey stone building which houses the department store Debenhams, and on the other side of the square is a Dorothy Perkins and a Burton ‚Äì brands that are part of Philip Green‚Äôs Arcadia empire. Both Debenhams and Arcadia are living on borrowed time, having collapsed into administration on consecutive days this week

If Arcadia‚Äôs brands do not find a buyer, Nottingham will feel the impact of store closures keenly. The city is home to nine Arcadia stores ‚Äì .

Tallulah Harries-Pugh, 29, was holding a Topshop carrier bag, but with an item to return rather than a new purchase.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt agree with Sir Philip Green‚Äôs ethics, and I try not to shop [at Arcadia brands],‚Äù said Tallulah. But she said she was worried about the staff, and what more store closures would mean for the high street.

The scars of another recent retail collapse are clearly visible in Nottingham city centre. One of the city‚Äôs two shopping centres, Broadmarsh, was half-demolished with plans under way for a multimillion pound redevelopment, when its owner, the retail property company Intu, collapsed in June.

The city council has been handed the keys to the development and has already spent ¬£19m on the project. Councillor Sam Webster, whose ward covers the city centre, concedes it won‚Äôt be a ‚Äúquick fix‚Äù.

Carl Davies, a staff member at the Five Leaves bookshop in Nottingham. Photograph: Fabio De Paola/The Guardian

‚ÄúIt is a challenge, but it is also an opportunity. The project is probably the biggest regeneration in a core city in the country‚Äù.

In the short-term, however, Nottingham‚Äôs businesses have to contend with tier 3 restrictions.

Prof David Paton from Nottingham University business school warns that retailers will feel the impact of cafe, pub and restaurant closures. ‚ÄúThere is a lot of interlinkage between high street hospitality and shops. Nottingham is going to face that, as all tier 3 will.‚Äù

In a normal year the nine stainless steel fermenting vessels at the Castle Rock brewery near the city‚Äôs train station would be full, ahead of the expected peak in demand during the festive season. This December they are empty.

‚ÄòWe won‚Äôt brew again before Christmas‚Äô: Colin Wilde, MD of Castle Rock brewery in Nottingham. Photograph: Fabio De Paola/The Guardian

‚ÄúWe won‚Äôt brew again before Christmas,‚Äù said the managing director, Colin Wilde. The brewer and pub operator has 22 sites in Nottingham and across the east Midlands, all in tier 3.

The company now offers takeaway alcohol from its brewery and pubs, but it brings in less than 10% of normal trade, and Wilde said the closed pubs ‚Äúleak cash‚Äù.

‚ÄúAs a sector, we feel like canaries in a cage. It feels like politicians are testing things out on the hospitality sector and don‚Äôt think it matters if it dies.‚Äù JP

Title: No 10 and regulator contradict Hancock's 'because of Brexit' Covid vaccine claim
Text:
Both Downing Street and the UK‚Äôs medicines regulator have contradicted a claim by Matt Hancock that Brexit helped the UK become the first western country to license a vaccine against coronavirus.

The health secretary asserted on Wednesday morning that ‚Äúbecause of Brexit‚Äù the UK had been able to approve the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine, rather than wait for the European Medicines Agency (EMA) to do so.

However, the government announcement of the decision said it had taken place under a provision of the Human Medicines Regulations, passed in 2012, which permits the rapid licensing of medicines in the event of an emergency such as a pandemic.

The UK is still under the remit of the EMA until the end of the Brexit transition period on 1 January, and EU laws also allow other member states to approve medicines for emergency use without EMA authorisation.

At a government briefing about the UK‚Äôs decision to become the first country to license the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine for emergency use, the head of the UK‚Äôs Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Authority (MHRA), which made the decision, cited EU rules. ‚ÄúWe have been able to authorise the supply of this vaccine using provisions under European law, which exist until 1 January,‚Äù said June Raine, the MHRA‚Äôs chief executive.

Timeline UK Covid-19 restrictions: the key political dates ahead Show Hide Here are some of the key dates ahead for the UK's Covid-19 restrictions. The current lockdown in England ends, and the new strengthened tier system comes into force with nearly 99% of England headed for the strictest two tiers. Only the Isle of Wight, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly are set to go into tier 1, with more than 32 million people in tier 2 and more than 23 million in the toughest tier 3. New restriction come into force in Wales. Pubs, restaurants and cafes will be banned from serving alcohol, and will be unable to open to customers beyond 6pm. Businesses can offer a takeaway service after 6pm, and if they have an off-licence can sell takeaway alcohol up until 10pm. Bingo halls, bowling alleys, soft play centres, casinos, skating rinks and amusement arcades will also have to close. The rule allowing four people from four different households to meet indoors in pubs and restaurants will stay in place. The decision will be reviewed on 17 December. Ministers will consider data about England's coronavirus cases weekly throughout the tiers period, while legislation requires a formal review of tiering allocations every fortnight. The first review point is 16 December, with new tier allocations announced the following day ‚Äì decided by a cabinet committee chaired by the prime minister. They will come into effect on Saturday 19 December, Boris Johnson said. For five days over Christmas there will be a UK-wide relaxation of rules to let up to three households form a 'bubble' so they can mix socially indoors and stay overnight to enjoy the festive period together. In Scotland, a maximum of eight people will be allowed but that does not include under-12s. In Northern Ireland, the window has been extended to 22-28 December to allow for additional travel time between countries. Johnson has announced a ‚Äúsunset‚Äù clause on the tiered restrictions in England, meaning they will expire on 3 February and require MPs‚Äô approval if they are to be extended into March.

Asked about the contradiction between these comments and Hancock‚Äôs stated view, Boris Johnson‚Äôs spokesman pointedly declined to back the health secretary.

‚ÄúI think the important point is that we are the first country in the world to approve this vaccine, thanks to the hard work of the MHRA,‚Äù he said, when asked whether Hancock had been correct to credit Brexit.

Pressed repeatedly on whether No 10 agreed with Hancock, the spokesman said only: ‚ÄúAs I‚Äôve said, it‚Äôs clear that we‚Äôre the first country in the world to approve this vaccine, and it‚Äôs obviously incredibly positive news.‚Äù

The health secretary made the claim in an interview with Times Radio, saying one reason for the quick approval was the MHRA‚Äôs ‚Äúgreat job of working with the company to look at that data as it‚Äôs come through and do things in parallel, rather than one after the other as they normally would‚Äù.

Hancock continued: ‚ÄúThe second reason is because, whilst until earlier this year we were in the European Medicines Agency, because of Brexit we‚Äôve been able to make a decision to do this based on the UK regulator, a world-class regulator, and not go at the pace of the Europeans, who are moving a little bit more slowly.

‚ÄúWe do all the same safety checks and the same processes, but we have been able to speed up how they‚Äôre done because of Brexit.‚Äù

'The buck stops with her': the woman who makes call on UK's Covid vaccines Read more

The Liberal Democrats said Hancock had been playing ‚Äúfast and loose with the facts‚Äù over the vaccine. The party‚Äôs health spokeswoman, Munira Wilson, said the claim ‚Äúis not only fanciful, but shows his desperation to try and point-score, no matter how ridiculous it makes him look‚Äù.

The ability for the UK to approve the vaccine before the EMA falls under section 174 of the Human Medicines Regulations, which also allows for medicine approvals in the event of emergencies, not only in pandemics but also in the event of nuclear or chemical contamination.

Play Video 2:15 'Day to remember in a year to forget': Hancock says first 800,000 doses of vaccine tested ‚Äì video

In October, Hancock‚Äôs department updated the regulations to boost the MHRA‚Äôs ability to push through vaccine approval.

A government source said that while such a route would have been open to other EU states, the UK was focused on non-EMA approval as ‚Äúpart of wider conversations‚Äù about the MHRA‚Äôs lead role in medicines regulation after Brexit, and that this most likely speeded up the vaccine approval process.

The EMA‚Äôs role in UK regulation will not fully end on 1 January, as its approvals will still be valid in the UK for two more years, as well as those made by the MHRA.

Title: Fans Concerned After Oprah‚Äôs Favorite Things List Just 6-Pack Of Miller Lite
Text:
CHICAGO‚ÄîRevealing their sincere worries about the iconic talk show host‚Äôs wellbeing and mental health, fans expressed concerns Friday after Oprah Winfrey‚Äôs annual Favorite Things list only featured a six-pack of Miller Lite. ‚ÄúYeah, I know this year has been hard on everyone, but I guess I wasn‚Äôt expecting Oprah would just include a sixer of cheap beer or rave about how great it was to crack open a brew to start off your bullshit day,‚Äù said Sarah Alexander of the short gift list slated to be published in O, The Oprah Magazine alongside a full- page spread of Winfrey in a baggy Tennessee State sweatshirt, reclining on a sofa littered with empty cans. ‚ÄúIt was also a little disturbing to hear her say that they were the perfect gift for a friend, family member, or coworker who wanted to unwind during their commute or just blow off all of life‚Äôs fucking hassles by pulling over into a parking lot and getting tanked. I thought there‚Äôd be a lotion or a candle recommendation, but nope. Just her saying that the can also makes a handy ashtray. Jeez, y‚Äôknow? Is everything okay?‚Äù Alexander also expressed consternation that the media mogul encouraged to pass on the giving spirit ‚Äúwith love and delight‚Äù by drunkenly taking a leak on their neighbor‚Äôs lawn.

Title: Michelle Obama Fuming After Barack Also Titles New Memoir ‚ÄòBecoming‚Äô
Text:
WASHINGTON‚ÄîCalling the discovery ‚Äúunbelievable,‚Äù Michelle Obama was reportedly fuming Friday after learning Barack Obama had also titled his new memoir Becoming. ‚ÄúI know I don‚Äôt own a trademark on the word ‚Äòbecoming,‚Äô but what the fuck, Barack?‚Äù said the former first lady, who was bewildered after coming across an advanced reading copy of her husband‚Äôs latest book hidden under a pile of clutter on his desk. ‚ÄúWas he going to tell me or was he just going to wait for me to see it at the store? He even has his chin on his hand, Jesus Christ. It‚Äôs not like he can claim ignorance on this one either because he read mine and assured me that he liked it. This is why he kept giving me all those suggestions like ‚Äòyou should call it Me, Myself, Michelle.‚Äô That goddamn son of a bitch.‚Äù At press time, Michelle Obama was calling her husband‚Äôs cell phone after noticing a glowing blurb on the book jacket attributed to her that she had never written.

Title: Alex Trebek Politely Listens To Lame Anecdote About Time Archangel Saw Bear
Text:
THE HEAVENS‚ÄîDutifully feigning interest as the celestial being recalled the incident, the ascended soul of late Jeopardy! host Alex Trebek politely listened to an archangel‚Äôs lame anecdote about the time he saw a bear, sources from on high confirmed Monday. ‚ÄúMy friend and I went to Yosemite once, and this big black bear just appeared out of nowhere,‚Äù said the Archangel Michael, Prince of the Heavenly Host, who continued to recount the forgettable story as the beloved TV personality reportedly gave a cordial nod and tried to wrap things up. ‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt have any bear spray or anything, but it was fine, since it was pretty far away and, for the most part, they‚Äôre shy and timid creatures. Apparently with black bears you‚Äôre supposed to make yourself appear larger, but with grizzlies you‚Äôre supposed to play dead. They don‚Äôt have grizzlies at Yosemite, though. Just black bears, and I‚Äôm not sure if this one even noticed us.‚Äù Before the archangel could finish the story, Trebek is said to have cut him off and begun speaking to the Archangel Raphael, who had a story about a time he served James Gandolfini in a coffee shop.

Title: Aaron Sorkin Defends Taking Liberties With Scene In Which All Members Of Chicago 7 Endorse Joe Biden
Text:
LOS ANGELES‚ÄîAddressing criticism about the film during a press junket in support of its streaming release, director Aaron Sorkin told reporters Monday that he stood by taking liberties with a scene in The Trial Of The Chicago 7 in which every member of the group announces their unequivocal endorsement of Joe Biden. ‚ÄúLook, we may have taken some creative license here and there, but the spirit of the Chicago 7 has absolutely been preserved by having these protesters offer their full-throated support to Joe Biden‚Äôs presidential bid,‚Äù said the director, who repeatedly stood by the moment when all of the defendants in the trial for their incitement to riot look directly into the camera and emotionally declare ‚ÄúJoe Biden is the right man for the job!‚Äù over the judge‚Äôs strenuous objections. ‚ÄúNow, obviously, is the movie mostly about the 1968 Vietnam protests? Of course. But would we have served [Yippy founder] Abbie Hoffman‚Äôs memory better by removing the heartbreaking moment where he breaks down in tears under cross-examination, stands up his seat, and shouts ‚ÄòYour honor, I‚Äôm not sure we see eye to eye on everything, but I fervently agree with Joe Biden that we must restore the soul of this country‚Äô? I don‚Äôt think so. Just think about it. These men were progressives; many people who support Joe Biden now are progressives. So, if you really examine things, this is exactly what would‚Äôve happened.‚ÄùAt press time, Sorkin had abruptly backpedaled after a follow-up question on an episode in The West Wing‚Äôs third season in which the characters played by Martin Sheen, John Spencer, and Bradley Whitford discover Saddam Hussein has weapons of mass destruction during a routine diplomatic visit to Iraq.

Title: David Blaine Wakes Up In Cold Sweat From Nightmare In Which He Dies Of Natural Causes
Text:
NEW YORK‚ÄîMumbling the words ‚Äúold age‚Äù and ‚Äúin his sleep‚Äù as he thrashed and screamed wildly, illusionist David Blaine reportedly woke up in a cold sweat from a nightmare Friday in which he died of natural causes. ‚ÄúOh my G od, that was terrible; it really felt like I was on my deathbed, passing away painlessly and peacefully while surrounded by friends and family,‚Äù said Blaine, wiping perspiration from his brow and reminding himself that he was far more likely to die suffocating handcuffed in a tank of ice-cold water, or falling 30,000 feet from a balloon floating through the troposphere, than from something as insane as heart disease. ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt unsee it. There was no stage. No crowd. No cage. No knives being repeatedly shoved through my stomach, or a school of sharks ripping me limb from limb. It was just me, the doctor, my wife, my children, and my grandchildren. And we were praying. Jesus Christ, I‚Äôm really losing it.‚Äù At press time, Blaine was reportedly finally able to go back to sleep after taking a few deep breaths, drinking a glass of water, and strapping himself nude to a lightning rod on the roof of his apartment.

Title: Bob Dylan Not Exactly Rising To Occasion As Far As Current Protest Music Goes
Text:
NEW YORK‚ÄîIn a nation mired in a deadly pandemic, mass civilian street actions, widespread environmental degradation, and collapsing institutions under the fourth year of Donald Trump‚Äôs presidency, it had become clear to sources Friday that Bob Dylan was not exactly rising to the occasion as far as his current protest music goes. ‚ÄúSeriously, we‚Äôre in this terrible moment full of awful crises and wanton violence, which really should be easy fodder for even a half-decent protest singer, and here Bob Dylan can‚Äôt even get his shit together for a three-minute tune,‚Äù sources said, adding that apparently the so-called Voice of a Generation couldn‚Äôt cobble together at least one extended metaphor that fiercely and poetically captured the current situation for a 2020 audience. ‚ÄúWe gave you a Nobel Prize for Literature, and for what? So you can release some esoteric 17-minute song about the Kennedy assassination in goddamn March and call it a day? We‚Äôre still droning people in half a dozen countries, for Christ‚Äôs sake. Look, you have a lot of options here‚Äîsome sparsely instrumented yet grand statement that perfectly summarizes the current maelstrom of blame and chaos like ‚ÄòBlowin‚Äô In The Wind‚Äô or ‚ÄòThe Times They Are A-Changin‚Äô‚Äô would be ideal, obviously, but if you would rather hone in on some specific episode of social injustice that serves as a microcosm of a commentary on systemic issues, like ‚ÄòHurricane‚Äô or ‚ÄòThe Lonesome Death Of Hattie Carroll,‚Äô that works too. Your lyrics don‚Äôt even rhyme. All you have to do is sit down with a guitar and just poignantly and pointedly attack the actions of the Trump administration, or really any other aspect of our present moment. It‚Äôs not like we‚Äôre lacking for subject matter. Jesus, Bob, get your shit together.‚Äù Sources added that they would give Dylan the rest of the month to release something as galvanizing and timelessly true as ‚ÄúMasters Of War.‚Äù

Title: Psychic Already Sick Of Spectral James Randi Ragging On Her From Afterlife
Text:
MIAMI‚ÄîStruggling to mentally close herself off from the recently deceased skeptic, local psychic Rosemary Shanley confirmed Thursday she was already sick of James Randi‚Äôs specter haunting her place of business and ragging on her from the afterlife. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sitting here with my crystal ball trying to see into the future, and it‚Äôs hard enough without the ghost of James Randi hovering in front of me and whispering that I‚Äôm a fraud and a huckster,‚Äù said Shanley, adding that she tried to banish the spirit of the famed debunker and stage magician by sprinkling holy water throughout the room, but the Amazing Randi just scoffed and called the ritual ‚Äúeasily disproved theatrics.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs worse is that he‚Äôs taken to appearing before my clients and showing them how he can do everything I can do using nothing more than simple trickery. I was impressed when he first showed up and appeared to roll a pencil across my desk using only his mind, but then he insisted it was basic misdirection and called me a dumbass for believing in psychic powers. That dude needs to get off my case and go heckle some other clairvoyant.‚Äù At press time, sources from the beyond confirmed Randi had taken possession of Shanley‚Äôs body and was attempting to locate Uri Geller.

Title: Jason Momoa Brings In Scene Double For Challenging Facial Expression
Text:
VANCOUVER, CANADA‚ÄîReferring to his on-screen doppelg√§nger as a ‚Äútotal badass,‚Äù Jason Momoa, star of the forthcoming Aquaman 2, told reporters Monday he and the film‚Äôs producers had brought in a scene double to help execute a particularly challenging facial expression required of his character. ‚ÄúI actually do a lot of my own acting, but when the script calls for something really tricky, it‚Äôs always best to call in a professional,‚Äù said Momoa, whose agent confirmed the Teen Choice Award-nominated actor had long relied on seasoned Hollywood scene double Phil Westwood to handle more complex emotions such as apprehension, remorse, or despair. ‚ÄúWhile I can manage a bit of glowering, or even fly into a rage, sometimes you have to think about what‚Äôs best for the production and say, ‚ÄòOkay, these faces are really hard to make. We need someone who‚Äôs trained for this sort of thing.‚Äô I first worked with Phil back on Game Of Thrones, when my character was supposed to be angry and in love at the same time, and it was way too hard to do both. You should see some of the feelings this guy can express‚Äîit‚Äôs wild.‚Äù At press time, sources said production for Aquaman 2 had been delayed so Westwood could wrap up some acting work as John Cena‚Äôs scene double in Fast And Furious 9.

Title: Conservative Conspiracy Theorist Outraged After Stumbling Upon Entire Netflix Section Dedicated To Kids

Title: Mom Completely Understands That Coming To Thanksgiving Is Risky And That You Don‚Äôt Love Her Anymore
Text:
KANSAS CITY, MO‚ÄîAcknowledging that she had seen all the warnings about holiday travel on the news, local mom Mary Simpson announced Tuesday that she completely understood that coming to Thanksgiving would be risky for all involved and that you didn‚Äôt love her anymore. ‚ÄúNo, no, don‚Äôt apologize, honey‚Äîif it isn‚Äôt safe and you don‚Äôt care enough about me to make the trip, you should probably just stay home this year,‚Äù Simpson said in between audibly heavy sighs, adding that if anyone understood it was her, what with her migraines and your father‚Äôs bad knee making their last trip to visit you so difficult, though they obviously wouldn‚Äôt have missed it for the world. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm quite aware of the public health situation, so there‚Äôs no need to explain why you think it might be too tricky to navigate travel when you clearly have a life of your own with no room in it for a boring old lady like me. After all, we‚Äôre living in difficult times, and I‚Äôm sure the last thing you want to do right now is come see the person who gave you life and loves you more than anything in the world. I‚Äôll just be here in this big, quiet house with your dad and no one else, if you‚Äôre saying that‚Äôs the safest way to celebrate.‚Äù Simpson went on to remark that she might as well not bother cooking a Thanksgiving meal this year, seeing as there would be far too many leftovers to deal with if you weren‚Äôt coming.

Title: Private Eye Struggling To Meet Women Who Aren‚Äôt Suspect In Late Husband‚Äôs Murder
Text:
LOS ANGELES‚ÄîPeering through the blinds into the glow of a nearby streetlight, local private eye Cliff Hardy confirmed Tuesday that it was hard for him to meet women who weren‚Äôt suspects in the murders of their own husbands, the mysterious circumstances of which he happened to be investigating at their behest. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like to be in a relationship, but the only girls I ever meet are the ones who walk into my office‚ÄîI look up and they‚Äôre just there, slowly pulling their gloves off, telling me some sob story about their dead husbands,‚Äù Hardy said from beneath a tan fedora, recalling the dozen or so women he‚Äôd met most recently, all of whom were wealthy dowagers primed to inherit their husbands‚Äô multimillion- dollar oil empires, former Hollywood starlets next in line to run their husbands‚Äô blockbuster movie studios, or femme fatales who married and then destroyed men just for the sport of it. ‚ÄúI need to find a way to meet women who don‚Äôt want to hire me to investigate the very murders they themselves turn out to be guilty of. It‚Äôs hard, because they give me these signals like they‚Äôre really into me, often sitting suggestively on my desk and flashing me a bit of thigh or taking a seductive drag off my cigarette. But then the next thing I know they‚Äôve got a pistol pointed at me. What gives? Just once I‚Äôd like to meet a dame done up head-to-toe in a ravishing evening gown who isn‚Äôt trying to pin the disappearance of her rich husband on me! Maybe it‚Äôs time I got out of this town.‚Äù At press time, reports confirmed Hardy had struck out again after he agreed to have a drink with a woman, his vision started swirling, and he woke up to find he had been committed to a local mental institution.

Title: Boyfriend Announces Kneecap Apparently Worst Place To Get Shot
Text:

Can you imagine what that would feel like? This guy I knew in college told me his cousin accidentally shot himself in the kneecap and it hurt like a motherfucker. And I guess the worst part is there‚Äôs no surgery that can fix it. SARASOTA, FL‚ÄîExpressing his shock at having been taken completely off guard, local cat Muffins acknowledged Monday that no amount of training could have prepared him for his first experience encountering a mouse in real life. ‚ÄúMan, I‚Äôve spent hours and hours simulating a confrontation with a mouse, but when the real moment comes, all that practice goes right out the window,‚Äù said the two-year-old American shorthair, confirming that his daily regimen of pouncing, scratching, and running in circles around his apartment had done virtually nothing to help equip him for the sensation of coming face-to-face with a genuine rodent. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll admit I used to be pretty cocky. Instinct takes over, and it doesn‚Äôt matter how sharp your claws are, that‚Äôs the moment when you find out if you‚Äôve got what it takes, and let me tell you what‚Äîreal mice don‚Äôt have catnip inside them, buddy, you can bet on that.‚Äù Muffins added that since he was now a killer, he didn‚Äôt know if he‚Äôd be able to return to living in a pretend fantasy world.

Title: Gamers, We Pulled Some Strings And We‚Äôre Pleased To Announce That The Common Loon Is Now Officially The Gaming Bird
Text:
Boy, have we got some good news for you, gamers. Oh yes, we do. What is it, you may be wondering? Well, get ready, because it‚Äôs going to knock your socks off: After pulling some strings, we are pleased to announce that the common loon Gavia immer is now officially the gaming bird!

Let‚Äôs just say we reached out to our people at the Audubon Society, called in a few favors from some old business associates at the World Wildlife Fund for Nature, and, well, we managed to work something out.

Title: Review: The PS5 Is A Game-Changing Next-Gen Console That Santa Just Can‚Äôt Afford Right Now, Okay, Sport?
Text:
Anticipation has been off the charts for the latest iteration of the PlayStation, and now that the system has finally hit shelves, it‚Äôs clear that Sony has delivered in a major way. Soaring ahead of its competition, the PS5 is a game-changing next- generation console that Santa just can‚Äôt afford right now, okay, S port?



Advertisement

Sadly, things are a little tight money-wise in Santa‚Äôs Workshop at the moment, C hamp, if that makes sense.



Building on the success of the PS4, the gigantic new console pushes gaming to a whole new level, utilizing an AMD-powered GPU that can process 10.28 teraflops for the most immersive user experience to date. Santa would simply love to get one for you, Slugger, if the economy wasn‚Äôt so bad right now that it‚Äôs even affecting the North Pole.

Advertisement

Perhaps most impressive of all the PS5 ‚Äô s features is its DualSense controller, whose minimalist aesthetic belies a sophisticated interface with greatly improved haptic feedback that allows you to feel as though you‚Äôre really there with every raindrop, or at least, you would feel that way if the bank could have just cut Santa some slack with interest payments on his magical sled.

Preloaded with the enjoyable, if not revolutionary, platformer Astro‚Äôs Playroom, which serves mostly as a demo reel of the console‚Äôs newest technologies, there are actually two editions of the system available: one including a 4K Blu-ray drive with a price tag of $499, and the slimmer Digital Edition, which at $100 less is still too big an expense for Santa what with all the payments for someone to babysit all of his reindeer and little elves.

Advertisement

Of course, the PS5 is not completely perfect. There are some noticeable flubs here and there, including an overreliance on outmoded options menus and a counterintuitive home button configuration, so no need to cry, Buddy, huh? It‚Äôs not because of anything you did. You‚Äôve been so good this year! Santa still loves you very, very much, and I promise there‚Äôs so much other fun other stuff you‚Äôre going to get this year that you won‚Äôt even miss the PlayStation, honest!



Remember how much you like Air Bud? Well, let‚Äôs just say ol‚Äô Saint Nick got his hands on the DVDs for a few sequels this holiday season.



Advertisement

Thanks to its impressive engineering, backwards compatibility, and exciting pipeline of new titles showing off exactly what the next-gen is all about, we‚Äôre sure the PS5 is going to be around for quite a while. So dry your eyes, Chief, and think about how much more you‚Äôll appreciate the system when you get it for your birthday next year or maybe next Christmas depending on how a couple of Santa‚Äôs job interviews pan out.

Title: Ah, Shoot: We Forgot To Drain Our Xbox Over The Weekend And Now All The Game Fluid Leaked Out
Text:
Well, dang it. We‚Äôre feeling pretty annoyed right now because we just walked into the OGN offices after taking the weekend off and we were met with a nasty surprise: W e forgot to drain our new Xbox Series X over the weekend, and now all the game fluid leaked out.



Advertisement

Ugh, this sucks.

Obviously, the manual says to drain your Series X every six to eight hours with the included syringe, but we just completely neglected to head into work a few times to open up the excess valve and make sure the video game runoff didn‚Äôt gunk up the works. It really spilled everywhere‚Äî the whole outside of the console is green with congealed gaming fluid, the fluid valve has shattered from excess pressure, and it looks like a fair amount of the stuff even dripped down the table and seeped into the carpet.

Advertisement

This is a major drag, and it‚Äôs made all the worse by the fact that we have no one to blame but ourselves. We even remember thinking on Friday, ‚ÄúHmm, it‚Äôs been a while since anyone drained the Xbox, and we‚Äôve been going pretty hard on Demon‚Äôs Souls lately, so we probably need to soon.‚Äù On the other hand, it was the end of the day and we didn‚Äôt want to have to walk all the way to the bathroom to flush it down the toilet. Oh well, we suppose hindsight is 20/20.

Oh, crap. Now that we‚Äôve been standing in here for a little while, it‚Äôs really clear that the distinctive bitter gaming fluid smell has seeped into most of the fabric, too. God, it‚Äôs really noxious. Maybe it would help if we open a window or something.

Advertisement

We guess this is just one of those things that happens to you once and then you learn your lesson. Suffice it to say, we won‚Äôt leave the office again without double-checking each and every one of our Xboxes to en sure the gaming fluid dial is at 50% or lower. Honestly, at this point, this whole thing has been such a headache, so we‚Äôre thinking about maybe even investing in one of those automatic fluid changers that they sell on Hammacher Schlemmer.

Okay, gamers, well we‚Äôre going to grab some Lysol and paper towels and try to dab out some of it out of the drapes, but honestly, we don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs going to require a professional cleaning or what. Yuck. What a morning.

Title: Gamers, We Need To Come Clean: ‚ÄòCyberpunk 2077‚Äô Is Just A Lie We Made Up To Make You Like Us That Got Way Out Of Hand
Text:
Hey, gamers! We know there‚Äôs one game left in this generation that‚Äôs been getting you more pumped than anything else. In fact, this open-world RPG from CD Projekt Red is probably one of the things that has kept you going through this tough year. But we need to just come clean and get this off our backs: Cyberpunk 2077 is not a real game. It was just something we made up to sound cool and interesting in front of you so you would like us and now that lie is spinning completely out of control.



Advertisement

Please don‚Äôt hate us.

Now, we‚Äôre sure your mad. We know you were counting down the days until you could explore a fully realized Night City as part of the ultra-customizable gameplay you‚Äôve been seeing in hands-on videos for months. But it‚Äôs a lie. It‚Äôs all a goddamn lie and we‚Äôre sorry. We just really like when you hang out on the site, and we wanted you to stick around. That‚Äôs why we made it up way back in 2012 and got the developer to play along.

Advertisement

This started as a dumb little fib about something we thought you would like and now it‚Äôs become this huge weight on our chest, getting heavier and heavier every day. We just couldn‚Äôt keep it down anymore without having a panic attack.



We know what you are thinking. The screenshots? The previews? Our art department created it all. We thought we could keep up the charade for a year or two more with a trickle of delays and impressions about the gangs, the dynamic police system, all of it. But in the back of our heads, we always knew that one day, you would expect this game to come out and we would be caught.



Advertisement

Some of this is on you. Why do you think it‚Äôs been delayed so many times? We flirted with the idea of canceling it all together, saying CD Projekt Red had gone bankrupt or something. But then we would have never been free from the manacles of this lie.



We were just insecure, you know? There are so many video game sites out there and we‚Äôve always kind of felt like outcasts. Talking about Cyberpunk was the first time we ever really felt like we were part of something, like you actually wanted to hear what we had to say. In a way we wanted it to be real‚Äîthe customizable weapons and slow-motion combat sequences. It all sounded so cool and we didn‚Äôt want to let you down. Please don‚Äôt blame us. After all, our intentions were good.

Advertisement

We did this for you, even if we only ended up hurting you.

To be fair you probably should have figured it out years ago. The idea of a sci-fi shooter from the makers of The Witcher series was always a bit of a wish fulfillment fantasy wasn‚Äôt it? Obviously, we‚Äôre not trying to absolve ourselves of this. But we kind of assumed you would catch on when we claimed Keanu Reeves was going to be in the game. That doesn‚Äôt make any sense if you just think about it for a second. But we just blurted it out a few months ago, and then all it took was hiring him for a few press appearances and we were in the clear again.

Advertisement

At least, until now.



So, listen, what we are trying to say is: We‚Äôre very sorry. This video game is never going to come out. It doesn‚Äôt ev en exist. Of course, we understand if you never trust us again to deliver honest coverage of the industry. On the plus side, getting this all out there makes us feel like we can finally breathe again without hating ourselves. We‚Äôre sure you‚Äôll need some time to process this, and we could use a little time to ourselves to figure out why we‚Äôre like this.

Advertisement

Unfortunately, we also aren‚Äôt able to refund any of your pre-orders. That money is already spent.

Title: Someone Needs To Explain: The Upcoming Games In The ‚ÄòMario,‚Äô ‚ÄòGTA,‚Äô and ‚ÄòMetal Gear Solid‚Äô Series Are All Called ‚ÄòThe Sands Of Time‚Äô
Text:
Okay gamers, here at OGN, we pride ourselves on providing the most comprehensive look at the much- anticipated video games. But now we have a piece of truly perplexing news that we‚Äôre going to need someone to sort out for us. Today, in separate press conferences, the biggest publishers in the world just revealed that the upcoming installments in the Super Mario, Grand Theft Auto, and Metal Gear Solid franchises are somehow all subtitled ‚Äú The Sands of Time‚Äù ?



Advertisement

Your guess is as good as ours, gamers. We got nothing on this one.

While we‚Äôre incredibly excited to have Nintendo, Rockstar Games, and Hideo Kojima all taking the stage on the same day, we‚Äôre also having a tremendous amount of trouble wrapping our heads around why each of the developers‚Äô latest games seems to be named after the 2003 action-platformer set in ancient Persia‚Äîor are they? We really have no idea.

Advertisement

It‚Äôs especially confusing given that most of the titles in some way makes use of an hourglass in the graphic. You could argue that it was just a mistake if it only happened to be one of these companies that adopted the ‚ÄúSands of Time‚Äù suffix. But all three? It just doesn‚Äôt make any sense.

Super Mario: Sands of Time. Grand Theft Auto: The Sands of Time. Metal Gear Solid: The Sands of Time. We‚Äôre not going to act like these aren‚Äôt cool titles. They definitely are. But we‚Äôd assume that Ubisoft would have the exclusive rights to that phrase. Even if not, why would any other game developer want to associate their games with such an iconic phrase? It‚Äôs simply not possible that nobody at any of these three major video game companies had ever heard of the original ‚ÄúSands of Time‚Äù game. That was one of the most popular titles of the sixth console generation.

Advertisement

Does anyone understand how this could have happened? Anyone?

We‚Äôre just going to go ahead and assume that each game has some sort of time-travel element too, but why would these publishers do that? How could all three of them possibly use this mechanic in an inventive way?

Advertisement

Please don‚Äôt take our confusion as negativity, gamers. These are huge announcements for some of the most popular franchises in video game history. We‚Äôre talking about a new Metal Gear Solid, a series long thought dead since Kojima‚Äôs departure from Konami. And new titles in Mario and Grand Theft Auto? This is incredibly exciting stuff. All we‚Äôre saying is that it‚Äôs kind of incomprehensible why any single one of them would choose to have a title that had already been used 17 years ago.

We reached out to programmers at Nintendo, Rockstar, and Konami about it, but they refused to respond and seemed genuinely angry that we questioned this baffling decision.

Advertisement

Are they fucking with us?

Seriously, gamers, if anyone knows what the hell is going on here please let us know. Maybe there‚Äôs some sort of movement to establish ‚ÄúSands of Time‚Äù as its own video game genre subset that we don‚Äôt know about? Or for some reason, all future video ga mes will be named after Prince Of Persia games or Jake Gyllenhaal films? Whatever the truth is, we‚Äôre confused but prepared to enjoy these awesome new games alongside the just announced Prince of Persia: The Origami King.

Title: Microsoft Has Revealed Master Chief‚Äôs Teeth And They Are Filthy
Text:
In a jaw-dropping reveal at the Onion Gamer‚Äôs Expo that‚Äôs almost 20 years in the making, Microsoft just teased Halo Infinite by giving gamers their first-ever glimpse of Master Chief‚Äôs teeth, and let‚Äôs just say that these things are absolutely filthy!

Xbox fanboys, looks like your dreams of getting an up-close-and-personal look at the Chief are finally being fulfilled‚Äîand his dental hygiene is more upsetting than anyone could have ever predicted.



Ever since we stepped foot into the legendary Spartan‚Äôs MJOLNIR armor way back in 2001 with Halo: Combat Evolved, the single-player campaigns have always left us with the same tantalizing question: What was going on inside that helmet? Well, with this sneak peek at the yellowed, cavity-ridden teeth inside of Master Chief‚Äôs mouth, we‚Äôre finally getting an answer, albeit a viscerally disturbing one that none of us specifically requested.



Of course, there is a distinct satisfaction to looking over the Chief‚Äôs gingivitis-plagued gum line and impacted molars and realizing this is the Spartan who saved the human race from the Covenant. But as rewarding as it is for fans to finally take a gander at the pieces of decayed meat caught up in his bleeding gums and crooked teeth, all of this just raises more tantalizing questions: ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt Master Chief ever brush his teeth?‚Äù; ‚ÄúHas he considered braces for those repulsive things?‚Äù; and ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt he bothered by his apparently severe halitosis while he‚Äôs cooped up inside that metal suit?‚Äù

At the very least, this answers how the hero known as John-117 managed to avoid seeing a dentist even once as he fought countless battles against the Flood, as well as giving gamers a great reminder of how important regular visits with their dental hygienists are. Plus, getting this close to the Chief‚Äôs mouth‚Äîno matter how repulsive‚Äîjust makes us more excited than ever to get our hands on Halo: Infinite! Here‚Äôs hoping it‚Äôs worth the wait.

Until then, stay tuned to OGE for all the game reveals you could ever want.

Title: Highlights Of The Onion Gamers Expo: Part 1
Text: And that‚Äôs a wrap on opening three days for our first-ever gaming conventions! Title: Gamers, Are You Not Seeing All The Olives We Left Around The Expo Hall For You? Gotta Be Like 500 Dollars Worth Here, Be A Huge Waste If No One Eats Any
Text:
So far, so good at our first-ever gaming conference! We‚Äôve witnessed some amazing panels, dream-come-true announcements, and a few moments that surprised even us. Still, there‚Äôs one small detail that‚Äôs been irking us. Gamers, are you not seeing all the olives we left around the expo hall for you? There are, like, $ 500 worth here, and it‚Äôd be a huge waste if no one scooped them up and tried a few.



Advertisement

We left all of these olives out for you, guys! So really, feel free to have at ‚Äô em!

Look, readers, we thought this would be a nice treat for everyone, so it‚Äôs just a bit of a bummer that we scattered these olives around the convention center and nobody is even picking them up to try a little nibble. Now, it‚Äôs possible no one has noticed them, but we really tried to make sure that wasn‚Äôt the case. There are olive on tables, some are on the floor, some are in baskets. Anywhere you look, there are olives.

Advertisement

These aren‚Äôt some cheap prepackaged olives from the grocery store, either. Maybe that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre worried about? We went to a nice cheese store and picked them up before the show. We‚Äôre talking green and black. Even a few stuffed with blue cheese. Please understand, that‚Äôs hundreds of dollars from our pockets down the drain if you don‚Äôt even take a little nibble.

Come on, gamers, why are you stepping over them like they‚Äôre trash? These are really great olives. Some of them are K alamatas straight from Greece, some have rosemary in the brine. There are even these spicy buffalo- flavored ones that are really nice, too. Even if you don‚Äôt want a ton of olives, you can be nice about it and just grab a couple.

Advertisement

Hell, if you really don‚Äôt like olives, all you have to do is put them on your plate, walk around with them for a little bit, and then throw them out while we aren‚Äôt looking.

Honestly, we‚Äôre a little annoyed with you right now, gamers. We sent out an email to see if anybody had dietary restrictions and no one even responded, so we were left to assume everyone was cool with olives. And now we‚Äôve basically spent 500 dollars on nothing.

Advertisement

Think about it: How would that make you feel?

Now, we will take some ownership that we should have left them in jars instead of just putting them down on the conference floor and booths. But we had this image in our head that it would set up a nice tableau, and then we just ran with it. Who knows? Maybe we got overly excited about putting olives everywhere. Either way, their brine is probably an antibacterial, so it‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs going to get you sick by just picking them up and popping one in your mouth.

Advertisement

Listen, we‚Äôre not perfect. Not by a long shot. We‚Äôll admit that a pitted snack might not be the best thing for a video game conference without many trash cans. But you could have at least told us you didn‚Äôt enjoy olives before the conference started. We just wanted to do something nice for you and now you‚Äôre making us feel like jerks.

This wasn‚Äôt out of some food discretionary fund, either. All of our writers pooled their own money in a little manila envelope labeled ‚ÄúOLIVES‚Äù because we thought it would be a great reward for our attendees. Instead, we‚Äôre going to have to pack them up in Tupperware containers at the end of the day and take them home.

Advertisement

Jeez. Thanks a lot, guys.

Title: Come On, Man: Representatives From CD Projekt Red Are Completely Hogging All The Controllers At The Booth Where You Can Try Out ‚ÄòCyberpunk 2077‚Äô Even Though It‚Äôs Their Own Game
Text:
You know what, OGN readers? We‚Äôve seen some pretty unprofessional behavior before in the gaming industry, but this really takes the cake. There is a whole line of playable demo stations for Cyberpunk 2077 at the Onion Gamer Expo right now, but the reps from CD Projekt Red have been hogging every single one of them this whole time even though it‚Äôs their own game.

Advertisement

Look, we‚Äôre just going to say it: This is total bullshit.

After a week of exclusive previews and gameplay teasers, we were unbelievably pumped to finally get our hands on CD Projekt Red‚Äôs sprawling new science-fiction RPG. Unfortunately, just as we were about to grab a controller to jump into the neon-lit wonder of Night City, a dozen Projekt Red employees barged through the door, commandeered every single one of the controllers, and haven‚Äôt stopped playing for the past 30 minutes. They didn‚Äôt even seem to care that there was a massive line of fans who had been waiting for hours to catch a glimpse of the new perk trees and stealth mechanics over their shoulders. Goddamnit.

Advertisement

What‚Äôs worse is that we have repeatedly and respectfully asked their designers and coders to step aside and let someone else play, stressing that they must have playtested the game thousands of times by now over the five-year development cycle. But they just either outright ignored us or laughed in our face! It‚Äôs unbelievable. There are signs mounted everywhere that say ‚ÄúLimit 15 Minutes‚Äù‚Äîsigns that they mounted themselves‚Äîand these pricks don‚Äôt even seem to care.

Jesus Christ, one of them just quit out of the game entirely so she could boot up Celeste. That‚Äôs not what this booth is for, you jerks! C‚Äômon!

Advertisement

Well, we are calling it, this is fucking unacceptable, gamers. This is our expo and we want to play Cyberpunk, or at least watch it without Mike Pondsmith deliberately obstructing our view. If CD Projekt Red wants to thumb their noses at the rules and act like a bunch of spoiled assholes, they will pay the price. We‚Äôre calling the expo manager to get these assholes off the consoles and let everyone else gets a chance.

And by the way CD Projekt? We are panning the shit out of your game if you ever actually manage to release it.

Title: Yikes: A Severely Overweight, Dead-Eyed Shigeru Miyamoto Showed Up To Our Gaming Festival 2 Days Late With His Eyebrows Shaved Off And Is Now Silently Wandering Around
Text:
Strap in, gamers, because this is a weird one. Two days after our staff expected him, a severely overweight, dead-eyed Shigeru Miyamoto just showed up to the Onion Gamer Expo with his eyebrows shaved off, and he is now silently wandering around the convention hall.



Advertisement

Oof. We really don‚Äôt know what to make of this.

See, Mr. Miyamoto, the legendary game designer for Nintendo, was originally scheduled to give a presentation on the main stage earlier this week. As abiding fans of everything he‚Äôs contributed to the history of video games, we were all really excited by a rumor that he might be making a big announcement about an upcoming Mario game. He didn‚Äôt show up, though, and we didn‚Äôt hear anything from him or his representatives about where he was. Ultimately, we assumed he had canceled due to an illness.

Advertisement

Flash forward to today, spectators at the Cyberpunk 2077 demonstration noticed an unhealthily obese, middle-aged Japanese man standing completely still in the middle of the Marvel‚Äôs Avengers tent, emptily staring at an exit sign. We didn‚Äôt recognize him at first, but after taking a second look, we realized, dear God, that‚Äôs Shigeru Miyamoto, and he looks like he‚Äôs in horrible shape.

What the hell is going on, gamers?

Our first concern wasn‚Äôt that he had missed delivering Monday‚Äôs exclusive OGE Nintendo Direct. The more pressing thing was that Miyamoto appeared to be eating from a three-pound sack full of pistachios while repeatedly muttering the word ‚Äúliars‚Äù under his breath in a near-catatonic state. His shirt is completely stained and rumpled, and, well, let‚Äôs just say he doesn‚Äôt smell great. It‚Äôs like a combination of rubbing alcohol and really badly burnt clay‚Äîit makes you gag a little just getting a whiff from far away.

Advertisement

After overcoming our distress, we tried to approach the designer behind The Legend Of Zelda and Super Mario and ask what he thought of the conference, and he just said, ‚ÄúMaybe I will‚Äîmaybe I fucking will‚Äîsee how they feel about it‚Äù before wandering off to the Epic Games booth, where he‚Äôs now just glaring at Tim Sweeney and breathing loudly. We‚Äôre really scared, and we‚Äôre not sure why.

Readers, should we call an ambulance or something?

Either way, we‚Äôll keep an eye on him for you, and let you know if there are any updates. Suffice it to say, it doesn‚Äôt look like we‚Äôre getting bonus DLC for Super Mario Odyssey or a new 3DS version of Mario Party anytime soon, and what this means for the future of Nintendo in the next generation is anyone‚Äôs guess.

Title: Mother Fucker: Cliff Bleszinski Just Made Off From Our Conference With 10,000 Free EA Games Pens
Text:
Well, gamers, unfortunately it‚Äôs time for some pretty infuriating news. We were super excited when Gears Of War and Unreal creator Cliff Bleszinski decided to grace our Onion Gamer‚Äô s Expo with his presence, but then this son of a bitch just took off with 10,000 of our free EA Games pens!



Advertisement

Go dd ammit, what a complete asshole!

As one of the many truly unique facets of the OGN g aming c onference, we were able to partner with EA Games to give each of our attendees a free pen bearing the video game developer‚Äôs logo completely free of charge. When Cliff Bleszinski first arrived he took three or four of them‚Äî a reasonable amount of pens that should satisfy the average person. But it‚Äôs apparently not enough for the greedy prick. Advertisement

We were under the impression that Bleszinski was excited to talk to an audience about his design philosophy with the Gears franchise and maybe sign a few copies , but when it came time for the panel we scheduled, he was peeling out from the parking lot cackling to himself with a van full of our precious EA Games pens.

Cliff Bleszinski, you unconscionable bastard!

What‚Äôs disappointing is this was one of the main points of promotion for this conference. We paid an ungodly amount for targeted ads to gamers that read ‚Äú Come to the OGE and receive a free white EA Games click pen!‚Äù Now we‚Äôre left wondering if the only reason why Bleszinski agreed to the conference in the first place was so he could sneak behind our booth to steal boxes of pens while the security guard wasn‚Äôt looking.

Advertisement

Given that he took every pen we had, it‚Äôs hard to tell if this was simply an act of Machiavellian self-interest or some kind of declaration of war against our conference itself. You have to assume that he has the money to buy 10,000 pens if he wants. But why would someone need this many pens? Maybe he intends to offload them to a fence who can sell them on the black market.

Regardless of the reason, this is a huge dick move.

Christ, sorry you had to find out like this, gamers. But Cliff Bleszinski is the true scum of the Earth for taking off with all 10,000 of our EA Games pens, and we also sincerely apologize that nobody else will get the opportunity to have a free pen. We know it comes as a huge disappointment, but you‚Äôll have to make do with the free EA Games bouncy balls and coasters while we all wish that Cliffy B would go straight to hell.

Title: N.Y. Jets Sued For Millions After Using Unlicensed Cheering Sounds From Other Teams
Text:
FLORHAM PARK, NJ‚ÄîDecrying the blatant lifting of audio files for in-stadium noise during quarantine, the New York Jets were sued for millions Friday following the franchise‚Äôs unlicensed use of other team s‚Äô cheering sounds. ‚ÄúIt is obvious to any listener these sounds of joy and applause were not created by the New York Jets football team,‚Äù said Eric Jarvis, an attorney representing several organizations including the Ravens and Seahawks, who claimed the damaged parties had never given permission for the sound of their fans cheering for touchdowns and celebrating interceptions to be used by the Jets. ‚ÄúThe Packers and my other clients have worked hard to generate these outpourings of celebratory sound, and for the Jets to lift them like this is outrageous. People that hear this might get the idea that fans support this team, and that is an outright lie. In fact, these sounds being played during Jets games cheapen the entire act of cheering itself , as well as directly harming the value of these franchises and the NFL.‚Äù At press time the Jets‚Äô legal team had failed to show at court after accidentally locking themselves out of their office, losing their cell phones, and then inadvertently burning the building down while trying to break back in.

As you‚Äôll soon see, there are all kinds of testimonies and other documents proving definitively that officials knowingly engaged in‚Äîno, not this, how did this bath towel get in here? Now where are my potato peels? Sirs of the jury, I submit here for legal questioning and subsequent arrest and execution whichever culprit took my potato peels. I have probable cause! But first I submit these hockey pucks, and if you ignore the bite marks, it‚Äôs unmistakable that they‚Äîwait, excuse me, these are the wrong hockey pucks. Objection!
